results.description:
Citymart works with cities to design innovation challenges that invite the best solutions from business and society. We help cities access the contributions of their own citizens and entrepreneurs to find proven and innovative solutions addressing the pressing needs of urban areas, such as efficient transportation, quality public spaces, sustainability, effective social services, robust commerce and tourism. We invite you to join our network of problem solvers and learn more about opportunities to partner with our global network of cities.

Agenda 

8:30-8:40am:  Breakfast and Networking

8:40 -8.45am: Welcome, Civic Hall

8:45-8:55am:  Bringing Innovation to New York City Government, Jeff Merritt, Director of Innovation, NYC Mayor’s Office of Technology and Innovation  

8:55-9:00am: Q & A with Jeff Merritt

9:00-9:15am:  What is Citymart? Sascha Haselmayer, CEO, Citymart

9:15-9:20am: Q & A

9:20-9:30am:  Citymart Open opportunities in Global Cities, Nina Robbins, Project Manager, Citymart

9:30-9:50am:   Breakout Activity

9:50-10:00am: Wrap up

results.description:
Women helping women train to find their inner warrior ! Walking can do so much more for you then get you from point A to B. It's a great way to tone up and increase your fitness and health.

My passion is CrossFit and Spartan Obstacle course racing and helping people improve their health and wellness. With the support and comraderie of other women of all fitness levels , we come together to walk and add in moderate intervals of body movement workouts as we power through the beautiful scenery of Tibbets Brook Park.

Women of all fitness levels, shapes and sizes can see in a few short weeks the amazing changes in their bodies ! Let's get in a powerful walk and chat about nutrition and relieve alittle stress and make our bodies stronger !! Who knows you may want to sign up for a local mud run with me!!!
results.name: Yonkers Walking Warriors

results.description:
This is an intermediate strenuous,  hike: 10 miles long, hilly and should take us 3.5 hours. we will take the blue 2 yellow 2 orange to white 2 blue back down 2 car just after a refreshing swim at the lake

please do not forget to bring sunblock, shades, bug spray, a noodle  paddles, kickboard, snorkel, goggles, pull buoy, or flippers, I will be bringing a water polo ball to toss around and have some fun.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT

results.description:
Note registration is NOT here, but at http://www.africaopendata.net/register

-------

Open data is a new public resource that is transforming communities and nations across the world.  It is driving innovation, investment, and job growth; revolutionizing transportation, health, education, and agriculture, civic engagement, IT innovation, and government transformation.


This conference is designed to bring together African governments, businesses, and communities with international aid organizations, foundations, and other interested parties to improve local, national, and regional investment, growth and economic development.  Full details and schedule are available.


Please join us as we work together to develop Africa with open data.


Attend to find out more about how:


• Cities are using open data to rationalize public transport, reducing costs and improving services. 

• Nations are publishing raw weather and census data, providing business with access to new markets and just-in-time inventory forecasting based on weather patterns. 

• Governments are leveraging open data to increase internal information sharing, improve supply chain efficiency, reduce regulatory burdens, and increase tax efficiency. 

• Farms are taking advantage of satellite open data to drive more agricultural yield, with less water, fertilizer, and pesticides, with precision agriculture. 

•  Communities are using cloud computing and low cost open data portals to collect information and develop new apps that solve local problems, communicate needs and issues, preserve languages and culture, improve education and social integration.


There is a pre-conference event for this conference (http://www.africaopendata.net/register). You are encouraged to register for both events.  Registration is free, but is required for attendance.
results.how_to_find_us: Kivukoni Rd, Dar es Salaam 9574, Dar es Salaam
results.name: Africa Open Data Conference

results.description:
Time to try something new!  Stop working at home alone, or in a Panera.  Get out and find a place where you can do your work on your own, but be around like minded people!  This is where communities are made for entrepreneurs! If you are a writer, consultant, designer, or programmer -- This is ideal for you!

 

This is not a typical meetup. This meetup is to offer you a FREE morning to work out of The CoWorking Space and understand what coworking is all about.


We have coffee, water, snacks, free parking in the back lot (unlimited hours) and on Main Street (for only 3 hours).

We have great food right around the corner and banks, atms, convenience stores and more all within your reach. So get out of your house, stop working alone and come by for a FREE day!

Besides bringing your laptop, bring business cards as you will meet others to network with in between work.


See you on our next Fun Friday!

Noelle

results.name: Desk Dating!

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change

results.description:
Hello Friends!

This week we have Matt Hooper coming to visit us!


Matt Hooper is the VP- Open Innovation and Startup Ecosystem at Barclays. Previously, he was the Managing Director of Startup NEXT NYC, and started his career in 2010 as the co-founder of Redrawn Labs before working as EIR at Casual Corp.


Matt also hosts the monthly series Live! From Tomorrow, lives in New York and has a cat named Tigger. Talk to him about Philip Roth, Tom Waits, 'The Sopranos' and hip-hop and he might not stop talking back.


We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!
results.name: Founder's Friday with Matt Hooper

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.

With Through The Lens, Adorama’s groundbreaking original series, we turned the camera on this generation’s creator class. Each week a new creator took you through the streets of New York, showing you the city through their lens. You’ve listened to them talk about their passion, inspiration, and ambitions. Now get to know them even more! 

We’re giving you the opportunity to ask your favorite TTL photographer anything! There are two ways to participate: attend the live event in New York City or watch the livestream here.  There will be a Q & A session with our livestream and twitter audience during the event. Space for the live event in NYC is very limited so be sure to RSVP asap! Those in attendance will get a chance to win an autographed 11x14 print of one of the photographer’s best work. 

Share this event: https://goo.gl/CPGvKW

Trend this event:  #TTLAMA #AdoramaNYC

Click here to watch all episodes of Through The Lens.

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Come and have tea with the ladies of OneTaste! We will talk about dating, sex, desire and Orgasm (not climax, but Orgasm - we'll explain more at the event). 

Have tea, drink coffee, eat cupcakes or drink sparkling water and have a lively discussion on things that woman don't normally talk about. We will have fun, laugh and go a little deeper into areas where we normally don't go. 

Orgasmic Meditation is a simple yet profound 15-minute wellness practice that creates deep and everlasting change in mind, body, and spirit.

It's the central practice that we teach and it has touched each of us so deeply that we desire to share with as many others as possible.

Find out more about OM here: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AGMSmNMXXpU

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
This is the club's official meetup night. Currently, we are engaged in an epic campaign spanning across uncharted territories, on the fringe of the known Universe. "Cryptic and sinister ambitions sought by clandestine players behind the scenes, clash in a race for power and forbidden knowledge, drawing in a gossamer cast of characters, who aim to win at all costs, no matter the stakes! Who will unravel this allegoric enigma, and lay claim to its rapturous glory? And what unknown perils may this seductive wanderlust unleash!?" Heralds of Ruin is a 40k variation of the Kill Team rules. Armies begin at 200 points, and include every faction in the game, plus a few old chestnuts, long forgotten. Players build up and improve their forces weekly, in typical campaign setting fashion. You can find the "Heralds of Ruin" Kill Team rules here:Heralds of Ruin Kill Team Rules

,

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

• October: Raphael, Uriel

• November:  Haniel, Sandalaphon

• December: Metatron, Sariel

• January: Chamuel, Jophiel

• February: Raguel, Ariel

• March: Raziel, Zadkiel

• April: Azrael, Jeremiel

• May: Circle of all Archangels to bring balance

• June: Work with the Archangel that you are most in need of.

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

Within the Art District you can enjoy over 60 participating galleries, artist studios and restaurants joining the First Friday Art Walk (6-9 pm) every first Friday of the month. Free guided shuttle coaches pick you up at the light rail station at 10th Avenue and Osage Street and ferry you around the Art District on First Fridays between 5:30 and 10PM.

Join us this Labor Day weekend for our after work Social Fridays @ Hudson Terrace. Our group will be meeting from 6pm for happy hour specials and more!

The list for free entry will be open to our group from 6pm. Later that night we will all head to Monarch rooftop.

Hudson Terrace is one of the most popular venues here in New York! We always have a fun time there.

Mention Rory's List to the door person for free admission.

Dress code is business casual.

Don't forget to R.S.V.P for this event.

Feel free to invite your friends, colleagues, and classmates.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Do contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers

Meetup Organizer,

Rory

Want to learn how to decorate your own notebooks or make some as gifts for the upcoming holiday season? Join Hannah as she teaches you techniques to decorate four notebooks in various ways. You will walk away with four finished gifts that you can present to your friends and family; and with the knowledge to make many more. All supplies are included. You can't beat that for only $20!

Come, get ready to have fun, learn something new, and make some new friends. It'll be a night to remember!

results.description:
Did you know that there are 100’s of places in the city and beyond that offer free food like hot dogs, buffalo wings, mussels in white wine, popcorn, peanuts, bagels and lox, antipasto and so much more? There are so many free food options I created a Facebook Page devoted to the establishments that offer free food as seen here. 

This Friday, join me and a whole bunch of singles from multiple meetup groups as we hop from bar to bar to sample their free food offerings. I know you’re all psyched to gorge on free food and while that is possible, there’s a slight catch. You have to buy a drink first, but it’s not like it costs any more that it usually does. The 3 bars we will be visiting are as follows

Croxley Ales: 28 Ave. B btw E 2nd & 3rd Sts.
Free wings with drink purchase from 5-7p on Fridays 

Crocodile Lounge: 325 E 14th St. btw 1st & 2nd Ave
A free personal pizza with every drink, all the time, is just about the best you can ask for in life.

The Charleston: 174 Bedford Ave @ N 7th Street (1 stop from NYC, a 5-min ride)
More free personal pizza pies but this place makes it better 

We'll meet outside of Croxley Ales at 6pm located at 28 Ave. B btw E 2nd & 3rd Sts. We'll hang out for 20 minutes while we bond and wait for everyone to arrive. We'll spend an hour at each establishment or for as long as it takes everyone to have a drink and some of the free food that goes with it. We'll stay at the last place because it's the best with the best pizza with the cheapest drinks in the coolest neighborhood with the most beautiful people you ever saw in your life after us of course. =)   

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­

results.description:
Friday evenings are free at the MoMa. Let's meet around 6pm. The museum closes at 8 so that should give us some time to explore the museum and get to know each other. (http://www.moma.org/visit/plan/index#hours) .

Since everyone had a great time at the first trip to MoMa I'm scheduling this meetup again so others can attend too. (If you attended a previous MoMa event and want to attend again that is fine too).

(***Note this particular event falls over Labor Day weekend)


Where to Meet:

Enter the MoMA museum lobby through the main entrance on 53rd Street. Meet me near the indoor Design and Book Store gift shop entrance (see photo).

(Don't go to the MoMA Design Store across the street).

results.description:
Learn how to make a professional website using Wordpress. Excellent class for entrepreneurs and individuals interested in web development. 

~~~~~

Important note: This class is on September 4th and 5th 2015

Times: 

Friday - 6PM - 8PM

Saturday - 12PM - 6PM

Please review the following video:

https://vimeo.com/113828701

To signup and learn more:

</a><a href="http://www.startupsaturdays.net/event/make-a-business-website-with-wordpress-workshop-with-limited-space-2/"></a><a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/e/make-a-business-website-with-wordpress-workshop-with-limited-space-new-york-tickets-17904323313">http://www.eventbrite.com/e/make-a-business-website-with-wordpress-workshop-with-limited-space-new-york-tickets-17904323313

~~~~~~~

Agenda:  

~~~~~~~

On Friday (6PM-8PM) we will meet to setup your projects, install Wordpress and any other necessary components, introduce ourselves and start.

On Saturday (12PM-6PM) we will dive deep into our projects and do the following: 

1. Setup our front page

2. Integrate Social Media

3. Integrate Videos

4. Setup forms or a mailing list depending on what the class wants

5. Work with pages and posts

6. Work with plugins

7. Work with Favicon

8. Work with Parma links and learn about SEO (Search Engine Optimization)

9. Work with widgets

10. Cover the backend of Wordpress

This class is ideal for entrepreneurs, bloggers and individuals interested in becoming freelancers.

~~~~~~~~~

Click here for Blue Host.

results.description:
The Schomburg Center hosts a social networking event the first Friday evening of each month, rain or shine, from 6 pm to 10pm.


This month, the theme for First Friday @ the Schomburg will be the “Carnival” Edition, in celebration with the Caribbean Day festivities! Attendees are invited to rep their country with paraphernalia and flags. 

Enjoy signature drinks and extended viewing hours of their two current Exhibitions:

• Curators Choice: Black Life Matters, and

• The 75th Anniversary of the American Negro Theatre

The host for the Night will be Humble Prince from Sahara FM, and your deejays for the night will be DJ Trini & DJ Craig in the Langston Hughes Lobby and DJ Kwiss in the courtyard.

Suggested donations are welcome and sign up for a Schomburg membership is always encouraged.


Our Meetup


We'll meet in the Langston Hughes lobby where the music will be playing. There will be a drink table with a HarlemGo Meetup sign to gather there.

Please find me (Daniel) at the HarlemGo drink table. I, as well as others, will be wearing a "GO" name tag (similar to the image above) on the front of my jacket/shirt, and name tags will be given out to identify other members. 

Many of the library and NYPL staff and executives attend the Schomburg Center's First Fridays events, as well as a wide variety of professionals from many backgrounds and industries. Definitely a good social & networking opportunity!

Post-First Fridays Drinks at Ginny's Supper Club

Afterwards, we'll head down to Ginny's Supper Club at Red Rooster
(www.ginnyssupperclub.com) to keep the good spirits going with a nightcap of drinks at the bar, socializing and dancing. Making a dinner reservation at Ginny's is strongly suggested for those that may want to grab a bite after the Schomburg event.

We'll arrive at Ginny's around 9:30pm and will end the meetup there officially at 11pm. If you can't make the Schomburg event, feel free to meetup with us there, and anyone is welcome to stay as long as they'd like.

Ginny's Supper Club is located on the downstairs level of Red Rooster
(www.redroosterharlem.com), 310 Lenox Avenue, between 125th & 126th Streets. 

As always, if you're running late, need further directions, or have any questions, please give Daniel a call/text to 774.275.3646.

Directions to The Schomburg Center:

Train: Take the #2 or #3 trains to 135th Street. The Schomburg entrance is between 135th & 136 streets, on Malcom X Blvd. (Lenox Avenue).
Bus: Catch either the M7 or M102 to 135th Street and Malcolm X Blvd.

About The Schomburg Center

The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, a research unit of The New York Public Library, is generally recognized as one of the leading institutions of its kind in the world. For over 80 years the Center has collected, preserved, and provided access to materials documenting black life, and promoted the study and interpretation of the history and culture of people of African descent.
results.name: First Fridays @ The Schomburg Center & Ginny's (Red Rooster) After

Time to breath, and leave the stress and the worries behind.

Combing the best of both worlds; Yoga and Pilates. Yogalates/Core Yoga: A blend of the meditative flow and the breathing techniques of yoga, with the controlled movements of Pilates will leave you feeling energized yet relaxed while you strengthen, tone, tighten, and firm the body.

With Rama, read his bio on our website

Friday's at 6:30pm


First time at the Studio?  Yippy!  Members of this MeetUp group can get a significant discount discount of just $10.00!  You can do so by Rsvp-ing here, and then going onto to our facebook page,  and "like" us then simply RSVP there under the latest post for your class choice.  That's it!  Good for all classes on our schedule except Pre-natal yoga, and Tango.

You want a highly-academic, highbrow tour of the Metropolitan Museum of Art where we stand before the great masters, contemplating their skilled use of line and form, while simultaneously placing them in the pantheon of other art historical geniuses, right?

You picked the wrong tour.

Welcome to Museum Hack VIP, our premiere museum experience.

Perfect for a date night, an evening with friends or a capstone to a New York City visit, our famous VIP tour guides will show you the secrets, backstories and hidden nooks and crannies of the Greatest Fucking Museum on Earth.

This “by New York City residents, for New York City residents” tour will show you the Met like you have never seen it before. 

*Please remember that this Meetup listing may not have accurate information - the people who have RSVPed may not have PAID/SIGNED UP. Please check attached link for the most accurate details!
results.name: Not Your Ordinary Museum Tour - VIP and Wine

results.description:
“First Friday” is a casual evening for drinks and socializing.  Pranna Restaurant has high and open ceilings with a trendy atmosphere including a beautiful light colored décor and box shaped tables.  Food is inspired by Southern Asia (including Thai, Vietnam, India) - appetizer / finger food or full dinner.  Pranna has some signature drinks, standard bar, nice variety of wine by the glass and variety beer (draft and bottled).  Come join the party and meet current and prospective members.

Note, August the group was moved to the Basement 'private club' space.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us in the bar area and ask the host desk.  I will try to arrive early and get a table near the entrance (near the front windows).

results.description:
Let's savor Sichuan specialties at Savour Sichuan, the sister restaurant of La Vie en Szechuan.  Join us for a spicy feast at Midtown's newest Sichuan restaurant.  

Dinner will be family-style.  Everyone will pay an equal share of the final food bill, including tax and tip, and pay an additional $1 toward the Meetup Organizer dues.  (It is free to be a Meetup member, but not to be a Meetup organizer.)  Cash only.  Estimated cost per person is $25-35.  You will pay for your own drinks and individual desserts, if any.  

Only RSVP if you plan to attend.  If your plans change, please update your RSVP to Not Going. 

Do not RSVP if you do not want to eat real spicy Sichuan food. 

By attending, you agree to be responsible for your own dietary restrictions, allergies, health and general welfare.
results.name: Savour Sichuan

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge
results.name: SPANISH CULTURE & CONVERSATION WORKSHOPS (BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATE)

results.description:
Presents

The Poetry of Giovanni Meli

https://staticapp.icpsc.com/icp/loadimage.php/mogile/3549/50565096eb6b179a38c6584b7e692803/image/jpeg

Presented by

Prof. Gaetano Cipolla

You are cordially invited to attend a special program at the Italian American Museum <a>this Friday evening</a>, September 4th.  Professor Gaetano Cipolla will present "The Poetry of Giovanni Meli", volume XIV of the successful series “Pueti d’Arba Sicula/Poets of Arba Sicula.” The goal of the series is to present the best poetry written in Sicilian as a way of introducing the Sicilian soul to the English-speaking community. The poets are the best ambassador of a people and it is through their voices that Sicily speaks to the world.

Giovanni Meli is undoubtedly the greatest Sicilian poet of all time. Professor Cipolla who has already translated Meli’s Origini di lu munnu, Favuli morali, Don Chisciotti and Sanciu Panza as well as many other single poems, has assembled an impressive anthology that includes most of his Odes, a sampling of the Buccolica and many other poems never translated before. This 356-page bilingual anthology (with the Sicilian and English translation on the same page) offers readers a wonderful opportunity to marvel at the breadth of Meli’s interests and the depth of his learning, while savoring his wit, charm and wisdom. Giovanni Meli was called the “perfect Sicilian poet” by his French translator because he embodied the best of Sicilian values.  Meli’s poetry is a must for anyone who wants to understand Sicilian culture.

<a>Friday, September 4th, 6:30 P.M.</a>

Italian American Museum

<a>155 Mulberry Street</a>

(Corner of Grand and Mulberry Streets)

<a>New York, NY 10013</a>

Suggested donation of $10 per person

RSVP Code: Meli0904

***************************************************************

We can eat after at a local restaurant like we have done after so many other meetups at the Italian American Museum

results.description:
MEETING DETAILS SENT OUT 12 NOON  THURSDAY. IF YOU DO NOT RECEIVE, CHECK SPAM, SEND ME AN E-MAIL IMMEDIATELY , DON'T POST A COMMENT, WITH YOUR PERSONAL E-MAIL ADDRESS AND I WILL RESEND.

RSVP'S CLOSED



PLEASE READ THIS CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU RSVP. I SUBSCRIBE TO THE RADICAL VIEW THAT IF YOU RSVP FOR A MEETUP EVENT, YOU SHOULD SHOW UP. 

I have done variations of this hike during the day-but not at night-until now.

If you are not going away this Labor Day holiday weekend, join me and AMC Club members who do not have to RSVP on a fun but fast paced hike as we explore Vinegar Hill, Dumbo, Brooklyn Bridge Park and then make our way over Brooklyn Bridge ending up at the Fulton Transit Center in Manhattan-which is almost an event onto itself. There are always surprises along the way. On a few occasions, we will stop very briefly to talk about what we observe. There should be great views and many interesting things to see.

WE WILL BEGIN BEFORE 6:45 P.M. BE READY TO GO.

NO FOOD STOPS. EAT BEFORE WE MEET.

MEETING DETAILS WILL BE SENT BY E-MAIL TO THOSE WHO RSVP THE EVENING BEFORE THE HIKE. 

Please consider joining the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) http://www.amc-ny.org/ The Club offers many hikes, walks and events and is also active in conservation efforts and trail maintenance. Only a few of the many hikes and walks that are offered by AMC leaders are posted on Meetup. 

Since this event will be posted as a last minute hike to AMC Club members, there is NO need for AMC club members to RSVP for this-unless you don’t get last minute e-mails from Yahoo. (Contact me if you are a dues paying AMC Club member and don’t get these e-mails and I’ll tell you how). 

Let’s leave 10 spaces for AMC Meetup members. Needless to say, please take the RSVP process seriously and be considerate. If you have been a NO SHOW on any previous AMC Meetup events that I have led or are a chronic abuser of the RSVP process –see your Attendance History- please do not sign up for this event because I am just going to delete your RSVP. Let someone else go who will actually show up. PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO THOSE WHO HAVE PREVIOUSLY ATTENDED OTHER AMC MEETUP EVENTS.

 I am going to ask that people not post any comments or questions prior to the event. You have more than enough information to do this once you get the meeting details. No offense, but I don’t need to know-and probably neither does anyone else- what you are doing that day if you can’t make it or what you think the weather will be. AFTER the event, post as many comments and photos as you like.

If the weather forecast is really bad, See the Accuweather website like I do, I will post a notice on the day of the hike by 4:00 P.M. If there is no notice, we go. We will finish around 10:00 p.m in Lower Manhattan.
results.name: Sunset Hike–Over the Brooklyn Bridge, Brooklyn Bridge Park, Dumbo, Vinegar Hill

About the film:

Winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the 2009 Sundance Film Festival, "We Live In Public" tells the story of the effect the Internet is having on our society as seen through the eyes of the greatest Internet pioneer you've never heard of -- visionary Josh Harris.

Award-winning director, Ondi Timoner, documents Harris' tumultuous life for more than a decade, creating a riveting, cautionary tale of what to expect as the virtual world inevitably takes control of our lives.

Roger Ebert gave the film four stars, his highest rating, and wrote, "This is a remarkable film about a strange and prophetic man."

The film runs 86 minutes and will be followed by mingling and a moderated discussion.

Approximate timeline for the night:


7pm - Arrival & mingling

7:30pm - Film starts


9pm - Short moderated discussion breaking out into smaller discussion groups


Directions  & Parking:

The coffee house we've graciously been offered as a venue is located inside the Union Train station, near Kean University. It's in an unmarked building, so it might be tough to spot from a distance. To help you find it, here's what it looks like from down the street.

In addition, here is an overhead map to help you get your bearings and familiarize yourself with the area.

If you're driving to the event, you can park in any open spot at no charge. At this hour, there is no parking enforcement.

If you are taking the train, the venue is right inside the Union Train station, which is on the Raritan Valley Line. Here's an NJ Transit Map of the rail system to help you figure out if taking the train would be convenient for you.


To Find Us:

Rock'n' Joe is a cozy place. You'll see us gathered around the big pulldown movie screen on your left as soon as you walk in the front door. Grab a beverage or something to eat and come sit with us!

Please support the venue, Rock'n' Joe with a food or drink purchase (their coffee is sooo good!) so they can continue to welcome us back month after month!

results.description:
You are cordially invited to opening reception


of DAVID ZAPATKA's "Darkest of dark nights" solo show

at Adelante Gallery this Friday, 09/04, 7-9p.

When one seeks photographs of lighthouses there are usually hundreds if not thousands to choose from of almost every one in the country. Most, if not all are daytime images. Seldom do you find photographs of lighthouses from when they did their most important work-at night. With the advent of more sensitive image sensors developed over the past several years, newer cameras now allow for the emerging genre of nighttime photography.

In October 2013 the first of what has now become a series of thirty lighthouse photographs taken under specific conditions was shot at the Dutch Island Lighthouse in Rhode Island. Under clear and darkest of dark nights during monthly new moon phase,

I've since been able to capture New England lighthouses in a way not widely before seen. Through extensive research and with cooperation from Coast Guard authorities, local harbormasters and private landowners, in the past eighteen months the series called "Stars and Lights" has expanded from Rhode Island lighthouses to those throughout Southern New England.

I'm currently researching Connecticut's Long Island Sound lighthouses and will begin shooting those in the coming months as well as the remaining eastern Massachusetts lights to Provincetown.

Since the start of this project several local lighthouses have been turned off and it is my intent to venture further throughout the region and beyond to capture more before many of these iconic structures are darkened.

This project is much more complicated than simply arriving at a location and snapping a picture. One can view plenty of daytime photographs to get a more defined idea of the terrain, but once the sun sets, the area takes on a different look. Conditions one might not consider while shooting during the day include the amount of ambient light from nearby sources, i.e, streetlights; neighboring security cameras; industrial light pollution; light pollution from nearby cities.

Another compounding factor in shooting lighthouses is whether the lighthouse is land-based or water-based. For the former, gaining proper access to the property is paramount as the photography will take place in the middle of the night and arousing suspicious neighbors might be detrimental.

As for the latter, I've had a special twenty-foot aluminum tripod built to be able to shoot water-based lighthouses. Most were typically placed near shallow waters and prior to heading to these areas extensive research must be done for safety, not only for the boat but for personal safety as well. Additional compounding factors for water-based lighthouse photography are tides, wind, and sea conditions.

This project has taken on a life of its own most who view the work are intrigued by the serenity of the images taken in the middle of the night with nothing around but a wonderful setting, a beautiful lighthouse, and billions of stars. It's difficult work and the motivation is to capture as many working lighthouses that we have left before we lose too many more.
  Browse David Zapatka's work HERE.
results.name: See fantastic photographs by David Zapatka. Real thing! NOT a Photoshop!!!

Come join us for our first Friday of the month Game Night. Food, drink, fun times and good people!

We typically play party games like Apple to Apples, Cranium, Taboo and Scattegrories first and end with a charades like game called Celebrity.  If you have a group game you think people would like, please feel free to bring it.

I provide some light snacks and drinks but feel free to bring something to share with the group.  We also give out silly "prizes" to the winners so if you would like to donate to the grab bag that can work out as well!  Prizes can be a piece of candy or a silly dollar store item.

*Don't fret if you are on the waiting list. People tend to drop out (especially a day or so before) so keep on the lookout. You most likely will end up able to come!!

results.description:
The nights are cooling down, enjoy the evening watching an exciting movie about the history of running the Grand Canyon outdoors in our backyard .

One reviewer says:

It shows old original video and photos taken when the technology of movie taking was pretty rudimentary. It tells the story of adventurers and their exploits, shows photos of the boats they tried to make work, the wrecks, the successes and failures, and tells of the competition to be the first... the fastest... and eventually the race to take tourists through the canyon. It highlights the death defying adventures of early river rafters. Humorous, historic, delightful.

Bring a beach chair, a beverage of choice and money for Pizza! the two dollars is to cover the Audio video projector.

Don't forget your popcorn and candy!

results.description:
The Night Folk of Boston are coming together for an unprecedented market fair and festival, hosted by the Vampire Prince of NYC. In the wake of the Avatar Storm which occurred in 2002, the 9 Traditions of Magick are finding their feet. The season is now Spring. Can your band of young Awakened establish themselves and show the Sleepers of New York a better way? Nodes, Sancta and Libraries lie unclaimed. It is only a matter of time before the Technocracy returns in force.  What destiny will your band of wizards claim?

This will be a beginner's chronicle for Mage: The Ascension, using the newly released backer's PDF for Mage: The Ascension 20th Anniversary Edition (and print copy which should be released shortly.) This is meant to be friendly to newcomers to Mage: The Ascension, the classic White Wolf game of urban fantasy and metaphysics. All players will be run through a prelude and no prior knowledge of White Wolf games will be needed to play. Old White Wolf hands are also welcome.

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.

Come join this wonderful on going FRIDAY EVENING co-ed (men and women) Yoga Class 7:15-8:15pm.  This is an adult yoga class for all ages and levels (if interested in children's yoga, please contact me).  Beginners are welcome and encouraged to join.  NO gym membership required.  Reiki is part of the entire class, however specifically given to each person during the quiet beginning of the class (meditation and centering) and at the end of the class during Savasana (the final pose). Each person receives Reiki during the entire class.  If you have a mat, you can bring it.  If you do not have a mat, I have some to share.  Please visit

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)

results.description:
September usually means one thing to the West Indian in New September usually means one thing to the West Indian in New York, CARNIVAL!!. While we will not be screening carnival films per se, we will be screening films from the land of carnival. This month is also the 10th Anniversary of the Trinidad & Tobago Film Festival, yet another reason to celebrate films from the twin islands. The films we will be screening - all shorts - represent a variety of genres and some of the best films coming out of T&T recently. Check them out.

Flying the Coup
by Ryan Lee
2014

The neighbourhood trouble maker and a police officer on his first day on duty reluctantly team up in order to escape Port-of-Spain during the first day of the 1990 attempted coup. They trip over each other’s personalities as they stumble to escape the chaos filled streets of the capital.

Where the Sun Sets
by Ryan Latchmansingh
2012

LUKE SINGH struggles to make ends meet working as a fisherman. Unable to provide for his sick grandmother, Luke is presented with an opportunity to make a lot of money, but the decision would come at a great cost. This film was recently released on Studio Anansi Tv.


Knockabout
by Emilie Upczak
2012

Philo, an expat detective turns to his previous partner Monique for help in solving a current high profile kidnapping case. But where this leads them is to the past, and an old rift between them regarding the disappearance of her brother, which Philo seeks to mend.

Jab in the Dark
by Robert McFarlane
2013

A security guard who works the night shift finds himself stealing from the storage containers he should be guarding. His friend coerces him into taking something from his missing brother’s container, which leads to devilish complications.


Chee$e
by Damian Marcano
2015

'CHEE$E’ - After news he's gotten Rebecca pregnant, SKIMMA (Akil Williams) comes up with a plan - he embraces a new profession: the village pot supplier. It quickly becomes evident everyone wants what he's selling -- even local rastaman OIRIS (Lou Lyons) — Skimma is faced with making some money to provide for his new child and keeping his new enterprise out of the reach of the law.

‘CHEE$E’ is directed by Damian Marcano, a native of Trinidad & Tobago. Marcano’s previous work includes, 'The Little Boy & The Ball', 'God Loves The Fighter' and 'GIANTS'. His work on the feature Award-Winning film "God Loves The Fighter” has racked up numerous prizes worldwide. ‘CHEE$E’ is a 10 episode season currently in production. As Marcano is in love with his local aesthetic, it is filmed on location, entirely in the Caribbean.

Main stars: Akil Williams (Skimma), Julio Prince (Peter) Score / Music: Cheah-Meng

Come join us!!
results.name: Watch Caribbean Films

results.description:
Dear First Friday Film friends,


As some of you know already, it’s soon going to be curtains for my film series at Piermont Library — at least, with me as host. California beckons, and I will soon be leaving my beautiful village, with a VERY big lump in my throat. But first, we have 2 more movie nights to share together.


It’s been an ENORMOUS privilege for me to produce nearly a decade’s worth of free movies on the first Friday go every month at Piermont Public Library. I have enjoyed every screening, every movie, every Q&A and every private conversation we’ve had after movies or on email. While Jessica Bowen, our wonderful librarian, and I discuss the future of this film series (we both would like it to continue), I’d like to invite you all to my last 2 film showings at Piermont Public Library.


As promised last year, I will be showing you the last 2 films in the fantastic 

Before Sunrise

 series — tracking the improbable relationship between Jesse and Céline through life. We left off last summer with the incredibly tantalizing and romantic cliffhanger ending of BEFORE SUNSET. A final film, BEFORE MIDNIGHT, was released 2 years ago and it may be even more astonishing that its two predecessors.


So next Friday, Sept 4, I’ll be screening both films in a row — with a special 6 pm start for the first film, and, courtesy of the Library and Jung Kim, the classic French cocktail Pastis both at the start of the evening, and between the two films.


Here’s the running order on Friday, Sept 4

6

pm: cocktails, and BEFORE SUNRISE (reprise)

7:30 pm: more cocktails… and the finale BEFORE MIDNIGHT

And after the movies… you will surely want to discuss all that you have seen. Our post-screening Q&As are always my favorite part of the evening.(Here’s the trailer: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=euOJkb0U8vE

 )


(Our grand finale will be Friday, October 2, and I’ll show again the VERY FIRST film we had in our series, the wonderful Stanley Tucci movie BIG NIGHT.)


So please join me Sept 4 for this special film evening. We’ll wind down the summer, and start to wind down this film series, in style!!


Thanks for making our series such a wonderful community success!


Warmly,Marc

www.marcfarre.com
results.name: Piermont Library - 1st Friday Movie

results.description:
"THE WEIR"  by Conor McPherson 
directed by Ciarán O’Reilly 

So here is Great off Off Broadway Meet up

to start the Fall. 

We are meeting @ DR2 Theater, 103 East 15th Street between Union Square East and Irving Place.

FRIDAY SEPT 4th MEETING UP ! 7:30pm -

Show time 8:00pm

Conor McPherson’s The Weir is a haunting evocative evening in the theater you will never forget. 
In a remote country pub in Ireland, newcomer Valerie arrives and becomes spellbound by an evening of ghostly stories told by the local bachelors who drink there. With a whiff of sexual tension in the air and the wind whistling outside, what starts out as blarney soon turns dark as the tales drift into the realm of the supernatural. 

Then, Valerie reveals a startling story of her own….

Preview it here:

https://youtu.be/KgSfJoVrZ5k 

Conor McPherson’s The Weir is a haunting evocative evening in the theater you will never forget.

"Conor McPherson’s The Weir provides a welcome respite from the summer heat:There’s nothing like tales of the supernatural to send chills down your spine...(It) reminds us that our memories can haunt us more powerfully than any ghosts." -The New York Post 

Superb… The intimacy of the production, gracefully directed by Ciaran O’Reilly, is a signal asset… this enticing production, provides audiences an evening in very good company indeed. –The New York Times 

Price is ONLY $ 65. 00 for ticket w my DISCOUNT

We'll Have A Section Out In The Patio With Some Decorated Palm Trees And An Indoor Reserved Section For The Group!


If you haven't been to 46 Lounge yet, your missing out. It is one of the hottest clubs in North Jersey. It has been consistently known for drawing in celebrity appearances as well as popular radio DJ's mixing there live. They have a nice dance floor and a really cool outdoor patio area to hang out at.

The DJs on Friday nights play primarily top 40, house, upbeat dance music to get you moving and grooving. We've also arranged to have a reserved section on the inside & the outside for the group that will include tables. There's normally a Bottle/Table Charge for this, but we pulled some strings for all you wonderful group members!


There Is A Cover Charge Of Only $5 Per Person When You Mention Meetup At The Door And Arrive By 10pm. Price Will Be Higher Afterwards, So Arrive Early.

Also Meetup Members Will Have Access To A Free Hot Dinner Buffet Between The Hours Of 7:30pm To 9pm!


Free Parking Before 9pm. After 9pm, There's A Charge Of $5 A Car.

Dress Code Is Business Casual: Nice Jeans Ok And Nice Shoes. Avoid Baggy Clothing & Work Boots.


Here Are All The Drink Specials Available Til 9pm:

*$3 For All Imported & Domestic Beers

* $5 For Specialty Martini's & Cocktails

* $15 For Bucket Of 6 Beers

* $15 For Sangria Or Drink Pitchers

Hope 2 See Ya There!

results.description:
RSVPs open 3 days prior to event. 

Please pay online by game time.
If you don't get the payment prompt from Meetup, you can send a paypal payment of $15 to [masked].

Friday Night Meetups begin at 8pm and end at 10:30

This evening is for Beginners-to-Intermediate. Perfect for folks new to the group. RSVPS open at 12:30 noon on Tuesdays! 

Come out, get a great workout and make new friends!!

GAME RULES:

-On serves only one REDO will be granted per player per game on first serve. (Can hit any obstacle (except lighting) and ball cannot be going out of bounds on sides) After a successful serve(s), no redos! (Beneficial to players waiting to sub in)

- NO REDOS on ceiling obstacles only on WIRE (less arguing, will speed up games)

-If each team fouls they both will cancel each other and a redo will be played immediately 

-No Net touches top or bottom (For Safety of all players)

results.description:
Jazz Lovers:

Here we go again, it's the first friday of the month so it's time for the great concert series at the Neighborhood Church of Greenwich Village at 269 Bleecker.  This month we have the up and coming Ms Simona Premazzi who is getting lots of attention from the critics and fellow musicians.  Ben Ratliff of the NY times says:


"Her composing style stays modern without ever being airless and swing-deficient, open without getting lost in harmony and sentimentality. And her soloing is special"


And her band includes Dayna Stephens, a hot hand on the tenor sax.  Further, Jeremy Pelt, the trumpet sensation, has enlisted her for his upcoming European tour.


So come and join the fun!!!  

Did I mention that it's FREEEEEEEE!.


http://www.simonapremazzi.com/

http://www.ncgvnyc.com/live/

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:

www.tennis-buffs.com

 

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.

 


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

 

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.

 

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator

results.description:
Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company to start your labor day weekend in Astoria. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every week we go to someone's apt, park, or bar.

Every Friday Night for nearly 10 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

There will be free pizza and strawberry daiquiris.

If you want to bring anything, don't burden yourself on the subway -- right by the Ditmars subway stop is a "Key Foods" supermarket, a liquor store, and a fine foods deli.  There is a Greek supermarket right nearby.


See you Friday Night.

Bill

Location? Q.E.D. A Place To Show And Tell [masked]rd Avenue Astoria, NY 11105)

Come enjoy a fun art night focused on figure drawing from a live model. No teaching or instruction, just a casual place to unwind after the work week, meet local creatives, refresh your artistic skills, or drink until you're talented! No need to be a pro, stick figures and hand-turkey’s welcome! Bring your friends or enjoy an evening of creative exploration and meeting local artists.  Bring your own materials. Some materials will be available for purchase.

twitter: @Astoria_DnDraw

results.description:
Get Your Tickets Here: https://quietevents.com/events/5-quiet-clubbing-in-the-garden-5/

Join us for our Quiet Clubbing Party at  the outdoor Studio Square Beer Garden! Drinks, food, and 3 DJs spinning at the same time to keep you singing and partying all night…Don’t like what DJ 1 is playing, you’ll have two other choices to dance and have fun to.

DJ 1 – Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop, etc
DJ 2 –  80’s, 90’s, and EDM Mashup!
DJ 3 – Hip-Hop, R&B,

Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

Never been to a Quiet Clubbing Event? Watch our YouTube video to learn why everyone is talking about it.

results.description:
ANNOUNCEMENT (This is not an actual meetup! lol)

After five full and exciting years, Out & About will be leaving the Meetup platform on Sep 4, 2015.

While Out & About is reinventing itself, we will not forget you; we had many exciting adventures, and for years we will have plenty of stories to remember and genuine friends to cherish.

It's all on you to stay in touch - Meetup organizers do not have access to members names and email.

You can email us directly and you can follow @ateliermileaway on social media (twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, G+, Facebook), or subscribe to the list (there is even a selection box for Out & About as you are special) to still be inspired to explore, to take a hike, to watch an outdoor movie, to discover a museum, to go sailing, to enjoy being a mile away.

Thanks to all who have participated, and inspired us over the last five years.

Have an amazing time, just a mile away.

Christian (cbetheuil @ gmail.com) | www.ateliermileaway.com
----------
Out & About

When Out & About closes on meetup.com, it will as if it had not existed; all the history will disappear (events, pictures, ...) - if you want to get in touch with someone, it's time to do it.
results.how_to_find_us: Take action to stay in touch

results.description:
Приглашаю на маршрут в NH с великолепными видами, альпийская зона, водопады. 2 ночевки на горе. Поднимемся до Mt Washington, посмотрим на туристический паровозик и проидем по южным вершинам.

Хожу медленно :-)

Рекомендуемый список снаряжения (кроме специального

http://www.meetup.com/Brodyaga/files/ packing_list)

 NH White Mountains

Day 1

From the Pinkham Notch parking lot -> Hermit Lake campground

Day2
...

Mt Washington, Mt Monroe, Mt Franklin, Mt Eisenhower, Mt Pierce -> Nauman Tent site

Day 3 Mt Jackson -> Webster Jackson trail-> Saco Lake Parking . Going Home

You need:

- backpacking gear

- warm clothes 
 Carpool is possible.

-----------------

Summit weather

https://www.mountwashington.org/experience-the-weather/mount-washington-weather.aspx

-----------------

Directions


Physical Address: Rt. 16, between Jackson & Gorham
Pinkham Notch, NH
GPS : N[masked]' W[masked]

<a>[masked], [masked]</a>
Directions:

The Appalachian Mountain Club's Pinkham Notch Visitor Center is on Route 16, 18 miles north of North Conway, NH and 10 miles south of Gorham, NH.

-----

If you join us for hiking (or any other event), understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation

that may happen at a planned event. It is your responsibility to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on this trip signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

Please review safety information:

http://www.meetup.com/Brodyaga/files/

results.name: Walk the Reservoir!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
Update 4 and 7mi versions: Same loop (depending on trail erosion...) as 8/30. Original loop (Michael's 4 Miler) was slightly modified due to closed trails. Gathering at 7:50, leaving at 8:00. Pace around 12:00/mile.

Start at the end of Lake surprise, and run to the deserted village (where there is a water fountain), and back. And then we'll do another 3-4 miles for those that are up for it (half road, half trails).

This is Michael's event, but please feel free to call/text Tears at[masked] on run morning if you have trouble finding us or need to change your r.s.v.p.


Note that this is a member-run meetup: no one is responsible for you but you. Your event host is not responsible for you or any injuries that could happen as you willingly run across rough terrain with roots, rocks, gullies, etc. Don't expect anyone to have first aid knowledge, supplies, or water for you. Just a bunch of like-minded people enjoying the trails together! For more details see section 6.2 of http://www.meetup.com/terms/
results.name: Run around the lake (and a bit more) - 4 miles

results.description:
Start labor day weekend with a challenging hike, hop or trail run to the Peekskill Brewery. It's our first stop in the Hudson Valley Brewery tour series.  Exploratory trail adventure: we'll divide into pace groups to read maps and route-find together to the finish with refreshments and a meal! 

Route:  Climbs and panoramic views.  ~6, 18 mi. options:
~6 miles: Start at Bear Mt Toll House trail head to Anthony's Nose and back.

For ~18 miles, optional add-on from Anthony's Nose: 
Take the blue trail to Appalachian Trail (white). Go east up to Graymoor Friary for ~6 miles out (~12 mi. RT add-on total).  Return on same route back to Bear Mt Toll House trail head.


DETAILS

Meet at: front of train station


Transport: Take Metro North train from NY Grand Central station to Peekskill then 5 min taxi (~$8) to Bear Mountain Toll House.

Cars: If people want to drive to and volunteer as designated drivers (no drinking pls.), please say so in comments section below. We can carpool, split the cost of fuel and feed the driver. The carpools can drive directly to the trailhead at Bear Mountain Toll House.

Food:  Post-run at Peekskill Brewery! Address: 47-53 South Water St., Peekskill, NY. [masked]-BEER (2337). Opens at noon. We'll toast the start of Labor Day weekend, and wish Bon Voyage to fellow group member Lyndi! 

How:  Social. Partner / form pace groups. (Co-host Rosanna will run/walk as sweeper (combo: run slowly and fast hike). Feel free to go ahead at your own pace -- just make sure you stick with your running buddy/group, and map as a guide to !


Rain or shine. Heavy rain cancels! Check comments section for updates.

Who:  Runners and brisk run-walkers. All paces are welcome!  Guests are welcome. Each person is expected to be prepared, self-sufficient, and able to find her way back to parking lot/train station. Thanks.

Groups:  Each group/partner will wait for each other at intersections, leaving no one behind. This is a good opportunity to work as a team with other local runners at your level, test map-reading skills, and to discover trails without having to do it on your own.

REQUIREMENTS

BRING

1) Download/print and carry:   

a) Taxis #'s to call on arrival at Peekskill station (to/from trail head): Bynum  [masked], Rio taxi[masked] ($8) or
Driving directions by car (links) 

b) Route directions -- text (link), turn by turn, for trail hike/run from Bear Mountain Toll House trail head to Anthony's Nose.  You will need this for route-finding with your group.  It's basically Camp Smith Trail trail to/from trail head. Total = ~6 miles* 

Optional add-on from Anthony's Nose, for ~18 miles total: 
*  Continue to the Blue trail to Appalachian Trail (white) 
*  Go east up to Graymoor Friary for ~6 miles out (~12 mi. RT total add-on). 
*  Then return on same route back to Anthony's Nose and Bear Mt Toll House trail head.

c)  Map of Harriman Bear Mountain Trails (use #119)
(for Camp Smith trail route, and optional AT add-on)

2)  Hydration backpack with enough water and fuel for a day trip (eg, Camelbak, trail mix, bars, bananas and/or dried fruit)

3) Sunblock

4)  Cash for refreshments at brewery (check site for cc accepted)

*  Note: Text on this site says 4.3 RT, but commenters here and on other sites say route is ~6 mi RT.

Weather:  Peekskill, NY

Thanks to Agnes for suggesting this event!
Comments? Want to form a carpool? Post in comments section below.

Happy trails!


_____________________________________________________


Note

This is not an organized training program. It is just a notice of activities some members are planning to do that is sent out to those who might want to join them. By choosing to join them, you agree that you are an adult over 21, and agree to the legal disclaimer. Each person is solely responsible for himself, and for following trail etiquette<a href="http://www.trailrunner.com/news/trail_etiquette.htm"></a>, laws, park rules, and park safety guidelines. Thanks!

results.description:
Arowana's Dragon Boat season runs through mid-September. 

The new members will meet up on the docks promptly approximately 30 minutes before the start time. We will require waivers to be filled out and then start with stretches followed by basic dragon boat paddling with you on land. Afterwards, we will take the boat out and paddle. No previous skill required. Arowana will provides life vests and paddles. We recommend bringing a bottle of water, sun screen and wear clothing that you will be OK getting wet, swimwear being best. Shades, gloves and hat are worn by most of our paddlers as well but are not required. Practice lasts roughly 2 hours. 

IMPORTANT NOTE: Our practices are on a first-come-first-serve basis. We may or may not be able to accommodate everyone on any given weekend, and there may be a waiting list on the event. Please update your responses if your plans change so that we may make space for those on the wait list.


PLEASE NOTE EARLY SEASON PADDLING WILL BE COLD, BRING A WATERPROOF JACKET!

Sometimes we grab lunch afterward in Flushing, you are welcome to join us.

This series of Meetups is catered to introduction to dragon boat. Our veteran members will be paddling alongside you as well. If you like'd to be added to our team mailing list, please ask Lin or Selene for additional details. 

Arowana will be participating in The New York Hong Kong Dragon Boat Festival in Corona Park this August and possibly other races during the course of the year.

When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.
