results.description:
This meetup is FULL, please send me a message if you'd like to do the same trip on Sunday or Monday.

On Saturday we are going to the North-South Lake Campground in Catskills. It is time to hike and run on some real mountains!


I can pick you up in NYC and we'll carpool all together in our RawMobile. As you can see, the number of spots is very limited, so first come first serve. The details about pick up and drop off are below. To reserve a spot just RSVP to this meetup.


Our recent day trips to the Catskills were awesome, so we're doing it again. Some folks were running, some were hiking, but all had fun and made new friends. Check out our photos and comments from the past trips.


There are lots of ways to enjoy a day at North-South Lake Campground, but the main point of interest to us is probably the famous Escarpment Trail. If you have never heard of this trail, take a look here: http://escarpmenttrail.com/ This is one of the most beautiful places for hiking and trail running in New York state.

Here is a video from the 2013 Escarpment  Trail race:

https://vimeo.com/71310538

Please note that we are not doing the entire trail (if you really want to do all 19 miles, let me know and we'll figure out how to set it up). Also, if you're interested on doing this trip on Sunday, let me know. 

I  will get you there and back and will take care of the day pass to the campground, and also we'll have lots of fruit and bottled water for everyone. We'll also have few picnic/beach  blankets. 

We will start hiking/running at North-South lake campground. I suggest doing about 5 miles of the trail (to the crashed airplane, or maybe a bit further), and then turning around. I will be staying at the back of the group, and faster hikers/runners can go ahead of us if they want to.


The beauty of this plan is that it's impossible to get lost. The trail is VERY EASY TO FOLLOW (it is well-marked with blue markers) so you can go at your own pace and turn around when you feel like it. Just be sure to get back on time before we leave (5pm sharp).


You are welcome to hike with anyone else in the group, but all abilities are welcome and everyone can enjoy this trail at their own pace.  The trail is rugged and at times very steep. Please prepare accordingly. There is no any water on the trail, so be sure to have enough with you. On weekends there are lots of people hiking there, so we certainly won't be alone there.

Other activities that you might choose to enjoy during our trip to the campground:


- hiking around the lake,


- visiting scenic spot of Mountain House,


- renting a boat (availability might be limited),


- lake swimming (in the designated area),


- suntanning and enjoying the beach.

More information about the campground is here: http://www.dec.ny.gov/outdoor/24487.html


Map of the campground is here: http://www.dec.ny.gov/docs/permits_ej_operations_pdf/northsouthlake2015.pdf

There are nice showers and bathrooms right by the beach (which is also our parking area and starting/finishing point of the hike/run). There are also picnic areas with tables and benches all around the beach.



What to bring (optional):

Towel, clean clothes, flip-flops, gels, your favorite snack, map, insects repellent, rain jacket.


You will be able to leave your extra stuff in the car if needed.


Pick up/Drop off:

The main point of the pick up is bus station by GW Bridge (at 8 am sharp!). To get there you can take A train (to 175th street). 


The drive takes just over 2 hours, we'll leave NYC at 8am, get to the lake shortly after 10am, run, eat, enjoy the beach, and head out back to the city by 5pm. We'll be back in NYC shortly after 7pm.

If you don't need a ride, then just come over to the campground and meet us there, no need to RSVP here.


Bad weather cancels the trip! Please check this meetup for the updates a day before.

Cell reception: T-mobile doesn't work there. AT&T mostly does work. Not sure about the others.


Time to go to the mountains!

Legal Disclaimer

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Level: Strenuous

Miles: 8.5

Elevation: 2200


Duration : 5.5 hours


• SINCE THIS WILL BE A CAR TO CAR TREK, WE NEED TO MEET FIRST AT THE PARKING LOT TOWARDS THE END OF FOX HOLLOW RD. IN SHANDAKEN. ZIP 12480. GPS MAPS BROUGHT ME RIGHT TO IT. FROM THER WE'LL DECIDE WHAT CARS WE'LL NEED TO TAKE TO THE BEGINNING TRAILHEAD ON RT.47.

•  GPS COORDINATES AND THE FOX HOLLOW ADDRESS ARE APPROXIMATE.

The various viewpoints at Giant Ledge offer a comprehensive vista of most of the major Catskills peaks.

  Hike description. Continue along the Giant Ledge-Panther-Fox Hollow Trail gives you the opportunity to climb Panther Mountain, enjoy several views along the ridge and then travel down through Fox Hollow for a total hike of just under eight and a half miles.

 This gets the majority of the climbing out the way in the first three or so miles and allows for a pleasant ridge walk across Panther and then a long descent into Fox Hollow.  It also reduces the vertical climb required (the Giant Ledge Trailhead is located at a higher elevation) and leaves the steepest sections of trail for the descent. From the Giant Ledge Trailhead to the Fox Hollow Trailhead, the total hiking distance is 8.2 miles.  The elevation difference between the Giant Ledge Trailhead at the summit of Panther is about 1400 feet and the descent from the summit of Panther Mountain to the Fox Hollow Trailhead is about 2200 feet for a total gain and loss of 3600 vertical feet in this hike.  

Due to the steep climbs to Giant Ledge, to the summit of Panther and the descent into Fox Hollow, this is a strenuous hike, especially when considering the distance covered.   Begin at the Giant Ledge Trailhead.  Here the yellow blazed Phoenicia - East Branch Trail, descending down County Route 47 leaves the road turning east and beginning to climb to the notch between Slide Mountain to the south and Giant Ledge to the north.  After crossing a small bridge near the road, the trail ascends slightly, passing a kiosk and a trail register (be sure to sign in ).  Past the kiosk the trail becomes steeper and begins to climb to the notch.

For the next 0.6 miles the trail ascends steadily in moderate to strenuous grade.  The trail then begins to level off before reaching the trail junction with the blue blazed Giant Ledge-Panther-Fox Hollow Trail.  For the Giant Ledge and Panther Hike, turn left here.  Ahead the Phoenicia East - Branch Trail begins descending and about 2.7 miles reaches the Woodland Valley State Campground.

After turning on to the Giant Ledge-Panther-Fox Hollow Trail, the trail, gently at first, begins climbing to Giant Ledge.  The trail quickly becomes steeper and the climb more strenuous.  After about three quarters of a mile, the first view of Giant Ledge is reached (about 1.45 miles from the trailhead).  Giant Ledge is not a single "giant" ledge, but a series of openings on a long escarpment that offers views to the southeast, east and northeast.  There are at least three outstanding viewpoints in short order.

Passing the views of Giant Ledge, the descends slightly to the col between Giant Ledge and Panther Mountain in just less than a mile.  From the col, the trail climbs steeply once again, passing another view on the shoulder of Panther before reaching the summit at 1.85 miles from Giant Ledge (and 3.3 miles from the trailhead).  .

<a></a>

<a></a>

<a>http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-DuRjhHvptNc/U_DU3rhH0YI/AAAAAAAABLo/VezyDOtgSYI/s1600/IMG_1473.JPG</a>;

View from near the summit of Panther From the summit, the trail follows the ridgeline of Panther Mountain while slowly descending.  It is a very pleasant, high altitude walk with occasional obstructed vistas through the trees.  About 2 miles north from the summit (roughly 5.3 miles from the trailhead), there is the last vista on the Panther ridgeline.  From this point the trail begins to descend more steeply and then very steeply descends as its drops off the shoulder of Panther Mountain into Fox Hollow.   This is a steep descent, especially after almost 6 miles of hiking. 


After steeply descending from the shoulder of Panther Mountain, at 7.9 miles the trail passes the side trail to the Fox Hollow Lean-to. 

<a></a> <a></a>

<a></a>

<a>http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Y_GxRxsQq8k/U_DYL7RYJHI/AAAAAAAABL0/DxIun8xL9fw/s1600/IMG_1470.JPG</a>;

Fox Hollow Lean-to The Lean-to is only about 0.30 miles from the Fox Hollow Trailhead

Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation:

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for brief introductions followed by a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This will be a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Inaugural Run

We'll meet at 9:00am for a 3ish mile light run in the hood(s).

We may wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we could wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt.

results.description:
Registration on the L.L. Bean website is required to attend this event. Visit www.llbean.com/RidgeHill to reserve your spot.

90 minute classes start at  9am, 11am and 1:30pm on Saturday and 9am Sunday.

Discover how easy it is to balance on top of the water. Our paddleboarding starter course is an excellent opportunity to learn the basic strokes and skills you'll need for maneuvering a paddleboard, allowing you to explore scenic lakes, coves and inlets.

Our course begins with a brief introduction and safety talk from our friendly paddling instructors, who will share their accumulated wisdom from years of paddleboarding. They'll outfit you with a personal flotation device (PFD), paddleboard and paddling equipment, giving you insight on the best ways to set up your board. You'll receive instruction on a variety of paddling strokes and have the opportunity to practice each stroke by the shore.

After you feel comfortable on the water, you'll set out in a guided, interpretive tour with your group. You'll experience the freedom of skimming across the water, learning about the ecosystem and history of the area.

All necessary paddleboarding equipment is provided.
results.name: Stand-Up Paddleboarding Discovery Course Every Weekend Only $25

results.description: Not Suitable for beginners or slow hikers.Let’s have some fun this Sat. by going hiking. The hike will be 10 miles long depending on temperature and the leader’s energy level. This hike will be a typical Tuxedo hike with the usual assortment of hills, lakes, valleys, woods roads, etc. This hike won’t be run at a fast pace, but won’t be slow either. It will be at a moderate pace, and we will stop as needed. It could be a demanding hike for some. We will stop a reasonable number of times. If you are looking for a high intensity workout or a slow stroll this is the wrong hike. Leader determines the pace, mileage number of stops, and duration of stops. If you want to run, do not come. Bring at least 3 quarts of water your lunch and wear hiking boots. If all goes well we will take the RD to the BD, the BD to the K, the K to the WB, the WB to the T, the T to the RD, and the RD to the parking lot. Rain cancels. No swimming and no dogs. Trans. 1C Tuxedo Orange CO. Bus Riders are always welcome. There is no need to let me know you are coming by bus. , but if you have any questions about the hike feel free to call or e-mail me. Bus riders take the 8:30 Shor t Line bus from PABT NY which Arr. 9:19. Buy a one way bus ticket. The short line ticket office is on the second floor of the North Building of the PABT. The bus usually leaves from gat 813. Drivers meet in in the commuter parking lot just passed the RR tracks on East Village road. . L: Joe Nigro[masked] (7:30-9:30 PM) [masked]

results.description:
We usually play one or two ~7 inning games. You can come for one or both. Teams are randomized before each. The lineups are locked at 13.

We play without a permit. We try to be aware of the field's availability but there is always a chance that we'll get kicked off by a permit-holder or that someone else will grab the field before us. (This has happened 2-3 times per year on average and we are usually able to relocate to a backup field 5-10 minutes away.)

Our annual costs:
meetup.com: $144
domain name: $15
clincher balls: $300

A suggested cash contribution of $15/year would be appreciated if you come regularly. (Electronic payment is easier). Or you can bring clincher balls (though we currently have a considerable stock remaining from last year).

results.description:
Are you Looking to get fit?

Need to drop a few pounds?

Want to get in shape for the summer?

Try a FREE Boot Camp class at CrossFit Outbreak in Ft. Greene Park.


Our Boot Camp classes are designed to introduce you to CrossFit. We want to get you fit and healthy, challenge your mind and  body - we love to  MAKE FITNESS FUN.


The first class is free, each class after that is $15.00.


There is no obligation to join our gym outside of this class. 


The Exercises: CrossFit is a combination of strength, cardio, muscle endurance, flexibility, core, and functional movement patterns. You get EVERYTHING you need!


Time Efficient Training. Our classes are 60 minutes in length. We utilize the principle of muscle confusion. You will NEVER do the same workout twice! Why is this good? Because…your body will never adapt and you will keep on getting stronger and fitter.


Make sure to click on the link below to register for the class and sign our waiver form ---> 


http://crossfitoutbreak.wodify.com/MembershipSales/ViewSchedule.aspx?LocationId=1895&IsMobile=False&OnlineMembershipId=14804

results.description:
Change of leader: Pat Horsch, cell day of hike[masked]

Meet: 10 AM at Trailside Nature Center parking lot on Coles Ave. A 4-5 mile hike at a moderate pace. Hiking boots required. Bring water and snack. Steady rain cancels. Watch this site on the morning of September 5 for any last minute changes/cancellations.
DIRECTIONS:
Trailside Nature Center, Coordinates: N40° 40.97', W74° 22.38'
1.1. FROM LIVINGSTON: Take John F. Kennedy Parkway past the Short Hills Mall keep left, following signs
to SUMMIT and River Rd. Proceed 0.5 miles at light by Novartis, turn left onto Morris Ave. Continue 1.9 miles past Overlook Hospital as road bends to left. After passing the hospital, take the first right onto Glenside Ave. then in 0.1 miles bear left onto Baltusrol Rd (signs says US 22) road name changes to Summit Rd. After 1.1 miles, at light, turn right onto Summit Lane. At traffic circle, take the second right and proceed 0.5 miles further to a right turn onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.
1.2. ALTERNATIVE: VIA US ROUTE 22: Take Mountainside/New Providence Rd. exit (turn right from westbound lanes; jug-handle from eastbound lanes). Proceed uphill northwest bound for 0.7 miles (name changes to Deer Path) to the 5th right onto Ackerman Ave. In 0.4 miles at Tee intersection, turn right onto Coles Ave. Proceed 0.2 miles to Trailside Nature & Science Center parking lot on the left.
1.3. ALTERNATIVE: VIA I-78 EAST: Take Exit 44 (New Providence/Berkeley Heights). At light turn left onto Glenside Ave. Go 1.3 miles and turn right into the Watchung Reservation (CR 645 - W.R. Tracey Dr). Proceed past Lake Surprise, uphill and straight past loop picnic area. Bear left and continue 1.3 miles to traffic circle. At traffic circle take the first right and proceed 0.5 mile on Summit Lane. Turn right onto New Providence Rd. Parking lot is on the right.

results.description:
This open practice is for those that wish to work on Tai Chi warm ups, form, qigong and general physical conditioning. This is also a time for regular members to make up weekly classes they have missed.


Come practice outdoors, weather permitting. I usually have a bandana on - if you don't find us, call/text me.  Also, if weather is wet or severe, we cancel:[masked]-9218. 


We try to be on the E side of the blacktop. Here's a google map of Robert Moses Playground, Grand Central subway closest: bit.ly/rm-playground.

Dress comfortably in rubber or soft soled shoes if possible with low or no heels. Bring a towel or cloth to stay dry and liquid to hydrate, when cold dress to stay warm and dry.


There are many benefits from learning Tai Chi form.  One advantage of Man-ching's 37 Yang form is that it is relatively short and can be done in plus or minus 10 minutes.  Once embodied (learned well and practiced regularly) it can assist you in maintaining optimum health. For more on health aspects of Tai Chi see here: NIH.


Please contact Inoshi for to arrange for a intro class and to learn about our program: [masked]-9218.

Please note: we do not offer regular classes for free. 

If you are a returning Saturday participant, contributions are expected.

Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. ACA Membership is required and due separately from club and facility fees (one-time ACA event membership is included for those in free trial sessions). Regulars: please confirm that your ACA membership is up to date or renew now. NYKP Members receive a discount! Newcomers can join ACA for 6 months at $15 for or for full year $30 (use PAC Individuals & Families options and select New York Kayak Polo). 

We may or may not set up a goal for this session, depending on numbers, but we can play the "football" version which is good fun and helps with your passing game.

We will be practicing a variety of skills including dribbling, passing/receiving, feinting, shooting, ball control, positioning, tactical training, etc.

Skill exercises will be alternating with strength/agility exercises.

Small sided games

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.

Whole Foods (Union Square) -- upstairs cafe. Show up a bit early to say hi, chat, and drop off any thing you don’t want to run with: jackets, bags, phones, etc. Somebody will always stay to watch the stuff.

Run – 10:00 am

Run 1 mile, 3 miles, 5 miles, or whatever you want. We'll head to the West Side Highway together. No pressure and no limits. Totally informal. Lots of different paces for lots of different people. Even walking speed is encouraged!

Brunch – 10:45 am

Whole Foods has ALL THE FOOD. Come get some.

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It’s that easy. First we run, then we eat!

About our Meetup:

http://www.ThriveInThePark.com

Thrive in the Park was created by a group of friends with a common interest in fitness, clean food, and having a great time.

Our goal is to get in the best shape while in the company of great people.

Workout Details:

Bring a water bottle and your determination.

Our free workouts are created by certified fitness experts and are designed for everyone at any level of fitness. 


The work out will consist of body weight exercises (pushup, sit ups, squats, lunges, jumps, team competitions, partner exercises, etc).

If you have any questions, please send us a message and we'll get back to you.

Note: When you RSVP we will send you a telephone number you can call/text in case you have any trouble finding us.


What people are saying:

Achelle - #ThriveInThePark is the workout I look forward to all week! Not only do I get an incredible full body workout, but it's a fun and encouraging group to be apart of!

Devon - #ThriveInThePark is the best way to sweat out last night's wine.

History:

Thrive in the Park started in 2014. We believe in giving back to the community and in creating ripples of kindness, strength and gratitude. It is our hope that you too will go out into the world and create these ripples. 

We can't wait to see you!

Sponsored by: http://www.soRipe.com

results.description:
Weather: Check back for any cancellations due to poor weather or otherwise.

What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

FREE Circuit Training Saturdays! A 50-minute non-stop intense workout. You will sweat off the weight, you will burn calories, you will gain muscle. All levels welcome. We vow to never give up on you. For we will do everything in our power to help you reach your goal. We operate in a judgement free zone to facilitate your comfort. We promise you will progress.

This Class consist of running, walking, floor exercise, abdominal  workouts, squats, jumprope, and much more. You always have the option to perform the modified version of any drill! This allows beginners or anyone with a minor injury to comfortable fit right in. Build your strength and endurance to perform the unmodified versions of the drill when you see FIT (pun intended :)!! All while moving to be beat of the music. Bring your family, bring your friends. 

Need further assistants locating us? Call[masked], someone will be happy to guide you! Note: We may not answer the phone during class hours!

results.name: Join Us For Our Free OUTDOOR Circuit Training Workout :)

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"It's like looking into the eyes of Pure Love. I've been around meditation, acupuncture, and "Spiritual Healers" for over 20 years. In that time I've worked with several healers. Not until I had privilege of meeting Nan Ni did I experience a true healer. Having a session with Nan Ni or "Nan" is like looking into the eyes of Pure Love - the kind of selfless Love that you hoped was "out there", but didn't really expect to find. Nan has a profound sense of commitment to her patients and students. Her caring, genuine smile comes from deep within and warms you the moment that you meet her. Nan's healing, insightful ways never cease to amaze me and fill me with gratitude. Nan can look at you and know what you need. How many times was I shocked when, without my uttering a word, did she know exactly was what troubling me. I wish I were eloquent enough to express my sincere appreciation for the gift of meeting and working with Nan. Nan's answer to that would be to greet each and every person I meet with an open and loving heart. It is my hope that if you are searching for a healer and/or a meditation practice and come across these words, that you will know that you've found what you've been searching for. Thank you, Lynn" Bodhi Meditation Class Saturday March 14, 2015

"I have tried many different forms of meditation and yoga over the years. Though I have experienced some positive changes practicing over the years I never felt committed to practice on regular basis. Nan takes it to a whole other level. How and why? All I can say is you have to experience it for yourself. There is power in simplicity,love, and truth. Despite some language barriers(which are minor) You can feel her love and healing energy. Open your mind and see with a different set of eyes. I highly recommend her special Saturday classes." Michelina, Bodhi Meditation class Saturday November 15, 2014

“ My first time today. Nan is very helpful and dedicated. I enjoyed it immensely and I did experience a shift in energy. I feel more alert, relaxed and focused even as I write this testimony. I plan on attending her next class in Freeport." Michelina, Bodhi Meditation class September 17, 2014

“ Very strong healing energy tonight. I got there feeling very tired. I had stomach pain all day, and during the first meditation of the evening it got a lot better. By the end I wasn't thinking about it at all. I left full of energy. ” Pam, Bodhi Meditation class November 22, 2013

“ I didn't realize I would be reaping the benefits of Bodhi Med so quickly after attending only two classes. After my second class I felt even more relaxed. I have insomnia, but after the second session I fell asleep faster and deeper which has not happened for a long time. ” Dee, Bodhi Meditation class September 18, 2013

"I have been attending these classes for three weeks. They are amazing. Nan is wonderful! My energy level is shifting and I am beginning to experience an ongoing sense of well-being with balance and relaxation. Highly recommend!" Kathleen, Bodhi Meditation class October 25, 2013

------------------------------------------------------------------

Between May 14,2013 and October 2014 over 2,500 people attended our classes in NYC and Long Island.

The Saturday class is for a small group. Up to 8 people.

Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness

* Stronger emotional intelligence

* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation

Energize your body

Strengthen your mind

Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated

* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America.

Feel free to ask Nan your personal health questions after the class.

Please arrive early for class intro/setup.

Class basic info:

* Loose fitting clothes is recommended but not required.

* Some people bring their own yoga mat for the seated meditation part. This is not a requirement as we have chairs for everyone.

* Cellphones needed to be turned off during the class.

Here is the internet link if you are interested in purchasing the meditation music used in the class.

http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1

</a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> </a> <a href="http://www.bodhimeditationsociety.org/digit-audios/?PHPSESSID=bdc7699b94b966a513c5c67e7cfc8ed1"> ----------------------------------------------------------------

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

Hi guys.  My name is John and Tears recently made me an event organizer.  So here is my first go at it.  Any suggestions?  Let me know!

There are 3 events, you can come to in any combination, including all of them if you want.  

Event 1:  Hike: We will meet at 10:15 AM in the parking lot of the Deserted Village.  Depart at 10:30AM and hike a loop back to the parking lot by 12:30PM -- If you need to leave, we will be back at your car. 

Event 2: BYO Lunch - 12:30PM - 2PM Bring your own lunch and let's have a picnic! There are some nice shady spots very close to the parking lot.  Join us just for lunch if you want, a great chance to be social since it's sometimes hard to talk to everyone while hiking.

Event 3: Hike: We will leave at 2PM and hike a different loop than the first hike on the opposite side of the Reservation.  And Loop back to the parking lot by 4PM..

Rain-day: The Sunday After. 9/6

Note that this is a member-run meetup: no one is responsible for you but you. Your event host is not responsible for you or any injuries that could occur on trails with roots, rocks, gullies, etc. Don't expect anyone to have first aid knowledge, supplies, or water for you. Just a bunch of like-minded people enjoying the trails together! For more details see section 6.2 of http://www.meetup.com/terms/

results.description:
Every time we have a fencing meetup in the park, we meet new people.  Some of them are meetup members who couldn't make meetups at other times, others are just people in the park.  But they're all fun.

Cancellations are much more likely in the summer!  A meetup can be canceled because the ground is too wet, rain is predicted, high heat & humidity are predicted, or just because there aren't enough people committed to being there.  PLEASE RSVP, and come if you say you will. I will post cancellations here by 9am on the day.


To find us, enter the park via the entrance opposite the Ethical Culture School (The Ethical Culture School is on the west side of Central Park West) at 63rd and Central Park West.  The "Backup Fencing Spot" is on your right, just inside the entrance to the park.  Soccer kids have been grabbing our "Where We Fence" location pretty steadily, but to find it, follow the paved path in a large arc to your left, (It starts off heading SE and curves around to NW).  The "Where We Fence" location is on the hard packed dirt under the trees. 


We have a very limited amount of equipment to lend. We're willing to share, but if you have your own equipment, please bring it.

It's also a good idea to bring water!

A more detailed map of where we fence in Central Park is here:

https://maps.google.com/maps/ms?msid=212152258049056562883.0004db7dc1516e1da7244&msa=0&ie=UTF8&t=m&z=17&vpsrc=0

If you're having trouble finding us, call my cell[masked]  It's a good idea to have my cell handy in case we are forced to move.

I look forward to fencing you!

- Mike

Please note:
1. Bring bug spray. We aren't going into heavy woods, so you can wear shorts, but the park has 600 acres of wetlands and there are mosquitoes.
2. When you get off the subway at Pelham Bay, go to the ground level and meet in the plaza in front of the CVS. Don't take the pedestrian bridge to the park, we'll cross that bridge together.


About 10 miles and 5 hours, moderate pace. We will meet outside of the Pelham Bay stop of the 6 train, walk into Pelham Bay Park, visit the Bartow Pell Mansion ($5 admission or just tour the gardens for free), walk around Hunter Island, eat lunch at Orchard Beach, stop on City island, explore Huntington Woods, then return to the 6 train Pelham Bay station.

When we get to the Bartow Pell Mansion, walkers who would like to go inside will have half an hour to tour the house; take a look at the mansion website to get some background before you go in Bartow-Pell Mansion. Walkers who do not want to go inside can tour the gardens, walk the grounds and relax in the shade.

We will visit City Island briefly but not stop there to eat. If you want to eat on City Island, you can split off from the group then walk back to the Pelham Bay station or take the Bx29; or, finish the hike with the group then take the Bx29 back to City Island for dinner.

Bring lunch, snacks, beverages. There is a CVS at the meeting point for snacks and beverages, there are food vendors of varying quality along the beach. Parts of the walk will have no shade, bring hat and sunscreen.

Meet: 10:30 a.m. outside the Pelham Bay station of the 6 train; take the 6 train or the Bx12 Express Bus, which runs from Inwood at Broadway and 207th Street along Fordham Road and Pelham Parkway and get off at the Pelham Bay 6 train station.

Leader: Tom Bergen[masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

As part of Oath Keepers ongoing expansion throughout the five boroughs of NYC, the Richmond County (Staten Island) chapter of the Oath Keepers will be having an informational booth at this years Richmond County Fair. The dates will be this coming Labor Day weekend, September 5,6 & 7. The fair runs from 11am until 6pm all three days. We are looking for volunteers to help run the booth. What that entails basically is greeting people and introducing yourself and educating them as to who we are and what we do as an organization. You MUST BE WEARING an Oath Keepers t-shirt or polo shirt while working the booth. We want to project a professional image and the head of the NYS Oath Keepers has asked that we dress appropriately.


Unfortunately we are only given three free passes so anyone that does come to help will have to purchase a ticket to the fair in the sum of $16. The fair is a great place to bring the kids for the day, it is set in historic Richmond Town on Staten Island. They have rides, a petting zoo, games, vendors...it is a lot of fun for the little kids as well as us big kids. If you are able to help out please RSVP this posting. Thank you again and hope to see you all at our next meeting.

results.description:
Do something GREAT this Summer!!


Take Acoustic Guitar Lessons in Central Park
Free Group Lessons Saturdays, May 16th to October 17.


You will learn to read notes, chords and play songs you know and love.  You will have the opportunity to learn:


• Basic info about the guitar
• To read and play chords
• To read and play Rhythm
• Techniques for using the pick
• How play finger style.
• What you learn can be applied to Rock, Blues, Folk, Country,
   Jazz, Classical
• Plenty of new songs


Anyone can attend and you don't need to attend all the sessions.  A new breakthrough approach, allows each session to be complete even for people who have no experience playing the guitar.  Note: You must RSVP by 9pm on Friday the day before the meetup is scheduled. After 9p.m., registration will be closed.

And after the lesson (12:30 - 1:30p.m), hang out and network with  people, or go check out the sights in the Park!!

WHAT TO BRING:

• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Bring a portable music stand if you have one
• Also bring a 3-ring binder and a pencil


OPTIONAL DONATION: The lesson is FREE.  However, your voluntary $5 or  $10 donation help to offset the cost of making the free lessons available to you.



IN CASE OF RAIN:
If it rains, or there's a threat of rain (including if there is rain the night before or in the early morning and the ground is left soggy), we will have the meetup at an indoor location; check the meetup group announcements for update if looks like rain...the alternate location we will meet at is:

The Sony Public Atrium (pictured below)
550 Madison Avenue, NY, NY  10022
Enter on 55th Street, and look for the guitars gathered near the Starbucks to the right of the entrance.

Remember: please update your RSVP if your plans change and you are unable to make it.  If something changes the day of the meetup, please let me know by phone or text at[masked]-1031.

results.description:
Note this section for new group members and those who have yet to to attend one of our events!  The other concurrent meetup is for other members. 

Greenpoint is an often overlooked gem of a neighborhood that hugs the East River. Once a busy industrial area with shipyards and a home to for oil refining, glassmaking, printing, ceramics and ironworks, the area has distinctively quaint streets, housing and restaurants.

We'll learn about the area's immigrant history which began with the Irish in the 1830's -- and Polish people later in the 19th century.  Even as the neighborhood has seen an influx of diverse communities, the area is an important hub for Polish immigrants still today.

We'll visit one of New York's newest outdoor public spaces -- WNYC Transmitter Park and enjoy the views of Manhattan. Optional after the walk- a great neighborhood to enjoy authentic Polish food!

Cheers from Hank

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
Hello everypony

Luis (aka Fluffy) coming at you with another event at the World Trade Center site. This time  it is to the observation deck at One World Trade Center, also known as The Freedom Tower.

Before going up, there will be a tour of the plaza of the memorial by yours truly, and then it's to take the express elevator up 104 stories. From what I've been told it could take up to 2hrs, for I haven't been up there yet. 

Price:
Adult $36
Senior $30
Kids $26

As for food there are plenty of places we can choose from like burger joints and pizzas, McDonald's and Burger King, Shake Shack, more.

As we get closer to the date I will provide details on where the meeting place will be, and if any more information needs to be given.

See you guys up there.

Rules for the trip:

Be respectful to the memorial, and with everyone. The area is filled with people who are visiting for the history of 9/11 and may have a personal connection to the site. 

Watch your words and your language.

No outside food permitted.

Cameras and video recorders are allowed.

No standing on the cube stone seats on the plaza.

No smoking on the plaza.

No rough housing.

Use indoor voices like in a library.

Service aid animals are allowed.

If you need a wheelchair the tower provide some.

No sharp objects like pocket knives or scissors. We will be going through security (assuming).
results.name: Bronies visit One World Trade Center Observatory

results.description:
This is always a popular walk, which I haven't done in far too long! Curiously, our largest turnouts (30+) for this walk, have been in full on winter with 4+ inches of snow and slush! Well, it looks like fall weather just might be approaching, so, lets shoot for 50+ attendees! We will meet just INSIDE the park entrance @ Prospect Park West and 15th Street [F, G Train to Prospect/15th]. I'm easily spotted. I'm the good looking guy wearing a glaringly green bandana! 

Don't hang out in the circle. I know that's where the map address points to, but cross to the actual park entrance between the columns. Weather Dependent of course. Ensure you double-check event status the day before and morning of, in case of last minute weather changes.

We'll walk around and through Prospect Park, and extend this to include a walk across Brooklyn Bridge, up through Manhattan LES, and finish for light munchies and brews at Alphabet Beer Co - http://www.abcbeer.co - a very relaxed Craft Beer store and lounge, serving a variety of lighter fare sandwiches and platters. Expect to do approximately 10-12 miles, over approx 5-6 hours. Sunset is 7.22pm. We're not in a rush. Bring your cameras. Plenty of time to stop and smell the daisies. Beware of geese. They're aggressive and will pick your pockets.. . And your small children. That wasn't a joke. This is an EASY walk/urban hike, as there will be few hills, but we will put on some miles. And of course, be aware that we will be walking busy city sidewalks & streets once we leave Prospect.

Dress comfortable for a long walk. I recommend you bring a small backpack with water and munchies. We'll pass pit stops along the route once we complete the Prospect Park leg of the walk, but we're not stopping for extended periods until we reach ABC Beer Co.
results.how_to_find_us: Call or Txt 2OI \ 2_3_3 ¦ 57*82
results.name: Urban Hiking: Prospect Park + BK Bridge + LES + Alphabet Beers & Platters

results.description:
Waiting List: The day before an event we tend to have a lot of people drop out so do not be discouraged if you're on the waiting list--there's a good chance you'll be able to join.

Attending List: Please remember that the RSVP list closes at 5pm the day before an event. If you change your RSVP to NO after that time or are a no-show, someone on the waiting list could be left out. We take that very seriously.

Club Hours: Gotham Archery has reserved space for us from 11:00am to 1:00pm. Those are the official club hours. Everyone is free to stay longer at the regular range rate.

First-Timers: If it is your first time at Gotham Archery, you will have to take a safety & intro lesson class from the range staff and demonstrate safe shooting. No exceptions. Please arrive 15 minutes early; the class will start promptly at 11:00am.

Public Transportation: Gotham Archery is located at 480 Baltic St (Brooklyn, NY 11217) in Gowanus. It's a few blocks south-west of the Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr train station. The 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, B, D, N, Q and R trains all stop there.

By car from LI:You can take the LIE, Northern State or Southern State to either Jackie Robinson or the BQE.  Set your GPS to 480 Baltic Street, NY, 11217.  The parking on Sat. AM isn't bad at all: you may have to circle the block once or twice.  The building is painted in a somber yellow ochre.

BUT: please consider car pooling or training it: the drive is awful; the train is lovely.  Most LI LIRR stations suspend parking fees on Sat and Sun.

You change at Jamaica and get in at the Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn-- walk south for about 7-8 minutes to Baltic -- go right.  Gotham is on the left.  The first time you walk here, you should have your GPS active.


 Range Costs: Make sure to mention when you pay for range time you are shooting with the NYC Archery Group to get the CLUB ONLY rate: $20 for two hours of shooting, $5 for equipment (plus sales tax). These discounts only apply during official club hours.

 Club Equipment: At this time we cannot guarantee there will be club equipment to borrow, so please plan accordingly. One of us will post in the comments if that changes.

 See you on the shooting line!
results.name: Gotham Archery Monthly MeetUp

results.description:
I have been reminded that Wave Hill does not permit groups on weekends. Therefore, the Wave Hill visit scheduled for Saturday, Sept. 5, is being replaced by the following:

Fort Tryon & Inwood Hill Parks, with a visit to the Cloisters.

About 2-3 miles at a very slow (1.5 mph) pace, but including a substantial hill in Inwood Hill Park (hence the name). Take the "A" train to 190 St. and then the elevator up to Fort Washington Ave. -- or take the #4 bus directly to 190 St. and Fort Washington Ave. Meet 11 a.m. by the benches at the entrance to Fort Tryon Park on Margaret Corbin Circle. We'll take a look at the Heather Garden, the largest public garden in NYC. Then we'll visit Linden Terrace -- the highest point in Fort Tryon Park and the second highest natural elevation in Manhattan, with great views of the Hudson and the city. We'll have lunch at a viewpoint over the Hudson (bring lunch and beverage) just before a visit to the Cloisters, where we can take a look at the famous Unicorn Tapestries, and/or anything else people might want to see (admission is "pay what you wish" -- $1 is fine). Afterwards, we'll walk through Inwood Hill Park, the largest forested area still remaining in Manhattan, and the only entirely undeveloped park. For those who wish, there is a possible early out after Fort Tryon Park by taking the A train, at Dyckman St., or by taking the #4 bus directly from the Cloisters. The walk should end around 4:30 with a pause for refreshment at the Indian Road Cafe on 218 St. (near the 215 St. stop on the #1 subway). Call or email me to make sure that the walk is on, to let me know that you are coming, and if you have any questions. Bob Susser[masked]; [masked].
results.name: Fort Tryon and Inwood Hill Parks, with a visit to the Cloisters

results.description:
Kayak the Hudson with Mountain Valley Guides

With the most tours, a variety of locations and the best kayak guides on the river, Mountain Valley Guides is the premiere kayak outfitter in the Hudson Valley.  The Hudson River offers fantastic kayaking opportunities, with open water, calm marshes, amazing sunsets, and beautiful scenery .  Our tours are open to people of all abilities...No experience needed, our guides will have you paddling in minutes.

NEW YORK CITY RESIDENTS - Our Hastings-on-Hudson location is only steps away from the Metro North Station (Hudson Line).  Hastings is a great place to spend the day with cool places to grab apres kayaking lunch/dinner and drinks.  Great views of the Palisades Cliffs and of the New York City Skyline.

Palisades Cliffs - Hastings

Guides will lead you across the Hudson to the "Jersey" side for amazing views of the Palisades Cliffs. Rising 350 to 550 vertical feet from the rivers edge, the cliffs offer amazing scenery.  It is hard to believe you are only a few miles north of New York City. Great views of the city skyline and the Hudson Valley.  Please arrive 20 minutes prior to your departure for check in. 

After the kayaking, we can have early dinner near the area.

Depart Date: September 5th Saturday (Event: 1:30 PM - 3:30 PM). Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 11:45 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map) 


Depart 12:30 PM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of 9th Ave & West 43rd St., New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Expect to be back NYC around 4:30 PM  & Flushing at 5:00 PM

Includes: 15 seats luxury Benz van round trip transportation from Manhattan & 2 Hours guided kayaking tour with Mountain Valley Guides (Palisades Cliffs - Hastings)

Cost: Early Birds $69 ($59 by entering promo code save10 by 8/23) for first 8 spots or 10 days in advance; Afterward, Regular $79

Buy Ticket Here: http://sep2015Kayaking.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

Items to Bring: Water bottle, hat, sunblock scream and clothes to change.

Maximum: 15

More Info: http://www.mountainvalleyguides.com/

Refund Policy:

* $10 processing fee if cancelled on or before 2 weeks prior to the event date; 
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, spots can be transferred to your friends with $10 processing fee.

results.description:
Roosevelt Island was once a shelter for paupers, convicts, and the insane--so it's perfect for our group! We'll take the aerial tramway (using Metrocards) to the island, where we'll visit the new Four Freedoms Park, designed by famed architect Louis Kahn; see the ghostly ruins of a smallpox hospital created by the designer of St. Patrick's Cathedral; view a beautifully preserved mansion from 1796 as well as the Eastside skyline; and see other oddities on the former Welfare Island, now a strikingly quiet residential neighborhood in the middle of the East River. After lunch (bring your own), we'll explore the rest of the island, cross a bridge to Astoria, and walk to a beautiful museum devoted to renowned Japanese-American sculptor, landscape architect, and designer Isamu Noguchhi. We'll end the day at an outdoor dance performance (5 PM) at nearby Socrates Sculpture Park, where we can view the sculptures and/or the performance: socratessculpturepark.org/program/in-sight-dance-company/

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.

DISTANCE: About 4 miles. We'll finish at around 5:30 to 6:00 PM, but you can leave earlier, of course.


LUNCH: Bring your own; we'll eat at around 2 PM.

COST: $2 for me (in part to cover Meetup's recently increased organizer fee), and $10 ($5 seniors and students) for the museum, which we will probably reach by around 3:30 PM.

TRANSPORTATION: 6 train Lexington/59th St. or F train to Lexington/63rd St. For details, consult hopstop.com, tripplanner.mta.info, or both, since each is occasionally inaccurate. Also check mta.info/weekender.html for weekend service changes. 

WAITING LIST: Be patient. If you're in the top 20 on the list (shown below the main list on the right side of this page on a computer only) at any time before the walk starts you can come. And there will be many cancellations, especially at the last minute.

IF YOU CAN'T COME:  No need to let me know. But please change your RSVP online if you previously said yes.

results.name: Roosevelt Island, Noguchi museum, & outdoor dance performance at sculpture garde

results.description:
England take on San Marino away for the Group E European Championship qualifying game. In what should be a foregone conclusion England hope to maintain their 100% record so far in qualifying.  

Hodgson's side have a 100% record from their six qualification games and need one win to confirm their place at next year's finals in France.  The squad includes call ups for Swansea midfielder Jonjo Shelvey and Leicester city striker Jamie Vardy.

Should be a good shout to get some beers down, watch some goals go in and the set up for a nice afternoon in the NYC sun! 

PS if Matt is coming remember you have to sing every song that he sings or else he'll get upset with us.

results.description:
**** EVENT IS NOW FULL ****

Join me as we get away from it all this Labor Day holiday weekend and take a trip to one of the most secluded parts of the state. We're heading north to camp out in the Adirondacks expansive Cranberry Lake State Park.


This gem of a place is hidden away from the touristy attractions that drive other campgrounds, but the isolation is worth it. It's a piece of nature that feels like it is just for us, where hiking, fishing, swimming, and boating abound just a few feet outside of our tents. This is how life should be.


The Plan ...

We'll arrive Saturday afternoon at the campground office to check in and head to our camp area to set up our tents and other gear. From here we can do as much or as little as we'd like. In the evening we'll cook and have a communal meal over an open fire, and spend the rest of the night doing the usual camping activities -- partaking in adult beverages and stuffing our faces with snacks, playing games, and shooting the breeze.

Sunday we'll get up and make breakfast, then the day is ours to play as we wish. In the evening we'll do more campfire cooking, socializing, and merry making until we nod off.

Monday we awake to enjoy out last meal together, break down our campsites, then head home.


Cost ...

$22.91 per person, click HERE to pay.

Cost is for TWO nights of camping, checking out on Monday. You don't have to stay two nights but that is what you're paying for. Payment is via PayPal -- you don't need a PayPal account and can pay via credit/debit card.

Space is limited so until I receive your payment your RSVP is not confirmed and your attendance is not guaranteed. Once I have confirmation of receipt of your payment I will move you to confirmed RSVP status.

Refunds will be given only if the meetup is cancelled or rescheduled.

Food Plan ...

To keep it simple, everyone is responsible for bringing what they would like to eat and drink. We will be cooking dinner Saturday; breakfast  and dinner Sunday; and breakfast Monday and it will be semi-communal, meaning bring what you would like to eat for yourself but perhaps also enough to share with a few other people. Simple to cook but interesting items are best.


What else do I need to know?

• When you RSVP, please comment if you have camping gear to bring (tent, sleeping bag, etc.).

• I've reserved two lakeside campsites. Each site has a fire ring or fireplace with grill for cooking and a picnic table.

• I'd suggest buddy-ing up to save hauling space/equipment costs. It doesn't matter to me if the accommodations are co-ed or gender segregated, everyone can decide what is most comfortable for them.


• Rental gear (tents, sleeping bags, etc.) is available at the Tents and Trails store in downtown NYC, Gear to Go Outfitters in Park Slope, Brooklyn, Eastern Mountain Sports and at several REI stores in the NY/NJ area.

• If you are unsure what to pack, click HERE for a list. You won't need to bring everything on here, but it's a good start. If you are still unsure, please ask.

• The campground has full restroom facilities, hot showers and clean running water. We are not auditioning for Survivor here.

• Meetup will be cancelled only in the event of a zombie apocalypse or locust swarm of biblical proportions. Possibility of rain or any other precipitation and we still camp.

Click for CAMPGROUND MAP

Click for HIKING INFORMATION

Directions ...

GPS Coordinates (Latitude, Longitude):[masked], [masked]

CRANBERRY LAKE CAMPGROUND
243 LONE PINE ROAD
CRANBERRY LAKE  NY  12927


Take I-90 (NYS Thruway) west, take Exit 27 at Amsterdam to Route 30 North. Take Route 30 North to Tupper Lake Village; turn left onto Route 3 West. Take Route 3 to Cranberry Lake Village, turn left on Lone Pine Road; campground is 1 mile south.

The park is about 5.5 hours driving time from Manhattan.


We'll need to carpool to the campground. When you RSVP, please indicate if need a ride. Or if you plan to drive, where you are coming from and how many passengers you can take. We'll then figure out our carpooling options, please be proactive and contact a driver directly rather than just saying where you need a ride from. Gas and tolls will be shared among all the passengers.

Campsite Assignments

Welcome to the Occupy Weed Street 420 Fight Club! 

It doesn't matter if you've been mixing marijuana and martial arts for years on the down-low or if you're a grasshopper who's new to the grass, 'cause we all have a lot to learn together! Dress to move around and sweat and come train your body, mind spirit and endocannabinoid system if you are interested in fighting for your 420 rights! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pwUvT4WwC8k

We meet every Saturday at 12:00 High Noon in Sheep's Meadow in Central Park. BYOW


We began the 420 FIght Clib last summer in Washington Square Park and were covered by Metro NY and Vice News! Check out the video below and join us in Central Park every Saturday at High Noon!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPRxzqDS9JM

We'll be playing funk this season. Join us for a great time playing in this group. We got the funk of Stevie Wonder, James Brown, Chic, Kool&The Gang, George Clinton and more! 

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (All charts will be posted by end of August) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

September 09/05, 09/12, 09/19, 09/26
October 10/03, 10/10, 10/17, 10/24, 10/31 (halloween, boo)
November 11/07, 11/14, 11/21 (skipping Thanksgiving, Happy Thanksgiving!)
December 12/05, 12/12

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (14 sessions at 5% discount + show fee) for $360

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2VLVLRLATSNKU­



Show Day is Sunday, December 13th at 2pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in October) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

This show is going to rock!

results.description:
Using browser debuggers are essential to frontend web development.  It can save hours development troubleshooting time when you properly know how to use a debugger.  Today the Chrome DevTools is more than just a debugger, it can be used as an IDE.  We will start by writing a simple web page and learn how to debug it all in Chrome dev tools!

Please bring a laptop with Google Chrome installed to the class,  any operating system is fine.


Please note this class is for people with prior knowledge of the basics of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.  There is a separate class which is for people with no prior experience with web programming that compliments this class.  Here is the link:

http://meetu.ps/2KQVcM

------------------------------------------------------------------


[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.] 

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.  

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities.
