results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Level 2 class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

Anyone and everyone is welcome! 

--------------------------------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of tv production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show, while at the same time, Dewey is taping his weekly MNN cable talk show, "The Midnight Kiki."

Every other Saturday, we will use sound to bring focus and quiet to our body, mind, and soul. Sound is a very powerful tool that has been used for thousands of years.( Even my chiropractor uses sound wave therapy to relax the muscles in my back!) In this meditation, It is a way of breaking the sound patterns that our bodies and energies have been tuned to. When we do this, it breaks up old patterns and helps us to release blocks and energies that no longer serve us.

Every week will be a different experience with Guided meditation, chanting, bowls, drums. I will work with the people who attend to make a personalized and special experience just for them.

results.description:
Though Alfred Hitchcock's Notorious was produced by David O. Selznick's Vanguard Films, Selznickhimself had little to do with the production, which undoubtedly pleased the highly independentHitchcock. Ingrid Bergman plays Alicia Huberman, who goes to hell in a handbasket after her father, an accused WWII traitor, commits suicide. American secret agent Devlin (Cary Grant) is ordered to enlist the libidinous Alicia's aid in trapping Alexander Sebastian (Claude Rains), the head of a Brazilian neo-Nazi group. Openly contemptuous of Alicia despite her loyalty to the American cause, Devlin calmly instructs her to woo and wed Sebastian, so that that good guys will have an "inside woman" to monitor the Nazi chieftain's activities. It is only after Alicia and Sebastian are married that Devlin admits to himself that he's fallen in love with her. The "MacGuffin" in this case is a cache of uranium ore, hidden somewhere on Sebastian's estate. Upon discovering that his wife is a spy, Sebastian balks at eliminating her until ordered to do so by his virago of a mother (Madame Konstantin). Tension mounts to a fever pitch as Devlin, a day late and several dollars short, strives to rescue Alicia from Sebastian's homicidal designs. Of the several standout sequences, the film's highlight is an extended love scene between Alicia and Devlin, which manages to ignite the screen while still remaining scrupulously within the edicts of the Production Code. In later years, Hitchcock never tired of relating the story of how he and screenwriter Ben Hecht (who was nominated for an Oscar) fell under the scrutiny of the FBI after electing to use uranium as a plot device -- this before the bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki. A huge moneymaker for everyone concerned, Notorious is considered one of Hitchcock's best espionage melodramas

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H8f4UOtLf5Q
results.how_to_find_us: we will meet in the lobby call/text my cell 917-388-5838
results.name: Alfred Hitchcock's Notorious movie starts at 1:30pm

group.name: Mondo Culto - The NY Cult Film Meetup

results.description:
Are you sabotaging your success or happiness?

Do you struggle to consistently manifest abundance? Do you FEEL like it's working, but look around and ask, "Where's the money?"

Then this workshop series is for you. Yes, I said series. I have created a series of 12 workshops over the course of the upcoming year designed to help you tap into your abilities to create the life of your dreams. Together we will keep our forward momentum.

Designing your life isn't a cookie cutter process. We are all different and we all block our natural abilities in different ways. And we forget. We reach or achieve the wonderful feelings of success and abundance and we thrive for moments, weeks or months and suddenly look around and realize that somewhere along the line we started slipping back. These workshops are designed to activate, encourage and energize! And most of all... help you create the positive momentum to experience more of what you want, and less of what you don't know. Are you interested?

BEFORE I can book the room, I need to know approximately how many people will be attending. My intention is to book it for the first Wednesday or Thursday of each month, at 7:00. Each workshop will be about 45 minutes, but I'll book the room for longer to allow for questions and socializing! :) Are you ready to create the life of your dreams!?!


Note:
Each workshop will be $15.00. If you are interested but can't afford the $15.00, please message me privately!
results.name: Intentional Manifestation Workshop

I'm excited to get things started so I was thinking of doing an informal stoop jam this coming Saturday, where we can get to meet, share songs and ideas, and our vision for the new Brooklyn Advanced Musician's Meetup Group. We'll be hanging out in front of 225 Park Place (bet. Flatbush and Vanderbilt Aves) with some musician friends playing some well known favorite tunes and a stoop sale on the side.

If you're in town this weekend and would like to get the fall season started, come join us. We'll see if we can schedule our first official Meet/Greet/StudioJam date, but first we'll do the fun stuff and jam, jam jam! Snacks, drinks and chairs will be provided, so just bring your acoustic instruments!

results.description:
As the ultimate law in Hillsfar, The Red Plumes are as corrupt as they are cruel, and regularly enrich themselves at the expense of the common folk in the surrounding area. After meeting a wee halfling in a backwater inn, you find yourselves recruited by Those Who Harp to investigate the disappearance of several farming families between the Cormanthor Forest and Hillsfar. What waits in the rural countryside?

Although there is no cover charge for this event, because the venue is a bar/restaurant, players should factor in ordering brunch (see menu at http://www.lovecraftnyc.com plus drink specials on-site).

We're using 5th edition Dungeons & Dragons. You can download the basic rules (with 4 classes, 4 races) for free at http://bit.ly/1EzS3Uq -- new/returning players welcome, everything provided but bring dice if you got 'em.

venue.name: Rosicrucian Cultural Center of New York City

results.description:
Rosicrucian Principles or “The Facts of Life” from a Rosicrucian Perspective

An Introduction to Key Concepts in the Rosicrucian Teachings

There are many sources of wisdom when we are on the spiritual path. The Rosicrucian teachings, the Holy Books of the major religions, the writings of illumined individuals, poetry, art and many other sources all can serve as important guides. Life also presents each individual with a personalized guide for her or his spiritual development. Life's wisdom is perfectly timed and the exact fit for our stage of evolution. Through this series we will explore how to discern Life's unique wisdom for each of us and how to utilize it to speed our spiritual evolution. 


Julian Johnson has been a member of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC for more than four decades. As a member, Julian has served as a Heptad Master, Regional Monitor, Grand Councilor and Provincial Master in the New York area. Currently, he serves as Treasurer of the Board of Directors for the English Grand Lodge of AMORC. Julian is a senior executive with an educational non-profit organization based in New York City and holds master’s degrees in non-profit management and developmental psychology. He has special interest in the interrelation between mysticism, science and psychology.

All are welcome!
results.name: "The Facts of Life” from a Rosicrucian Perspective with Julian Johnson

results.description:
Beyond Marvel and DC lies the third great shared universe...the Valiant Universe! Soon to be adapted into major movie franchise from Sony Pictures, Valiant is more deeply grounded in science-fiction and mythology than the classic superhero universe--allowing for stories that feel more like Heroes and Game of Thrones than Avengers or Justice League.  But the action and the characters are just as big and as bold as any you'll find in comics! Join us as we introduce you to the comic books and characters of the Valiant Universe at Valiant Fair, a member exclusive Free Comic Book Day! 

https://youtu.be/_QGb89wHV-w

Valiant Entertainment has graciously sponsored this event with a treasure trove of comic books and collected editions! Special Guests include Artist Damien Torres and an Intro to Valiant Panel by Peter!

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.

results.description:
Hike @ Massapequa Preserve

5+ Miles Flat Terrain around 3 hours

WE THEN HEAD TO LOCAL BEACH!!!


Directions:

EASILY ACCESSIBLE VIA LIRR

Take LIRR from Penn Stn or Atlantic Terminal to Massapequa Train Station!

Sunrise Hwy to Broadway, Massapequa (a traffic light and a diner are on the corner). Go NORTH under the RR trestle. At the light, turn immediately right. Look for CVS.

Park @ LIRR Station!

HIKE around a Beautiful Preserve!

Warmer Weather ==> Awesome Hiking Time!

PLUS ... a Healthy - Positive - Afternoon

Talk, Network, Mingle!
Feel positive, Feel Free and good about yourself!
Enjoy the breeze, the calmness!

Multi-Meetup Combined Event


In order to Defray Organizational Costs, contribution of $2 suggested.


Bring some water, Bananas or Granola Bars, Bug Repellent & Sunblock.

Please Don't Forget the Positive MOOD

AND YOUR CAMERA

AFTER PARTY !!!  AFTER PARTY !!!  AFTER PARTY !!!

After the Hike, we could (optionally) pick up some Food (maybe Sandwiches) and drive to Beach for Beach Picnic!!! Please bring your beach accessories. 

Those taking LIRR can car-pool with us.

Please check this page before departing for the Hike For Weather or other general Updates!

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Liability WaiverHiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in Front of CVS by the Massapequa LIRR Station
results.name: Hike - Massapequa Preserve THEN Beach !!!

results.description:
We had over 75 members attend our last Scavenger Hunt! It's a lot of fun!

The Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt is part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL New York. A series of clues leads you around the city performing mental & physical challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. Each member of the winning team receives a New York City gift package.

What to expect:  

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. You'll do the scavenger in pairs of two. 

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door)

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer so get your tix now) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain!

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets ASAP - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/
results.name: The Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Required)

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

Hi everyone,

We'll continue exploring what makes free will impossible, and how understanding the causal and unconscious nature of our human will can benefit us personally and societally.

Download a free pdf copy of my book Free Will: Its Refutation, Societal Cost and Role in Climate Change Denial here - http://files.meetup.com/1626947/fw.pdf

or here - https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BzQpsNgLq7eqRUQ0dUdjWGNZQ0U/view?usp=sharing

The Sony Plaza is a large public atrium with plenty of seating, and restrooms. There are Starbucks and Illy coffee concessions, or you can bring your own food and drink.

We'll also be joined by members of the Conversations New York Meetup. Visit their event listing for the rsvp's.

I hope you can join us.

George

results.description:
Note: If you are planning on attending this meetup please RSVP. I want to be able to know how many people are coming for a given session. Thank you.

I often see members of this group looking for time to study English, so I would like to give the non-native English speakers in our group an opportunity to improve their English just like they have given us the chance to improve our Chinese, Japanese, or Korean skills.

I also hope that by extending this opportunity, we will encourage more native speakers of Chinese, Japanese, and Korean to participate and aid our CJK practice on Wednesdays.

Our practice will include games, discussion, and reading activities. Please look for a notice from me about what activities we will doing each Saturday.

Any and all suggestions for methods, activities, etc. are welcome.

This group was created to function as an exchange. We help you and you help us.

For native speakers of Chinese, Japanese, or Korean, we hope that you will attend our meeting on Wednesday to help our language learners.

Finally, for any native English speakers who are interested in helping, please contact me (Carl) if you want to help out. Please contact me so that we can meet on Wednesday and potential volunteer opportunities. We want to create a friendly and engaging atmosphere but I would like to talk with you for a brief moment during the week before you participate as a volunteer. 

If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, feel free to contact me (Carl).

How to find us...

Go to 53rd street and Lexington Ave. The building is across the street from a CVS pharmacy on 53rd St, there are two main entrances. The top entrance in the picture is on 53rd St between Lexington avenue and 3rd avenue. The bottom entrance is on the corner of 53rd St and Lexington avenue. The building is called the Citigroup Center but the area where we sit is also called the Atrium Shops and Cafes. Which is located on the bottom floor: a big open area which has many round and square tables and chairs. The ZIP CODE is 10022. If you still have problems finding us look for a high rise glass building. Barnes and Nobles and 24 Hr Fitness are also located in the same building except on the upper level. If you enter on the upper levels then take the escalator down to ground floor where all the people and tables are.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a printed or written meetup sign with our group name
results.name: English Study and Practice for Non-Native Speakers

group.name: Chinese, Japanese and Korean in Practice (Non-beginners)

results.description:
Hello Everyone,

Let's get together for some fun minpin mayhem!  We will be meeting at my favorite uptown location- J Hood Wright Dog Park on 173rd-175th and Fort Washington.  The A train to 175 will get you right to the park.  The dog run is in the back.  It was  was renovated last year and is really really great. It's big, super secure, and loooooong enough for our little pins to get quite a workout.   We have a number of pins that live close by and go to this run regularly.  Looking forward to having other pins join us. 

Please come, hang out in the sun (there's definitely shade too!) and spend a little time hanging out with the other gorgeous min pins!

Happy Spring/Summer!!

-Jenny, Pablo and Princess

results.description:
We had over 75 members attend our last Scavenger Hunt! It's a lot of fun!

The Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt is part hunt, part obstacle course & ALL New York. A series of clues leads you around the city performing mental & physical challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. Each member of the winning team receives a New York City gift package.

What to expect:  

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. You'll do the scavenger in pairs of two. 

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door)

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer so get your tix now) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged) The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Please download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain!

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so get your tickets ASAP - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/
results.name: The Amazing NYC Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Required)

results.description:
With George
From 2pm-4:30pm (It's okay to arrive late or leave early.)

We'll explore what makes free will impossible, and how understanding the causal and unconscious nature of our human will can benefit us personally and societally.

The Sony Plaza is a large public atrium with plenty of seating, and restrooms. There are Starbucks and Illy coffee concessions, or you can bring your own food and drink.

We'll also be joined by members of the Exploring the Illusion of Free Will Meetup group. Visit their event listing for the rsvp's

I hope you can join us.

George
results.how_to_find_us: We're usually close to the 55th St. entrance. Look for our Meetup sign

results.description:
Would you like to be healthier and more relaxed and joyful…….letting go of stress and the burdens of a busy mind?

If so, come and join us for the Open Heart Meditation and Reiki Tummo energy balancing treatment. You will feel more relaxed and peaceful as Divine energy is channeled to everyone simultaneously.

What is Reiki energy healing?

Reiki is a simple way of channeling high vibration energy for healing purposes for ourselves or others. It clears blockages in our energy channels so that our physical body can be healthier. The practitioner does not use his/her energy, but is just a channel through which the energy flows. Reiki Tummo goes beyond traditional Reiki in that it is not just a healing modality, but also helps us to grow spiritually by opening our spiritual heart which is our connection to the Creator. Reiki Tummo also uses kundalini and earth energy for a deeper and gentler acceleration of cleansing and spiritual growth.

What else do I need to know?

Donations are gratefully accepted, but if you can't donate please feel free to come. Space is very limited so register early. Repeaters are always welcome. You may bring interested guests.

Open Heart and Reiki TUMMO Alumni can join for free.

Please note that this is not a Reiki circle to channel Usui.  You will be experiencing Reiki TUMMO by Padmacahaya alumni only.

Call Ann at[masked] or email by 9am @ [masked] for more information

Heart Smiles,

the NYC Group

results.description:
Hike @ Massapequa Preserve

5+ Miles Flat Terrain around 3 hours

WE THEN HEAD TO LOCAL BEACH!!!

Directions:

EASILY ACCESSIBLE VIA LIRR

Take LIRR from Penn Stn or Atlantic Terminal to Massapequa Train Station!

Sunrise Hwy to Broadway, Massapequa (a traffic light and a diner are on the corner). Go NORTH under the RR trestle. At the light, turn immediately right. Look for CVS.

Park @ LIRR Station!

HIKE around a Beautiful Preserve!

Warmer Weather ==> Awesome Hiking Time!

PLUS ... a Healthy - Positive - Afternoon

Talk, Network, Mingle!
Feel positive, Feel Free and good about yourself!
Enjoy the breeze, the calmness!

Multi-Meetup Combined Event


In order to Defray Organizational Costs, contribution of $2 suggested.


Bring some water, Bananas or Granola Bars, Bug Repellent & Sunblock.

Please Don't Forget the Positive MOOD

AND YOUR CAMERA

AFTER PARTY !!!  AFTER PARTY !!!  AFTER PARTY !!!

After the Hike, we could (optionally) pick up some Food (maybe Sandwiches) and drive to Beach for Beach Picnic!!! Please bring your beach accessories. 

Those taking LIRR can car-pool with us.

Please check this page before departing for the Hike For Weather or other general Updates!

BWSF2015 represents a true appreciation and celebration of Indie culture and an authentic creative approach without any corporate sponsorships or industry funding – only art and music in their purest form.

ABOUT BWSF2015:

Brooklyn Wildlife Summer Festival is an annual diverse and synergistic, indoor and outdoor festival featuring some of the best Independent talent from New York and beyond. The goal of the event is to galvanize the Indie arts and music community and represent its flourishing cultural growth within Brooklyn, with a special focus on Bushwick. BWSF2015 caters to a new youth culture that is multi-faceted, variegated, ethnically ambiguous and racially interwoven. Black, white, red, brown, gay, straight, trans - whatever color or gender… everyone parties together.

The festival is created by artists and is 100% Independent. There is no corporate sponsorship or outside funding. BWSF is unique in that it is the only festival to offer such a large and varied selection of independent artists and musicians, active within the community, gathered in one space. BWSF focuses on performers in the Brooklyn arts and entertainment scene and due to the large presence of international artists in Brooklyn, the festival includes performers and participants from all around the world. There will be representation from UK, Germany, Denmark, Australia, Caribbean, Jamaica, Russia and more. BWSF2015 SEEKS TO REACH:
Multicultural and Multiethnic people, ages 18-80

The festival attracts individuals who:
• Are seekers, social explorers, tastemakers and enjoy being ahead of the curve.
• Believe old-fashioned business models are outdated and traditional vehicles for communication (TV and Radio) are no longer in tune with the consumer of today.
• Have turned their backs on the status quo and crave progressive thought, art and culture.
• Artists, musicians, Brooklyn and New York dwellers and everyone who is part of or who appreciated the Indie scene.
results.name: Brooklyn Wildlife Summer Festival - Opening Show @ The Paperbox

results.description: Товарищи, Бродяги! Если на длинные выходные вы не отправились в дальние края, то позволю вам предложить следующие мероприятия. 5 сентября, Субота: Фестиваль средневекового искуства в Tuxedo Park NY http://www.renfair.com/NY/ Если никогда не бывали, то безусловно стоит сходить. Я с сыном (6 лет) хожу каждый год, он в восторге! 6 сентября Воскресенье: Русский Фестиваль в Otrada, Chestnut Ridge NY https://www.smore.com/rvry0 Вкусная еда, Живая русская и украинская музыка, Танцы, Бассейн, Игры для взрослых и детей. Это не Метап, регестрироваться не нужно. Я на оба мероприятия планирую прибыть около 2 р.м. Приходите когда хотите, там можем встретиться, пообщаемся, попьем пива... P.S. Общество Отрада, собирает гуманитарную помощь жителям Востока Украины пострадавшим в результате гуманитарной катастрофы. Если у вас есть ненужные вещи, или домашняя утварь, можете привозить: http://www.otradainc.org/

results.description:
** This class is for those of you who have taken Improv Level 1 at least two times. **

** If you want a longer warm-up, you can drop in for FREE on the Level 1 workshop taking place an hour before this. **

In this class, Dewey will help you take the basic elements of improv fundamentals learned in Level 1 and apply them toward building great scenes that engage an audience. 

You will learn the basic structure of comedic scenes and work on using “yes, and…” to discover and heighten the funny, understand how to make strong offers, establish who/what/where, heighten the funniest choices, and edit scenes.

If we get a consistent group, we might even consider putting on a show that you will perform in front of your friends and family as the culmination of your hard work in class.
results.name: Improv: Scenework [LEVEL 2]

results.description:
This Event:


The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where fellow Python developers and learners can come and asks questions and/or code with some company! Developers of all skill levels are welcome. Also, this event is free. 

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!
results.name: Saturday Python Study Group

results.description:
We don't often travel beyond Metrocard range, so this will be a special occasion. We'll be meeting at the home of one of our longtime members named Karen; she's been part of the group since 2005, and this will be her first time hosting. (FYI, her place is not wheelchair accessible, and for those with allergy concerns, there are no pets.)

To entice people to make the trip, Karen will provide LOTS of food. She says, "I don't know exactly what's on the menu yet, but I'm thinking about basic appetizers (chips, dips, veggies, fruit) some type of chicken dish; a vegetarian dish; a rice, pasta or potato dish; a vegetable, salad or combination of both dish; some type of bread; homemade cookies; ice cream; red and white wine; seltzer and spring water; coffee and tea."

If you're going to be traveling from New York City, there are two buses from the Port Authority that'll drop you off right near her place. One is the 167-Q to Terrace Circle, which takes about 45 minutes. The other is the 167-T to the intersection of Teaneck Road and State Street, which takes about half an hour. Both buses cost $4.25 each way. If you're driving, there's plenty of free parking nearby.

RSVPs are very important for this meeting! As I hear from you, I’ll send more info, including the exact address, along with more detailed bus directions.
results.name: Writing group meeting in Teaneck, New Jersey

results.description:
Bi-Perspective is the longest-running social, discussion and support group for ALL bisexual/non-monosexual, queer-identified and questioning people meeting in the New York City area.

Monthly meetings are held on the 1st Saturday of every month from 2:30 PM to 4:00 PM at the LGBT Community Center, followed by a convivial Coffee & Desert at a nearby local restaurant. The group provides a warm & friendly, welcoming, caring, SAFE, non-discriminatory environment for everyone who lives, works or plays in the New York City area.

Come visit and share your Feelings, Hopes and Dreams as well as your Fears, Concerns and Uncertainties with us. And of course, Joy and Laughter are always welcome at our meetings too! Bi-Perspective, a great way to meet others from the community and to make new friends in the New York area.

$5 (more if/less if) suggested donation to help defray room-rental cost
results.how_to_find_us: please contact your moderator Francesca Fortunato at FMFortunato06@aol.com if lost,  late or just need to chat
results.name: monthly meeting of Bi-Perspective: a social & discussion group

results.description:
You are invited on Saturday, September 5, 2015 at 2:30 PM to the Masonic Philosophical Society for our next hosted discussion and study. Each month a different topic, ranging from philosophy and science to religion and metaphysics, is discussed and debated. This group, which is open to the public, is where non-members can learn more about Freemasonry, as well as meet local Freemasons.

Study Topic
September's topic will be conducted by Brother Janet Castro on a study of Freemasonry: The Art of Impressionism: Is progress linked to breaking out of established thought patterns? After a short lecture, a discussion and debate by the group will follow.

Impressionism is a French art movement that emerged in the late nineteenth century. Its influence spread throughout Europe and eventually the United States. It came from the disagreement and reaction of some artists against the classical themes and artistic formulas imposed by the French Academy of Fine Arts, and sponsored by the official Paris Salon exhibitions. At the time, science started to realize that what is perceived by the eye and what the brain understands are two different things. The Impressionists sought to capture the former. It is said that Édouard Manet established the freedom of expression principle of an artist before an object, by not representing it on a "mystical", "elevated" or traditional theme. This concept, still undeveloped, is the basis and foundation of modern art. What do Masons think about the principles of Impressionism, about the revelry against the ideological foundation of the Paris Salon? Is thinking "out of the box", like the Impressionism at the time, nothing but a revolutionary idea, or is it fundamental for innovation and social Rebirth?

Directions:
[masked]th Ave Whitestone, NY 11357

Mission Statement
The Masonic Philosophical Society embraces the concept of learning, not for school, but for life, and believes that all men, who seek it, deserve access to continued education. We further embrace the concept of a community environment, where ideas can be shared and debated in an open forum. From the seven liberal arts to the arcane, we seek to gain and to share the knowledge that is the legacy of mankind.

More Resources
Website: http://www.philosophicalsociety.org

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/masonicphilosophicalsociety

Learn more about Freemasonry: http://www.co-masonry.org
results.name: The Art of Impressionism: Is progress breaking established thought patterns?

group.name: Freemasonry for Men and Women in New York City

Will there be a yoga mat for me ? 

No, you should bring your own yoga mat or a towel or a blanket. Whatever is available.

How does the picnic work? is it optional ? 

Picnic is totally optional and happens right after the class. Just bring whatever you like (IT NEEDS TO BE VEGETARIAN-CHEESE DAIRY PRODUCTS ARE OK) and share with others. i.e. 

http://www.meetup.com/The-Original-Yoga-System-Classes-are-finally-in-NYC/photos/26163153/?success=uploaded#[masked] 

Do i have to bring food to join the picnic ?

Well, yes. 

Can I text or call the Organizer ?


Yes, if you have a question which is not answered in here, you can text or call him.

[masked] 

Oh, OK. Let me RSVP then but i'm not sure if i'm going to make it there.

Well, RSVP only if you are really going to make it to the class. 
Besides emergency situations, members who RSVP and don't show up will be removed from the group.

I'm not sure if i can make it on time. Can I come later ?

Short answer is NO.We encourage everyone to attend the classes which are free. All you need to do is come on time.  

What kind of yoga class this will be ?

It's based on Patanjali's 8-limbs-system which is gentle yet very effective-take a look at  group reviews-. We will start with breathing & Bioenergy techniques, and continue with standing poses and other pose groups. Before meditation and deep relaxation, we will also have 5 min free time that you can practice any asana you would like. The Instructor will be helping with the postures. 

I am a beginner and i have never tried yoga before. Can i join you guys ?

Beginners are welcome !!! 

Great, how am i going to get there ? where do you guys meet ? 

LOCATION PICTURES ARE HERE(where we meet and practice):

Access the webinar here: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email. 


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>) 


----------------------------------------------------------------

Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.


These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful.


You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on their own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog
results.name: Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-FREE Class-(Online Webinar)

results.description:
Given the heightened geopolitical tensions permeating in different parts of the world, we'll forgo the "regular monthly" meetup this month — instead, we'll be discussing four important foreign affairs topics throughout the month that will encompass the European Union, China, Iran, and the United Nations.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EZ9lhoo8fZo

For this E.U. discussion, the subtopics will include:

• Will the E.U. ultimately transform into a Federation, Confederation, or some other hybrid form? Or, will it dissolve and revert into individual nation-states?

• Do the member States share a common military and security objective?

• Should the single currency system be overhauled?

• The current migrant and refugee: what is a sensible admissions policy, including a "burden-sharing" agreement among the member nations?

• What do the current immigration trends reveal about the future demographic makeup of the E.U.?

•  Does the recent rise of neo-nationalism countervail the "unification" goals among the member States?

• Can it recover from "Grexit"?

• Should Turkey be admitted to the E.U.?

• Should the U.K. withdraw its membership?

We probably will not enough time to cover all of the above points -- there will be a sequel (Part II) to continue the discussions, tentatively scheduled for later this year or early next year.
results.name: The Future of the European Union (Part I)

results.description:
The artists are back once more!


The last monthly meetup was epic, but now its time to follow it up with more awesome meetups! Join us as we draw to our heart's content at the Cap21 studio.

This hiatus has left our fandom in want for more PONY! so lets give them what they want by drawing new and exciting content for everyone.

Each of the events are scheduled with community artists to demonstrate on the projector. If you are an artist interested in making a demonstration, contact me to reserve time on the projector.

We'll be bringing tools for everyone to use. these are the things we have:

• One Laptop and projector


• Two digital drawing tablets (one Wacom Intuos Pro and one Huion GT-190S)

• The Phoenix Perch (recording device for traditional art)

• Pencils and a few sketchbooks


Please bring your own sketchbook, I don't have enough for everyone but I'm working on getting more for the group.

With these tools we are looking to cater to both the traditional and the digital artists in the best possible ways!

results.description:
Central Park is a three dimensional work of art with the intended effect of “refining and elevating people’s spirits.” Come explore the souther section of the most visited public space in all of the United States and connect your understanding of it with the monuments that define the spaces we cover on this tour.

Itinerary:
• Grand Army Plaza
• Doris Friedman Plaza
• Central Park Zoo
• The Mall
• Bethesda Terrace and Fountain
• Strawberry Fields
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins by the Pulitzer Fountain in front of the Plaza Hotel (between 58th & 59th Sts. and 5th Av.) map here. Tour concludes on Central Park West and 72nd St). map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You are not charged. At the end of the tour you can put a value to the information presented in the form of a gratuity.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

Central Park is a landmark to remember. Connect your memory of it to works of art that will be there for time immemorial.

results.description:
I keep an eye on the weather and the field.  In the case of inclement weather - I try to make a determination as early as possible - preferably 24+ hours in advance, or by noon the day of if it's still questionable.  If we are not meeting, I will actually cancel the event page and send out an email.  If you are not signed up to receive emails, check the site, or text me[masked]


Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc.   If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF.  If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...).  If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.



What is Ultimate Frisbee?  In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee.  You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Montclair)

OWSLA breakout darling Mija will join forces with Mau5trap’s REZZ for Dark Disco on The Roof at Output! It’s always refreshing to see bad ass females taking over the male-dominated electronic dance music scene — which is only one reason why we swoon for invigorating producer/DJ talent, Mija. A surprise set with Skrillex at Bonnaroo last year has coined Mija as the Jack U’s producer protege and has also proven her talents as a true director of vibes — buzzing off the success of her breakout hit “Crank It’” featuring Lil Jon and ???. Now, Mija continues to takeover festival stages with new remixes as she’s currently embarking on a world tour. REZZ has also been making rounds with a debut song “Serenity” off Mau5trap’s We Are Friends vol. 4 EP.

Dark Disco is committed to partying with a good sound system, lots of shots and a venue with shady corners, where you can love and hate equally and then drink and dance it off. Welcome to the party.

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvtxmqbv24I

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with 6x12 Goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

results.description:
Saturdays are meant to be taken easy - so join us for a leisurely, loosely-guided walk over the Brooklyn Bridge into DUMBO.

Before we cross the bridge we'll touch on the history of the Brooklyn Bridge and how it became one of the most iconic symbols of the city. It's an amazing story of architectural, as well as social, accomplishment that helped shaped NYC as we know it today.

Once in DUMBO we'll check out an array of stellar street art, the magnificent views of the skyline, and the picturesque parks that line the waterfront. It's truly one of the most wonderful little neighborhoods in the city.

WHO SHOULD COME TO THIS EVENT :

To put it simply : everyone, duh! But if you appreciate good conversation, little known facts about the city around you, and great people - this is DEFINITELY for you.

WHY SHOULD I COME TO THIS EVENT:

To meet great people, learn facts to impress your friends, get exercise, enjoy life, turn off Netflix, and appreciate the city in a different light. 

HOW LONG DOES THE TOUR LAST:

2 hours is a fair estimate. Depending on our pace and conversation it may last a little longer. 

HOW DO I GET TO THE STARTING POINT: 

I would suggest taking the 4, 5 , 6 to City Hall and walking through the park to the Woolworth Building. You can also take the A, C , E , 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 6 to Fulton Street and walk a few blocks north on Broadway.

HOW MUCH DOES IT COST: 

I typically charge $20 a tour through my business, SideStreet Tours, but this one is on the house. If you had an awesome time and wish to offer a gratuity at the end, it's always much appreciated. 

HELP! I HAVE A QUESTION! WHO DO I CONTACT :

Josh Steinberg -[masked] - [masked]

results.name: Walk the Brooklyn Bridge into DUMBO

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

4:00 - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
4:30 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on.
4:35 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
5:35- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Milk and Honey Cafe located at 1119 Newkirk Ave. The closest train station is Newkirk Plaza on the Q line. Walk 3 block down Newkirk Avenue until you reach Westminster Road. We are sitting at the table in the back.

SOME TIPS:

Laptops are welcome. Remember to charge your laptop ahead of time.

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Don't know where to begin, read this.

http://gaiateabrew.com/leonbell/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/Mini-Guide-to-Writing.pdf

results.description:
Photo: from Variety Magazine


DIRECTED BY STANLEY NELSON

The rise and fall of the Black Panther Party during the 1960s and beyond is a uniquely American story of a growing pride in black culture, and more militant demands for justice and racial equality, with a cast of larger-than-life personalities including: Huey Newton, Bobby Seale, Eldridge and Kathleen Cleaver, and Fred Hampton. Renowned documentarian Stanley Nelson masterfully assembles rare archival footage that contextualizes the history of the Panthers – begun in response to racism and police brutality. THE BLACK PANTHERS does not hesitate to critique its subject, nor does it shy away from judging the corrupt activities of J. Edgar Hoover’s FBI or the countless shoot-outs, raids and arrests that were the response of local police. It is a history that needs to be told to understand today’s incendiary racial landscape. USA • 2015 • 116 MINS. • FIRELIGHT FILMS

http://boxoffice.printtixusa.com/filmforum/advance?v=2454&i=16704

I have two restaurant options we can go to eat after, for whomever wants to participate.

Great Variety Magazine Article on Vet PBS documentarian Stanley Nelson film (click his name for it)

results.description:
Come with us on this tour devoted exclusively to events and personages of the Civil War era in the Union Square/Astor Place area. Hear tales of the exiled Irish patriots that formed the famous “Fighting 69th”;  the luxurious salon of photography pioneer Mathew Brady; the out-of-control spending of Mary Todd Lincoln in the metropolis’s biggest store; the ugly Draft Riots and their threat to this neighborhood; the wartime division within the thespian Booth family with tragic consequences for the entire nation; the “Fairy Wedding” that brought a sorely-needed bit of levity to town, courtesy of none other than PT Barnum;  and the fateful night that Abraham Lincoln made his bid for the Presidency at the Great Hall of a relatively new venue called The Cooper Union. All this and more, as we discover New York City’s Civil War past.

Where to meet: Meet outside the Barnes & Noble book store, East 17 St between Broadway and Park Avenue South. 

When to meet: 4:45 for a 5pm start. I will be holding a sign that reads, "Civil War Union Square".

Train: Take the 4,5,6,L, N,R to "Union Square/14 Street" and  you're right there; all other trains to their respective "14 Street" stations will leave you some avenue blocks away. 

Fee: $20 cash, $15 for seniors 65 + with proof of age; exact change appreciated! Please bring bills, not coins.  Sorry, please do not bring dogs or minor children age 17 or below on the tours. No audio taping or video taping allowed. 

The tour will be approximately 2.5 hours long. For sunny days, be sure to bring a hat and a bottle of water. Check the weather reports on the day of the tour; if there is a chance of rain, please bring your own umbrella.  While Friendly Native tours usually do take place on the date and at the time they are scheduled, on occasion they will be postponed in cases of high temperatures or high probability of rain,  and an email sent out to that effect to all who have registered for the event.

The nearest restrooms to this location are inside Barnes & Noble. Please be sure to "take care of things" before the start of the tour!

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
The first Saturday of every month we meet at 5 pm, instead of the normal weekly Saturday meeting time of 2 pm.

After our meditation program, which ends by 7 pm, we enjoy a healthy potluck dinner.  Please join us!  It's really a great way for us to get to know each other better. 

Log onto www.perfectpotluck.com to let us know what you'd like to bring. Type in Administrator: Fitzpatrick, password: Ananda. You can see what others are bringing to help you decide! Call Linda Fitzpatrick at[masked] if you have any questions or need help entering your food selection on the perfectpotluck.com site.

The potluck goes on until about 9 pm; although you can leave anytime you like.  It's all very informal and friendly.

We meet at the Wilson House of the First Baptist Church, 456 North Street (corner of Bryant Ave.) in White Plains. Email Merrill Harmin, [masked] if you have questions.

Our typical agenda:

- We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives.
- Then we meditate together chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of a gong.
- And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

The group has been meeting for some time before Meetup began. The Meetup page is not a reflection of the group's attendance as it shows only the Meetup members that are planning to attend a particular meeting. The special potluck meeting we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of about two dozen members.
results.name: American Meditation Society  - Monthly Meditation and Potluck Dinner

results.description:
PICK-UP CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @ CHELSEA PARK  

                                     Check our Facebook page:

          facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer


                                NO CLEATS OR STUDS ALLOWED

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cR_TuiCA8RM

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play THREE games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12.00 pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

***If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.***

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

CHELSEA PARK.

Between 27th and 28th street and 10th Avenue.

Take A, C or E to 23rd St and 8th Ave and walk to 10th Ave and 27th St or any subway line to 34th St and Penn Station and walk for about 8 minutes to 28th St and 10th Ave.

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll go to Molly Wee for a pint or two:

                             Molly Wee Restaurant

                                       402 8th Ave, 

                                 New York, NY 10001

                                    (212)[masked]

                            PLEASE CHECK THEIR MENU!

                                      themollywee.com

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
Each week will have a theme picked for that day to work with, discuss, and draw. I think these themed meetups will be exciting and give artists a more common focus, this will be a great exercise to either draw something their familiar with, curious about trying, wanting to learn, or to experiment with and challenge themselves with something new.

These meetups will be focused on creating art, sketches, and ideas with a central focus depending on the theme and be a slightly different from our casual meetups. The meetup will be split into three parts: First conceptual thumbnail sketches and warm-up exercises, then spend an hour and a half on drawing, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be more drawing focused! 

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC.
results.name: Lets Draw Together! Theme: Horror

This class will open your taste buds to the many types of beer out there, peeling back the myth that it is only for frat boys and sports fans! From fruity, juice-like lambics to citrus flavored sours to golden lagers, beer isn't just a fizzy, somewhat bitter adult beverage. With more variety than wine and a broader range of flavors, you'll be surprised to learn that YOU may be a beer lover after all!

Each class is 1 hour and we personally tailor your flight (4 tastings) to what you like to eat/drink. We will also buy you a pint of your choice! This interactive class is perfect for date nights, beer lovers and novices alike, bartenders, and anyone (over 21)! By the time you leave, you'll have discovered a new type of beer unlike anything you've ever tasted!

results.description:
HETEP is an Egyptian word for being calm and content within the self.
Healing Touch Program gathers a community of people who want to communicate love, respect, and compassion through the language of healing touch. They care to keep improving their ‘touch intelligence’ so as to be aware of another’s needs and boundaries. 

A HETEP GATHERING starts with an invocation to the Elements and the various aspects of the Mother Goddess. The space created is sacred and safe for all of us to share our experiences - our thoughts and feelings, our presence, and the rhythms of our breathing as we participate in the expansion of our touch perception.

This event is expanding now to include everyone interested in evolving their 'touch intelligence'. It has been a monthly women's gathering and a wonderful opportunity to share and celebrate our intention, strength, and life experience!

You're invited to join this ongoing class at any time. It is 'by donation', because your healing presence is the most important material you can contribute! So please come and donate your body to the science of healing - we will return it renewed and energized. 

Every gathering starts with an introduction of ourselves in a circle. You will be introduced to this simple healing touch method. We will practice on each other on the floor lined with yoga mats and blankets. You may want to wear comfortable clothes and bring a yoga mat. This program is designed for every body shape and sensory ability - or sensitivity! 

HETEP facilitator, Karuna Ma has been introduced to healing touch very early in life. Since 1998, qualified as a Reiki Master Healer and Seichim Master Teacher. Seichim energy is sometimes called 'Egyptian Kundalini' as it is great at assisting a breakthrough experience for both physical and psychic well-being. Since her training in 2001, Karuna has been working as a massage therapist, energy and sound healer.
results.name: HETEP Healing Touch Program

results.description:
THIS IS THE FIRST SLAM OF THE[masked] SLAM SEASON.

Our Sept slam will be at Casa del Sol in Nyack. We will have:  


--a short open mic [5 people max] 
--a poetry slam limited to 8 folk; the slam'll be 3 rounds 
--a $5 cover 
--$10 for the winner 
--a wonderful group of humans

Sign-ups and doors open at 6:30 PM; poems start at 7.

Any questions? Ask!


RULES FOR THE OPEN MIC: you get 5 minutes to do whatever.


RULES FOR THE SLAM: you get 3 minutes to do 1 original piece, sans costumes, musical accompaniment, props, animals, etc. Anyone can sign up to perform; first 4 slam spots are first-come, first served; last 4 spots will be determined randomly from anyone else that wants to compete. Judges will be chosen from the audience. Top scoring poets advance to the second round and the third round. Different pieces needed for each round so bring three poems!

Any poem you slam with this month cannot be used the next time you slam with us.

Parking is free from 6 PM to 11 PM in the public lots.
results.name: Sept Poetry Slam @ Casa del Sol in Nyack
