venue.name: Film Forum in New York City

results.description:
The Black Panthers:  Vanguard of the Revolution

A film directed by Stanley Nelson

The rise and fall of the Black Panther Party during the 1960s and beyond is a uniquely American story of a growing pride in black culture, and more militant demands for justice and racial equality, with a cast of larger-than-life personalities including: Huey Newton, Bobby Seale, Eldridge and Kathleen Cleaver, and Fred Hampton. Renowned documentarian Stanley Nelson masterfully assembles rare archival footage that contextualizes the history of the Panthers – begun in response to racism and police brutality. THE BLACK PANTHERS does not hesitate to critique its subject, nor does it shy away from judging the corrupt activities of J. Edgar Hoover’s FBI or the countless shoot-outs, raids and arrests that were the response of local police. It is a history that needs to be told to understand today’s incendiary racial landscape. USA • 2015 • 113 MINS. • FIRELIGHT FILMS

Reviews

“The film continues a discussion whose present-day relevance is painfully, increasingly obvious. Adding a bounty of excellent archival photographs and some good political soul on the soundtrack.”

Tickets

Tickets can be purchased in late August by visiting this site and clicking the link on the right side of the page:  http://filmforum.org/film/the-black-panthers-vanguard-of-the-revolution-film-page
results.name: Film:  THE BLACK PANTHERS Vanguard of the Revolution

Gaymes Night
Social evening of board games & cards. We provide the games (or bring your own to share), you provide the smarts!

Fun and non-competitive, open to all skill levels.
Held on the 1st, 3rd and 5th Saturdays of each month at 7 pm.

Snacks provided to feed the little grey cells.  Sometime the groups orders pizza.

results.description:
For more information and tickets: 

http://30anniversarygala.tacl.org/


Purchase of ticket includes night-long premium open bar, all hors d’oeuvres, three course meal, entertainment, and dance floor. Black tie attire recommended.

From September 4th to 7th, TAP-NY and our parent organization, TACL, will be hosting “Our Next Chapter,” a national convention celebrating both the 30th anniversary of TACL and the success of the Taiwanese American community. Joining us in this celebration will be leaders and officers from our sister TAP chapters in Atlanta, Austin, Boston, DC, LA, SF, SD and Seattle.

The pinnacle event of the convention will be the 30th Anniversary Gala – held at the Manhattan Penthouse on Fifth Avenue with breathtaking 360 views of the Manhattan skyline. Everyone is invited to celebrate this occasion with us!

This evening of elegance will be a black tie affair held from 7 PM to 11 PM on Saturday, September 5th. We’ll begin the night with hot hors d’oeuvres and mingling between TAP-NY, our out-of-town visitors, and the TACL National Board.

A three-course-sit-down dinner will follow, accompanied by performances, a look at our organization’s past success and bright future, and words from luminaries from our community. The evening will conclude with a DJ, open dance floor, and additional mingling. A premium open bar will be available throughout.


We look forward to you joining us for this celebration of the Taiwanese American community.

Learn more about TACL at 

www.tacl.org


Learn more about TAP-NY at 

www.tap-ny.org


For more information and tickets: 

http://30anniversarygala.tacl.org/


Special thanks to our sponsors:

- Anonymous

- Passport to Taiwan

- Bloomingdale's

- EVA Airlines

results.description:
The Culinary Collective will be having its first class on Saturday, September 5th at the Court Tree Collective in Brooklyn.  

What types of things will you cover in this class?


- It is my hope that you will leave the classroom with the knowledge and understanding necessary to be able to cook confidently on a regular basis.  The purpose of this class is to alleviate the notion that cooking requires too much time, a luxury that few of us can afford to waste.  This class will provide a number of fast, simple, and relatively inexpensive options, as well as give home cooks the resources they need to be able to cook more often, regardless of their schedule.  Recipes will be reinforced by ideas, techniques, and resources, and will be supplemented by materials that you will be able to take home with you the next time you're not sure what to cook, or how to cook it.  We will help treat the problem of indecision as well as use shortcuts, and creative use of storage and leftovers to our advantage.


Where will this be taking place?


-  Classes will be held at the Court Tree Collective in Brooklyn.  It is at 371 Court Street on the second floor, right off the Carroll St. stop on the F and G trains.Directions are here.

What types of things will we cook?

- We'll be cooking a few different protein/vegetarian options that can be used to make a multitude of "derivative dishes" for your lunch and/or dinner throughout the week.  Additionally, we'll be making several side dishes.  The menu will be as follows (keep in mind this may be subject to change due to time allotment):

Apple Braised Pork Shoulder

• Sliced Pork with Broccoli Rabe, Apples, Smoked Pork Fat

• Pulled Pork with Carolina BBQ Sauce, Serrano Chiles, and Celeriac Remoulade

• Pork Cincinnati Chili Three Way

Whole Roasted Chicken

• Chicken Legs and Wings with Romesco Sauce

• Moroccan Chicken Salad with Ras El Hanout, Almonds, Dates, and Cilantro

• Roasted Chicken Sandwich with Queso Fresco, Avocado, Pickled Red Onions, and Guasacaca Sauce


Oven Roasted Cauliflower

• Cauliflower Soup with Vadouvan, Pomegranate, and Mint

• Cauliflower Risotto with Saffron, Truffle Cream, and Radishes

• Cauliflower Sandwich with Roasted Garlic Aioli and Chimichurri

Side Dishes

• Brussels Sprouts with Grana Padano and Sherry-Miso Vinaigrette

• Mushrooms in Marmite Butter

• Roasted Potatoes with Truffle Salt

• Sweet Creamed Corn with Smoked Paprika

• Peas, Onions, and Lardons



How much will the class cost?


- The class fee will be $10 per person.  I have tried my best to keep costs to a minimum, however this fee is necessary in order to pay for the space, food, equipment, and teaching materials.  It is 100% my goal to give you the most bang for your buck, and will be packing as much content as I can into our time alotted, and will be distributing teaching materials that you can bring home with you. 

The $10 fee can be paid for via credit card through meetup, or via paypal here.


Alternately, the fee can be paid for in cash at the door as attendance is taken.

I am very excited to be able to offer you these classes at a reasonable cost, and will be counting on your input for more classes in the future.  This looks to be an exciting new chapter for our group, and certainly an amazing opportunity to continue learning and keep challenging yourself in the kitchen.  If you have any questions, feel free to email me personally at [masked].  I look forward to seeing many of you on September 5th, and hope this will be one of many interesting learning experiences to come.


Thanks!


Andy

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

Because of the demand, I have scheduled this walk a second time. This walk is also scheduled on Friday, August 14th. I probably will schedule it a third time.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John, who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo. Thank you again.

Description: The Temperance Movement in the 19th Century was the roots of Prohibition in the 1920s and early 1930s.

By 1830, the average American consumed nearly three times as much alcohol as we drink today and alcohol abuse (primarily by men) was wrecking havoc on some families. The Temperance Movement, which had many women in its ranks, first urged the moderation of alcohol  and then ultimately complete prohibition of alcohol. Later during Prohibition, the manufacture, transportation and sale of alcohol was illegal; however, there were many "side effects" of Prohibition, including the many speakeasies (illegal drinking spots) that popped up. These speakeasies had unmarked doors that led to "intoxication rooms" with velvety interiors. Mayor Fiorello LaGuardia, a NYC mayor in the 1930s and 1940s, once said, "It is impossible to tell whether Prohibition is a good or bad thing. It has never been enforced in this country."

On this walking tour, we will look at some of the symbols of the Temperance Movement in the 19th Century as well as talk about Prohibition speakeasies and the rise and fall of Prohibition in the 1920s and early 1930s. We'll stop outside of four or five faux speakeasies. If we can, we will go inside a faux speakeasy bar that was the site of an actual speakeasy during Prohibition. This speakeasy bar has the décor and interesting artifacts from the Prohibition days of the 1920s. This will be at the end of the tour.

This is a walking tour with much commentary. We'll be walking about 2 1/2 miles. There will be plenty of stopping at points of interest. If you don't like a lot of stopping, then this type of walk is not good for you. The tour lasts about 2 1/4 hours.

Below is an old photo of a slogan for the Temperance movement in the late 19th century. This photograph was taken in Thomas Edison's movie studio at West Orange, NJ. (Source US  Interior Dept., Nat'l Park Service, Thomas Edison Nat'l Historic Site)

Below is an article from The New York Times, August 26, 1887. This was about a Prohibition camp meeting in the Village of Sing Sing.

(Source MCNY [Nathanial Currier & James Merritt Ives ,1874])

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.


Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after dinner) at 7:15 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the entrance to Barnes & Noble Bookstore at 33 East 17th Street, which is between Park Avenue South and Broadway. Before the walk, restrooms are available in Barnes & Noble.

Below is outside of the entrance to Barnes & Noble Bookstore at 33 East 17th Street.

Transportation: Take the 4, 5, 6, L, N, Q, or R subway train to 14th Street and Union Square and then walk north to Barnes & Nobles.

Finishing Time/Place: This walk will finish about 9:50 PM at Norfolk Street and Delancey Street on the Lower East Side.

Rainy weather cancels this walk. Therefore, if it is raining, or the forecast is for rainy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice Saturday. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post the cancellation notice in the Discussion Board.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Thank you.

These were Prohibition agents dumping alcohol in the street during Prohibition. (Source The New York Daily News, circa 1920s)

These were children scrambling to scour up alcohol in the street after it was dumped by Prohibition agents during Prohibition. (Source New York Daily News, circa 1920s)

This was Old Man Prohibition hung in effigy from a flagpole as New York City celebrated the end of Prohibition with the repeal of the 18th Amendment. (Source NYPL [Irma and Paul Milstein Division, 1933])
results.name: History of the Temperance Movement and Prohibition - Walking Tour (Sept. 5)

results.description:
Please note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and 7 of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions about this event .  Please contact the event host Dave Cervini directly at [masked]

The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

Why does the event organizer have +40 for his RSVP's? That is because there are 8 Meetup.com groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com promoting this event.  There will be many more people than what you see below attending.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go? We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.

General Admission is $5.00.  Please bring exact change to the door.

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.description:
Check out the pics from the Walk Around Astoria we did the last time. It was sick!! 


Starting at the end of the N/Q line in Astoria with multiple meetup groups, we will casually stroll down Ditmars Blvd, then saunter along Shore Blvd next to Astoria Park following this route which has amazing views of Hell Gate Bridge, Robert F. Kennedy Bridge, Randall's Island, the East River and New York City. Like really, really amazing! 

Afterwards: If you are inclined, we'll pop on over to a bar/restaurant I like to bring my people to when I hold walking events in Astoria. It's a combination of indoor and outdoor seating and they have a great selection of everything: drinks, food, ambiance, and the subway is right there too. 


Pace/Distance/Duration: The pace of this walk will be easy-going. The total distance is a little over 2 miles. The approximated time from start to finish is 1.5 hours with photo opp stops. 


If this is your first time attending a meetup, try not to worry too much. Around 90% of attendees are first timers so you won't be alone. Most people come solo and I encourage that. In a matter of minutes you'll be engrossed in a conversation with someone and then another and another and so on. Every 10 minutes or so I make the guys switch with the girls so everyone gets a chance to talk to everyone. You'll meet like a trillion people! 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of McDonald's at the last stop of the N/Q line (Ditmars Blvd) and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. Alternatively, if you do not like approaching a massive group of strangers that could only be us, you can CALL the organizer at [masked] 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­

results.description:
This dance features Adina Gordon from Vermont and Tempest from Central New York State. To hear these outstanding performers, dancers will come from several states. Note to anyone considering this as a first contra dance: A top caller is the easiest to learn contra dancing from because she's so good at what she does.

If it's your first time, we recommend the beginners' workshop. You'll learn many of the basic figures of contra dancing, which will make the dance more fun. And because some experienced dancers always attend the beginners' workshop to help out, you'll get to know and meet people before the dance itself begins.

The beginners' workshop starts at 7:30; the dance begins at 8 PM. Fee is $15 adult/$10 student. Because of the performer talent level, this dance is $5 more than most of our dances. It's a great value.


Experienced contra dancers will enjoy not only this dance but also the afternoon dance, which runs from 4-6 PM. For the afternoon dance, see http://www.meetup.com/East-Hanover-Contra-Dance/events/221776497/
results.name: Let's contra dance to Adina Gordon and Tempest

Wednesday, September 2: National TPP Resistance Call

Saturday, September 5: Reclaim our Planet! Reclaim our Future! A Webinar on Development Justice & System Change 

Our friends at Bayan USA encourage you to join this informative event! Participate in person or via webinar!

Saturday, Sept 12: TPP Outreach at the NYC Labor Day Parade

Sunday, Sept 13: SAVE THE DATE: TPP Fall Campaign Strategy Meeting


Sunday, Sept 13: TPP, Obama's Pacific Pivot, and Popular Resistance in the Asia-Pacific Region: A National TPP Webinar with Bernadette Ellorin of Bayan USA

Wednesday, Sept 16: National TPP Resistance Call

Sunday, September 20: National TPP Conference Call. Details TBA.

Friday, Sept 25: Park Slope Food Coop International Trade Education Squad Public Forum

Friday, Sept 25 - Saturday, Sept 26:  International Tribunal of Conscience on Crimes against the People of Mexico

Focused on the implications of the current human rights crisis in Mexico for U.S policy regarding NAFTA and the drug war, and their relationship to human rights issues in the U.S.

Saturday, Sept 26: TPP vs. Sustainable Development Goals Event

w/Asia Pacific Forum on Women, Law and Development (APWLD). Details TBA.

Sunday, Sept 27: National TPP Conference Call & Webinar

Details TBA.

Monday, Sept 28: Dialogues for Justice and the Common Good: From the Margins to the Frontlines

 On the day after the UN Summit on development, hear the perspective from the margins and the frontlines - those most affected by the current unjust and unsustainable mode of development. Featuring a workshop on unfair international trade and the global financial system organized by TradeJustice NY Metro Time: 10AM-6PM Location: UN Church Center, 44th Street at 1st Avenue, Manhattan Directions: 4,5, 6, or 7 to 42nd Street- Grand Central Terminal. M42 bus to 1st Avenue.    

TradeJustice New York Metro

results.description:
Please note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and 7 of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions about this event .  Please contact the event host Dave Cervini directly at [masked]


The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

Why does the event organizer have +40 for his RSVP's? That is because there are 8 Meetup.com groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com promoting this event.  There will be many more people than what you see below attending.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.

General Admission is $5.00.  Please bring exact change to the door.

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.description:
In town for Labor Day weekend? Looking to meet new people in a friendly, private and casual environment? Join us for this private multi-group social for all new and existing members. 

Forget about overcrowded bars, long lines to get in and people with attitudes. This will be one of the most friendliest and social Meetups you'll experience! 

We will have our staff there to welcome all members and help introduce you to each other.  It's fun and laid back event that creates the perfect opportunity to make new friends.  

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT DOOR) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Sep-05-2015_at_0800PM

What to expect: 

• Complimentary Hot & Cold Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials (8-9pm)

• Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling 

• Socialize, Network & Connect With Other Members

PREPAY ONLY ($10 - Price goes to $15 as event gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Sep-05-2015_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own.

How many people attend? 50-75 Meetup members. This is not meant to be age/ethnic specific. All are welcome 21+.

What's venue like? The World Bar is an upscale lounge with lots of room to sit or wander around while meeting others. 

What do I wear? Neat casual.

How do I get there? Take any east side line (4,5,6) trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then short walk towards the East River.

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Sep-05-2015_at_0800PM

group.name: ! A Fun & Adventures With Strangers - New York

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.

NYSN has been planning events in and around the city for busy professionals!  There are so many events to choose from, sometimes it is hard to figure out what is best especially if you have never been out.  If you are new to the groups or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. The Night Will Feature:

-drink specials until 9pm

-music played at conversational levels

-lot's of room to sit, stand , socialize, network and connect

-60-80 members

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending usually come on their own.

Dress: club, lounge, neat

How do I get there? The World Bar is located on the ground floor of the World Tower on the corner of 1st ave and east 48th.  The 51st and 42nd street subways are closest then a few blocks walk.

results.name: Private Member Saturday Night Social (Comp Apps, Drink Specials) Prepay Only

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The Campbell Terrace is a cool , covered outdoor patio on the east side of Grand Central.
Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 in advance only - $10 at door if available

Prepay here:
 http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.
results.name: Multi-Group Private Member Social Happy Hour - Over 50 prepaid

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:
You've spent all week busting your hump! Now it's time to unwind, loosen up the tie, say inappropriate things, get hammered, and most importantly laugh til it hurts!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and get over the hump with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager- Free Comedy Show

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and get over the hump with some laughs!

results.description:
Greetings Fellow Travelers!


We're going to try something different for this trip.  We're going to travel to Strawberry Fields in Central Park, NY to meet and visit with John Lennon!  This area is dedicated to John Lennon.  http://www.centralparknyc.org/things-to-see-and-do/attractions/strawberry-fields.html

For anyone who doesn't know who John Lennon is, you can visit here and find out:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Lenno

John has already heard our invitation, because we've put out the call.  But, the more group energy we have for this trip the more of John Lennon's energy will be focused toward/with our group.  As you already know, cohesive group energy is a very powerful thing! 


As always, the hope for this journey is to connect with other group members, sit and visit with John Lennon and maybe bring back some information, and of course, some great experiences.  Before taking your trip, you might want to think of any questions you would like to ask John during your visit. 


Again, you can journey to our meeting place to meet with John Lennon with a clear intent through OOBE or Astral Travel, Lucid dreaming, Meditation and/or Remote Viewing.  


Go here to read up on some directions on how to travel:  http://www.meetup.com/Astral-and-Higher-Plane-Journeys-Workshop-Group/messages/boards/thread/48685588

Our intent is to meet other group members and any other equally or higher evolved beings that are in the vicinity.   So, please include your intent of meeting our group members when you do state your intent. 


Again, since time does not exist in the higher planes, you do not have to travel at the time and date scheduled in order to achieve and meet other members there.  I just needed to put in a time.  The goal is to create a cohesive journeying unit which can be very powerful for everyone involved.  You can make your journey at any time that is convenient for you.  All you need to do is state your intent for your trip, and to meet the group members there.  

And afterward, please make sure to share your experiences here with the group.  What you share may trigger memories in other members.  

Again, the intent is for this to be an interactive group, so please post any questions, etc freely.  I'm really excited about this trip!  I'll see you there!  


Sharon  :)
results.how_to_find_us: Intent and Focus
results.name: Visit with John Lennon!

results.description:
freedomnights.com
Freedom Nights is an Electronic Dance Music (EDM) event
whichll be a throwback to the way things were done before events were @ the mercy of Club owners & Bottle service & freespiritedness reigned true. Were converting an offbroadway theatre into a DJ Playground filled with State of the Art Intelligent Electronica, Sound & Lighting. The Producers Club is an ideal choice for this kind of event. One of the trendiest venues in NYC, this intimate, vibrant two story building combines the look & feel of theatrical decor complete with exposed brick, stage settings, stylish aesthetics, maze rooms, and anechoic acoustics. This sleeper venue houses multiple partitioned rooms setting the stage for showcasing NYC's accomplished spinners of the sonic groove. Eyegasm will create their visual magic in transforming this unique backdrop into a kaleidoscope of synchronized intelligent & gorgeous stage lighting in a dazzling display of cutting edge optics. Diversified Audio installed over 25,000 watts of QSC crystal clear, non fatiguing sound that is networked and amped. Earth quaking subs will shake the foundation & your chest. A Stellar Line up:

S T Y M I E K (Labworks) Producer -DJ
https://soundcloud.com/stymiek
a Purveyor of Hypnotic, progressive Techno & an Alchemist of Infectious grooves” will bring his pounding beats and driving rhythms to the party. PHARMHOUSE
https://soundcloud.com/pharmhouse
Celebrating his record release "Fibonachi's Groove", Pharmhouse will grace the wheels of steel with her eclectic mix of Dubstep and progressive house. Seductive, sexy & pulsating her set is highly anticipated to set the dance floor on fire. AMINA ZENA
https://www.mixcloud.com/discover/aminazena/
Amina Zena passion for hard hitting Progressive House is palpable & commands respect. Amina is preparing a special set of epic & exclusive dubplates, unreleased works & proper Progressive House. This is a set not to be missed! MADAM MARVELOUS

Beatport chart topping international Electronic Dance Music artist Madam Marvelous will electrify the house with pulsating sounds - Always celebrating Provocativeness and Freakdom.

JOHNNY V

Join us for our Saturday night for our Labor Day weekend party @ Slate NYC. Many of our Meetup groups will be joining us for the fun evening!

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans,

Round 12 of the 2015 Formula One season brings us to one of F1’s great venues – Italy’s Autodromo Nazionale di Monza. The 5.793 km circuit is the fastest track on the calendar. Built in 1922, it has hosted the Italian Grand Prix every year since 1950, with the sole exception of 1980, when it was held at Imola. The cars are set up with one of the smallest wing angles to ensure the lowest level of drag on the straights. The flat out nature of the track also means that engines take more punishment than at most circuits with up to 70 percent of a lap being run at full throttle. 

STANDINGS - After winning at Spa, Lewis Hamilton has extended his lead to 28 points in the Drivers' championship. He leads the standings with 227 points while Nico Rosberg sits in second with 199 points and Sebastian Vettel in third with 160 points. In the Constructors’ battle Mercedes still has a commanding lead of 426 points with Ferrari in 2nd with 242 points and Williams in 3rd with 161 points.

TIRE ALLOCATION - Unlike last year, Pirelli will be bringing the P Zero White medium and Yellow soft tires (one level softer). The lowest downforce set-up of the year used in Monza to extract maximum speed on the fast straights means that the tires have to provide all the mechanical grip necessary to get the cars through the corners.

DRS ZONES - There are two DRS zones. The detection point of the first will be just before Turn 7 with activation just after Turn 7. The second detection point will be just before Turn 11. The activation point will be just after the start/finish line.

After his redemption win in Belgium, Lewis Hamilton looks to win again and extend his lead in Italy. So can Nico Rosberg win in Italy and close the gap? Can Sebastian Vettel redeem himself from his retirement at Spa with a victory? If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Italian Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. Race will start at 08:00AM EDT with the pre-race starting at 07:30AM EDT. It's going to be another fantastic race.

We hope to see you all!

results.description:
Lakeview Marina Welcomes You

Lakeview Marina & Ski Instruction has all the necessary equipment for all levels. We utilize only the top of the line ski's, wakeboards and safety equipment. Steve Halperin has been water-skiing for over 43 years.

From Wakeboarding, Sking, Knee Boarding, Air Chair & Tubing. Lakeview Marina has it all.

Steven told me they also offer Zup Boarding, which is like a easier version of wake boarding to me. Check out Zup Boarding here: http://zup.com/

Steve is licensed with the American Water Ski Association (AWSA), and has completed the Level II Coaching Course at the International Tournament Skiing, in Okahumpka, FLorida, the same training facility for the U.S. Ski Team. He is fully certified & insured to teach any water sport.

Learn to ski with the state of the art, Team Air Nautique, Tournament Wakeboard Boat and Mastercraft X-45.

After the event, we can have late lunch together at a local restaurant.

Depart Date: September 6th Sunday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier than departing time. We will depart sharp on time. (Event Time: 10:30 AM- 1:30 PM)

Depart 7:45 AM: [masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Outside Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel) (Map)

Depart 8:30 AM: Northwest corner of 43rd St and 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Garden City Deli) (Map)

Return: Departs from Lake Marina 3:00 PM & get back NYC around 4:45 PM & Flushing 5:30 PM.

Cost: Early birds $79 for 20 minutes (limited spots) or $99 for 30 minutes for first 6 spots or 10 days in advance; Regular $115 for 30 minutes afterward. Please only RSVP here after you have purchased the ticket.

Trip includes: Round trip transportation from NYC, 30 minutes of wakeboarding or water skiing lesson & land instruction, and another 2 to 2.5 hours boat ride while other members wakeboarding. 

Buy Ticket Here: http://sep2015wakeboarding.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) Your spot is not confirmed until your payment is received.

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $10 processing fee if cancelled 2 weeks in advance;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, you can transfer your spot to other with $10 transfer fee.

Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

results.description:
Arowana's Dragon Boat season runs through mid-September.

The new members will meet up on the docks promptly approximately 30 minutes before the start time. We will require waivers to be filled out and then start with stretches followed by basic dragon boat paddling with you on land. Afterwards, we will take the boat out and paddle. No previous skill required. Arowana will provides life vests and paddles. We recommend bringing a bottle of water, sun screen and wear clothing that you will be OK getting wet, swimwear being best. Shades, gloves and hat are worn by most of our paddlers as well but are not required. Practice lasts roughly 2 hours.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Our practices are on a first-come-first-serve basis. We may or may not be able to accommodate everyone on any given weekend, and there may be a waiting list on the event. Please update your responses if your plans change so that we may make space for those on the wait list.

PLEASE NOTE EARLY SEASON PADDLING WILL BE COLD, BRING A WATERPROOF JACKET!

Sometimes we grab lunch afterward in Flushing, you are welcome to join us.

This series of Meetups is catered to introduction to dragon boat. Our veteran members will be paddling alongside you as well. If you like'd to be added to our team mailing list, please ask Lin or Selene for additional details.

Arowana will be participating in The New York Hong Kong Dragon Boat Festival in Corona Park this August and possibly other races during the course of the year.

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Try It You'll Like It and if you do, sign up and start your lessons the same day. Plus we'll credit your try SCUBA payment towards the class and give you a $50 Off, coupon for your "Student Package"

For anyone who wants to test the waters, this is the Scuba Discovery Program. It gives you a glimpse into what you can expect to see in the underwater world as well as what you could expect to learn in the Scuba Diver Course. You will be shown the basic safety procedures for scuba diving under the watchful eye of an instructor. You will learn skills like equalizing your ears, buddy checks, basic buoyancy control, underwater communication and an introduction to basic scuba equipment and scuba skills followed by an underwater dive in the pool. If you enjoy this experience then the Open Water Scuba Diver course is your next step.

Need more info? Call the Dive Center[masked]

What's Required?

• A curiosity about scuba diving

• A swimsuit and a towel

If you have a mask, snorkel, and fins, bring them.

If not, we'll loan you ours – we will provide everything else!

If all spots are filled get on the waiting list we may run a 2nd session that day

Cost: $25.00 Click to Pay Now! (Get back a $25 coupon for Lessons)

If at the end of the session you are ready to start. YTou can sign up on the spot and hop right back in.

Just bring a bathing suit and towel and leave everything else to us!

IMPORTANT:

Please print and complete the following three forms to bring to the pool

• SDI General Waiver for all Courses

• SDI Medical Info Waiver

• Student Information Form

Please note that the entrance to the pool where "Try Scuba" is being held is located in the rear parking lot of the Lodi Boys and Girls Club.

Become a Premium Member Learn more...

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
NEW CLASS STARTS TODAY

This is pool session one for new students starting their diving course and a continuation of Lessons.

Your Journey to Adventure starts today. After a brief presentation we will gear up and get started in the pool.

If you have not yet enrolled, please contact the Dive Center to get started [masked]

RSVP required

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must: 
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6

CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.  Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

1. SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks:

"Instructors": F. Ventura  &  C.K. Scharf, the

"Facility": 1-877-SCUBA-USA",

"Agency" : SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then,

Sign and date at bottom

2. SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

3. Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

Using Dive Computers; To help familiarize you with how they work go to: Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
This small figure 8 hike at the Parsippany Mountain Way Park is a hidden gem of Morris County. It's a quick hike, just slightly over 2 miles but it has a nice vista, some cool Revolutionary War history, and some impressive glacial erratics. This trail also connects to Morris County's Center Park for even more trails. There is only one small steep area so sneakers are fine if ground is dry. Bring a hiking stick if you have knee trouble. Total time is about an hour. This is a perfect hike if you are just getting back into hiking or if this is your first one. We'll take our time, no one will be left behind. Usual disclaimers about health apply of course. If you have not done this hike before, I'm sure you'll want to come back when you need a quick "nature fix" :) Trying for this Sunday. If it does not work we can try for Monday or another time.

Directions from Speedwell/202 Morris Plain :
From 202 North, take slight left onto Speedwell. Speedwell turns to Grannis Ave. Drive through Morris Plains. (Do not turn at Mountain Way in MP -- Dead end).
Turn right on Meadow Bluff Road; Meadow Bluff Road bears left and turns into Mountain way. Park is on right side about 1/2 mile or so up road. Please don't go over speed limit on this road. Parsippany Police love giving out tickets here. :) Hope to see you there.
results.name: Quick AM hike -- Mountain Way Trail, Parsippany

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
Let's get together and explore small river towns of Cortland and Croton on Hudson
We'll explore and hike thru Georges Island park, Oscawana park, Croton Point park and finally, if time allows us, we'll visit Van Cortlandt Manor as well.
Distance: 10 (plus, minus) miles RT from the Cortlandt station to Croton-Harmon station
Hiking pace : from 2 to 1.5 miles per hour
Terrain: level, flat and shaded walking path.
Meeting time and place: 
9:20 am at Grand Central or 10:43am at Cortlandt station.
“Meet me under the clock” of the Grand Central Terminal Station information booth, located in the main concourse area.
I suggest arriving at Grand Central station at 9:20am, so you'll have time to buy your ticket (there is often a line).
We have to get 9:43 am metro-north rail road tickets to Cortlandt staition NY.
We will aim for the 5:00pm train from Croton-Harmon station back to Grand Central Terminal.
My cell: #[masked]
Cost: metro-north rail road is about $ 28
Car drivers: please, write in your RSVP if you are driving and from where and if you're willing to offer a ride to fellow hikers. We'll meet at the Cortlandt station at 10:43am
Please, wear the proper shoes and attire for a hike in the woods. (No high heels etc.) Please, bring water
and bug repellent. Also, somewhere along the way, we'll have a picnic, so bring snacks or light picnic food.

results.description:
Mother nature is preparing a gorgeous Labor Day weekend - it would be a shame to let it go to waste.

We are planning another getaway for the upcoming Sunday. The trip has been planned mostly by me; Dave is not sure whether he will be able to join us on this ride. In case Dave cannot make it, the ride will still happen and the role of the leader will fall on me.

The ride will take us through Harriman SP, to Storm King Highway, Rte 301, beautiful Lake Lillinonah in CT and misc back roads. The length of the trip is about 190 miles. As usual, there will be several stops along the way to relax, take pics, chill and eat. Lunch (maybe pizza) in Carmel, NY.

Bring your camera, light snack and water for stops away from civilization.

Please fill up before the ride. Meet at 9:30 in Planet Fitness parking lot. Ride will be preceded by a safety briefing and route introduction. 10:00 kickstands up.

See you all there!

PeterD

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

We will take the morning train to the beautiful beach and stay all day and at night have a quick dinner before heading back to the city!

1) Make sure you buy the weekend getaway pass so you get a free beach pass or you will have to buy that separately.

http://web.mta.info/lirr/getaways/beach/longbeach.htm

2) We will catch the  10:09 AM nonstop train but get there early so you can buy a ticket from the machine and meet us near the waiting area (has a bathroom) make sure you buy the getaway round trip ticket

3) If you miss that train we will be near the Lifeguard station on Lincoln Blvd which is about a 15 minute walk from the train station.

4) There are a few hotels if you are interested in staying overnight

5) Text if you need to find us[masked] ( no calls will be accepted).


A few groups will be joining us

results.description:
MEETING DETAILS SENT OUT 8:30 A.M SATURDAY TO ALL THOSE WHO RSVP'D. IF YOU DO NOT GET THE E-MAIL, SEND ME AN E-MAIL IMMEDIATELY-DON'T POST A COMMENT -WITH YOUR PERSONAL E-MAIL ADDRESS AND I WILL RESEND TO YOU.


RSVP'S CLOSED

PLEASE READ THIS CAREFULLY BEFORE YOU RSVP. I SUBSCRIBE TO THE RADICAL VIEW THAT IF YOU RSVP FOR A MEETUP EVENT, YOU SHOULD SHOW UP. 

If you are not going away Labor Day weekend, join me and AMC Club members who do not have to RSVP, on a fast paced 6 mile expedition in Central Park on Labor Day weekend. I like to do an in depth tour of the Park on New Year’s Day and on Memorial Day weekend but this will be a little different-and longer. (I have also posted something for Friday evening September 4)


We will cover most of the Park. I’ll only stop very briefly a number of times to talk about what we see and I’ll sometimes provide commentary as we move. We’ll spend some time in the Ramble and we’ll see the waterfalls in the North Woods and walk into the woods a bit for some excitement. We’ll also be visiting a lot of other sites as well. Hopefully, you will see the Park like you never saw it before.

WE WILL BEGIN BEFORE 10:00 A.M. BE READY TO GO. NO FOOD STOPS

MEETING DETAILS WILL BE SENT BY E-MAIL TO THOSE WHO RSVP THE EVENING BEFORE THE HIKE. 

Please consider joining the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) http://www.amc-ny.org/ The Club offers many hikes, walks and events and is also active in conservation efforts and trail maintenance. Only a few of the many hikes and walks that are offered by AMC leaders are posted on Meetup. 

Since this event will be posted as a last minute hike to AMC Club members, there is NO need for AMC club members to RSVP for this-unless you don’t get last minute e-mails from Yahoo. (Contact me if you are a dues paying AMC Club member and don’t get these e-mails and I’ll tell you how). Let’s leave 10 spaces for AMC Meetup members. Needless to say, please take the RSVP process seriously and be considerate. If you have been a NO SHOW on any previous AMC Meetup events that I have led or are a chronic abuser of the RSVP process –see your Attendance History- please do not sign up for this event because I am just going to delete your RSVP. Let someone else go who will actually show up. PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO THOSE WHO HAVE PREVIOUSLY ATTENDED OTHER AMC MEETUP EVENTS.

 I am going to ask that people not post any comments or questions prior to the event. You have more than enough information to do this once you get the meeting details. No offense, but I don’t need to know-and probably neither does anyone else- what you are doing that day if you can’t make it or what you think the weather will be. AFTER the event, post as many comments and photos as you like.

If the weather forecast is really bad, See the Accuweather website like I do, I will post a notice on the day of the hike by 7:00 A.M. If there is no notice, we go. We will finish around 2:00 p.m. in mid Park.

UPDATED TRAIN INFORMATION:

Train schedule from Grand Central to Tarrytown : 

9:20 local train making all stops to Tarrytown arrives Tarrytown at 10:13.

9:43 express train stops at Harlem/125th Street at 9:54 then next stop is Tarrytown arriving 10:22.

Here is a link to the schedule: Hudson Line Schedule 

Hike from Tarrytown to Hasting on Hudson, walking the Old Croton Aqueduct and the Westchester River Walk, approx 8 miles on gravel/paved trails and streets, mostly flat with some hills to and from train stations. 

Walk through Dobbs ferry, Ardsley on Hudson, and Irvington on Hudson with bars in every town and return to Tarrytown  by train. Drop outs at train stations in towns. 

The OCA built in 1842 was 41 miles long and brought water from the Croton reservoir to NYC. 

Drivers can park free at the Tarrytown station, if parking is full, cross over tracks and park by rec center close to tennis courts (with bathrooms).

BRING LUNCH, SNACKS ,WATER. LUNCH BY HUDSON RIVER PARK A GREAT OUTDOOR RESTURANT AND VIEW AT TRAIL END


MEET HIKE LEADER AT TARRYTOWN TRAIN STATION.

LEADER: Richard Mohovich, 


[masked],  [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.

results.description:
Before fall makes its presence known, enjoy a summery Sunday morning in Prospect Park. 

If you are around this Labor Day weekend, come take a 45 minute vacay in Prospect Park. The first 10 minutes will be a little about meditation/getting comfortable, then 25-30 minutes of guided meditation using the breath, sound and mantra meditation and voila, the remainder for comments, questions and community.


We'll be at the green space east of the picnic house-- on the long meadow! https://www.prospectpark.org/visit-the-park/park-map/.  With your back to the picnic house, walk down the path towards the sun. Then LOOK FOR THE FADED RED BLANKET. 

Remember to wear something comfortable and bring a chair, cushion and/or mat to sit on... bring anything really that will allow you to sit ease-fully for 45 minutes. $5 suggested donation. 

Jess

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

Tickets: https://goo.gl/9tYDJP

A lot of times folks hear the name Breakneck Ridge and get a certain image in their head, though it is almost always different. For some the image is of crowds lining up to climb the boulders, slabs and cracks and trash filled trails. For others the image is of a beautiful adult playground with endless possibility for exploration, discovery and challenge. We would like to share our unique perspective on this location with all of you.

Breakneck was one of my very first "real" hikes and is one of the main reasons I am a guide today and while I admit that on the weekends it can get quite busy, it does not take away from the amazing experience waiting to be had. The most striking thing about this adventure is its contrast; the first part of the day involves a steep scramble up the side of a cliff with constant, breathtaking views up and down the Hudson River that get more panoramic with every step and the second half of the hike finds us in thick woods surrounded by the abandoned buildings, roads and ruins of the Cornish Estate.

This hike is steep and challenging, we have designed it for those of you who want to put your fitness and courage to the test. That being said, we are always willing to guide those who are motivated to push their limits both physically and mentally!

*Please remember that this Meetup listing may not have accurate information - the people who have RSVPed may not have PAID/SIGNED UP. Please check attached link for the most accurate details!

results.description:
We've got a brand new series called "Made for Mondays" that will be about our calling to be salt and light during the rest of the week, not just on Sundays.  That could mean in the workplace or wherever you may find yourself during the week.

This is a four-week series, divided into two parts. We will have a message on Sundays from 10:30am - 11:30am and supplement that with a weekly Wednesday night life class from 7pm - 9pm. 

You're welcome anytime.  Feel free to jump in on the series if you can't make the first week.  There's no obligation to be there on both Sunday and Wednesday.  You can attend either or, although we recommend joining both the Sunday message and Wednesday discussion to get the most out of the entire series :)

Let's be honest…does anybody really like Mondays?  Check out this funny promo video about the upcoming series:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FCcxw15GFbQ&feature=youtu.be

"Made For Monday" schedule:

- Sun, Sept 6th (Message #1)

- Wed, Sept 9th (Discussion #1)

- Sun, Sept 13th (Message #2)

- Wed, Sept 16th (Discussion #2)

- Sun, Sept 20th (Message #3)

- Wed, Sept 23rd (Discussion #3)

- Sun, Sept 27th (Message #4)

- Wed, Sept 30th (Discussion #4)

Please note: While we hold our weekly Wednesday life classes and Sunday services at the New York Society of Ethical Culture, we are not associated with their beliefs and values.

results.description:
Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my class!

WELCOME TO OUTDOOR YOGA!

RESUMING ON LABOR DAY SUNDAY -- COME CHILL WITH US!

As the temperature rises, so does our internal fire that when unbalance (overheated), can easily affect one's body, emotion, and mind. Therefore, we will take a break from the High Sun til Sept.

Join us then for an especially designed weekly sequence that includes breathing exercise, light vinyasa flow, and a sweet cool down. Come and prepare for CHANGE (seasonal and beyond). Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space. One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, expert hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.
