results.description:
Tickets: https://goo.gl/9tYDJP

A lot of times folks hear the name Breakneck Ridge and get a certain image in their head, though it is almost always different. For some the image is of crowds lining up to climb the boulders, slabs and cracks and trash filled trails. For others the image is of a beautiful adult playground with endless possibility for exploration, discovery and challenge. We would like to share our unique perspective on this location with all of you.

Breakneck was one of my very first "real" hikes and is one of the main reasons I am a guide today and while I admit that on the weekends it can get quite busy, it does not take away from the amazing experience waiting to be had. The most striking thing about this adventure is its contrast; the first part of the day involves a steep scramble up the side of a cliff with constant, breathtaking views up and down the Hudson River that get more panoramic with every step and the second half of the hike finds us in thick woods surrounded by the abandoned buildings, roads and ruins of the Cornish Estate.

This hike is steep and challenging, we have designed it for those of you who want to put your fitness and courage to the test. That being said, we are always willing to guide those who are motivated to push their limits both physically and mentally!

*Please remember that this Meetup listing may not have accurate information - the people who have RSVPed may not have PAID/SIGNED UP. Please check attached link for the most accurate details!

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/Sept.%206%20speaker.jpg?itok=qphi9JbM Joe Rinehart, Peer Advisor in the Democracy at Work Network’s Technical Assistance Program

Monica Weiss Presides 

A worker cooperative is a values-driven business that puts worker and community benefit at the core of its purpose. Interest in worker cooperatives and cooperative development is growing. Though we don’t yet have comprehensive data on the nature and scope of worker cooperatives in the U.S., researchers and practitioners estimate that there are[masked] democratic workplaces in the United States, employing around 7,000 people and generating over $400 million in annual revenues. The number of worker cooperatives has grown steadily over the past 20 years, and is made up of both well-established businesses and new, growing ones, increasingly including some businesses that have been sold to their employees by their owners. Joe, a long time social justice and environmental activist, and guests will share their experiences with us. 

Joe Rinehart is a cooperative developer and advocate for undermining economic inequality through shared ownership.  He is a former worker owner at Firestorm Café and Books in Asheville, North Carolina and instructor at Appalachian State University.  He recently left his position as Director of Cooperative Development at the Democracy at Work Institute where he helped guide and support the coalition that garnered NYC’s ground breaking $1.2 million dollar investment in worker cooperatives.  Prior to his time as a cooperative worker owner, he completed a Master’s degree in Industrial Technology at Appalachian State University with a focus on small scale technologies that empower communities and protect the environment.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

<a>
</a>

results.description:
Good Work

Facilitator: Jone Johnson Lewis, Leader, Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture

Details: Joan Chittister, from a Benedictine point of view, writes about work, asking if it is good work, “work that makes the world a better, more just, more fair, and more humane place for everyone…. Good work is a human being’s contribution to the development of humankind and the fulfillment of the universe.”

A colloquy is a participative, guided sharing of feelings and thoughts.  Our colloquy this morning, on the weekend which America celebrates as Labor Day, will look at the meanings of work that is broader than just jobs.  Jobs today are often unsatisfying, even if one can find one and is able to work.  Work includes, again in the words of Chittester, “the smallest and meanest of tasks.”

What work have we done, can we do, to build that more humane world — work from the smallest tasks to those more challenging?

*Donations this week will be split with Bronxworks.

About the Facilitator: Jone Johnson Lewis is the new clergy Leader at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. Jone has been an Ethical Culture Leader since 1991, serving Ethical Societies in Chicago, Northern Virginia and Brooklyn. She's currently the President of the National Council of Leaders and a member of the American Ethical Union's Membership Committee.

Sunday programs are held at 11:00 AM at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. For more information, please visit our website: <a>http://www.rysec.org </a>;

results.description:
Splitrock Reservoir is a gem of a place. Nestled between the Stonybrook and Greenpond mountains, its shoreline is largely undeveloped, save the dam at the south end.

Outside the distant drone of automobiles and occasional roar of passing jets, there are few clues that you're smack in the middle of the most densely populated state in the US. It doesn't take too much imagination to picture you're paddling a remote Adirondack pond.

Splitrock is large enough that your fellow paddlers are well spread out and you get a feeling of solitude that is rare in the NY/NJ metro area.

The reservoir and surrounding land is owned by the City of Jersey City and the public may access the water body for fishing and kayaking only from the public access parking area located near the dam. Only Car top watercraft is permitted providing it is launched from the access located at the parking area.

DIRECTIONS: 
I-287 to exit 43 to north on Fanny Road to Powerville Road, left on Valley Road, eight on Rockaway Valley Road, left on Split Rock Road which turns to gravel, parking lot on right at Reservoir.

Rt. 80 to exit 37 to Green Pond Rd. (Rt. 513), right on Upper Hibernia Rd, left on Split Rock Rd., go over dam and parking on left.

Rt. 46-Denville turn on Rt. 53 East Main St. (to Denville), right on Diamond Spring Rd.,  turns into Rockaway Valley Rd, left on Split Rock Rd., parking on the right.

Horseback Riding Tips:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S1RvLx_81vA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Z_Lh5elmDI

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kVNXvdruMG4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UVCUSoIhx3o

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JWeiXjeAtfg

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4rk9pQOKnK0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mkhXdJJRH90

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=77R6FlnHL2M

More:

If the horse is taking advantage of you by pinning their ears or kicking out in order to get out of doing something, say "No!" In a calm but firm voice and make them do what you are asking or telling them to do. Under no circumstance should you let the horse get away with that kind of behavior if you are sure that you can handle it.

As you approach the horse to mount, walk tall and straight with your head up. Take firm, confident strides. Show the horse you are not afraid.

Never let your horse walk past your shoulder; if he does back him up! His nose should be right at or behind your shoulder!

If your horse is up to weight, don't feed him lots of treats.

If your horse has a tendency to jump away or walk too quickly when you are walking him on the lead, make him run circles around you, using the lead to lunge him in a circle. If he wants to put more effort into misbehaving, make it your idea and MAKE him do what he wants to do, and then he will not want to do it anymore and will eventually realize it isn't worth putting so much energy into being silly for no reason.

If you are really quite nervous around your horse and not sure how to conquer this problem, try making yourself yawn. This physically relaxes your system and outwardly displays a calm and casual appearance to your horse who will pick up on even the slightest feeling of nervousness. Another tactic is to actually laugh whilst in the saddle if you or the horse is afraid about something. Although it sounds ridiculous, it's amazing how much your horse is able to pick up on what feelings these actions are associated with!

When feeding treats, don't let your horse be pushy or try to take them from you. Instead, hold the treat in your fist, and wait for the horse to stop nuzzling you or look away to give it the treat. This teaches them to respect you, and eventually they will not nuzzle for a treat.

When your horse does the right thing, be sure to reward him or her. If you don't, the horse won't know what (s)he is being asked to do, and may keep doing the wrong thing because they think it is what you are asking.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Your attendance as well as your guests on a hike or other event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you and your guests are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes/ events, you are your own leader- This is YOUR thing.
results.name: Horseback Riding Series Part 5 @ Bridle Hill Farm + BBQ @ Akim's

results.description:
Depending on what time you take the ferry - there could be a $2 ferry fee (from Manhattan and Brooklyn). (So make sure you have cash, because I'm not sure if they take credit card). There is also apparently an East River Ferry, but this costs $6. Here is a link to ferry information/schedules.  


There usually is a long line outside the ferry on the Manhattan side so this may affect which ferry you take. I'll probably arrive at the terminal at 10:30AM so If you are in line afterwards tell me where you are in line so we can try to stand together. (Just message me from meetup.) This can be difficult to coordinate so I can't guarantee we can all line up together). 

(Directions to terminal are in the first link.). For those coming from Brooklyn or the East River Ferry, once I arrive on the island I'll post a meetup location. 

 The idea is that we all meet on GI around 11:30AM.

The plan is that we spend the day on Governors Island (GI) and explore and have a picnic lunch (bring your own food/drink, or money to buy lunch on the island.) You can NOT bring Alcohol, but if you want to enjoy a drink you can purchase a drink on the island and drink it in a designated area (http://govisland.com/activities/food). You might also want to bring a towel or small blanket to sit on. I'll bring a blanket, or table cloth so a couple of us can share. (This will be placed on the grass, so if you bring something make sure you don't mind if if gets a little dirty). Plan on being outside for the day (Sunday is supposed to be a sunny day.

Also, one member suggested a potluck - where we each bring an item to share. This is optional- if you are interested in this, post to the comments what you will be bringing to share. (As I can't guarantee who will attend you might want to make sure you have enough food/drink for yourself in case someone cancels.)

Here is more info about the food and bathrooms on the island: http://govisland.com/info/visitor-services


(Also note that this meetup is scheduled over Labor Day Weekend.) In case of rain this meetup will be rescheduled.


Here are Maps of GI:


http://govisland.com/info/downloadable-map


http://govisland.com/map
results.name: Explore Governors Island  and meet new friends(1)

results.description:
Join 40 other Meetup members already prepaid for this event!  Less than 5 tickets left!  GET TICKETS HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yankees/

It doesn't matter if you're a big baseball fan or not, this will be a fun day out at the ballpark for all!  Enjoy the game, make some new friends, and maybe more!   

How it works / Itinerary:  

The game starts at 1pm on Sun, Sept 6th, and we will have a pre-mingle from 11:30am-12:45pm at a local bar/pub near the ballpark (location announced only to those who have paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you the game tickets.

Our host will greet you, and introduce you to other singles in the group. Food and drink will be available for purchase. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age specific. All are welcome.

You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 12:45pm. If you arrive after 12:45pm you will not be able to find the group. 

Price includes a ticket to the game (400 level seating) & pre-mingle. 

Tickets are $45.75 - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yankees/

Can I come alone?  Yes, 90% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +40? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  40-50 members will be attending.

How do I attend? In addition to RSVP'ing you must also buy tickets in advance.  An RSVP alone will not hold your spot and this will sell out!  Get tix here -http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yankees/

Price includes a ticket to the game (400 level seating) & pre-mingle. 

Tickets are $45.75 - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yankees/

Can I come alone?  Yes, 90% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +40? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  40-50 members will be attending.

How do I attend? In addition to RSVP'ing you must also buy tickets in advance.  An RSVP alone will not hold your spot and this will sell out!  Get tix here -http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/yankees/

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12pm-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Welcome back everyone! Come <a>play</a> some <a>beach volleyball</a> :) <a>Games</a> will be 4x4, rotating 3 teams, rally scoring to 15. 

Things to Know: Wondering what intermediate means? <a>Simply</a> put, you know what second ball means, and you can bump, set and spike.

Over all you can receive a <a>serve</a> and get it to the setter, reliably serve  and hot the ball over the net.  

Here is a <a>video</a> of the level of <a>play</a> we <a>expect</a> at the bare minimum . 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Nf4aM-hEzE

But this is how we think we play...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zmfd9etbXGE

We are a fun and friendly group. Any arguments over calls will be a redo.

• "Daria plays" are discouraged, but you get one freebie.

• Dancing between plays is allowed! 

• <a>Open</a> invites to drinks/ <a>lemonade</a> after the game :) Losers can drown their sorrows. 

• Sorry guys no refunds on day of cancellations!

• PLEASE LET US KNOW IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT.  Two no shows = ban for a month. 

Where is it?

Pier 25 is located by the <a>West Side Highway</a> between North Moore St. and Harrision St. It's the first Pier north of <a>Battery</a> Park City.

http://pier25.com/location/

Closest <a>subways</a> are: Canal (A, C, E), Franklin St. (1), <a>Chambers</a> on the (A,C, 2,or 3)

This week we will be <a>playing</a> at an Intermediate <a>level</a>. Bumping and setting consistently, and no carrying allowed. If you are unsure if you are at the <a>required level</a>, please <a>message</a> Joe and he will inform you if you can <a>sign up</a>. If you do sign up and are not at that level, you will be asked to sit this one out and refunded your payment. We will have an <a>open play</a> <a>meet up</a> again next week. Thanks!

results.description:
No meeting this week due to the Labor Day weekend. But we will be back Sunday, Sept 13 - hope to meet you then.

A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Updated September 5th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

FALL (Sep - Nov)

As the city cools down we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien 
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).
results.why: It's fun and you like it...
results.how_to_find_us: Look for flying discs...

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game for all levels. 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash. 

RSVP closes at 11:30AM (2 hours before the game)

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.

results.description:
Once again, participants from various meet-up events have expressed their curiosity and spirit to meet and discuss CG Jung's Red Book. In addition, am impelled to comply. Accordingly, I have arranged this Meet-up.

Here are some wonderful sites that provide an effective introduction/overview:

http://issuu.com/rmanyc/docs/redbook/1?e=1175422%2F5262897

http://gnosis.org/redbook/

http://us.theredbookprints.com/

http://philemonfoundation.org/published-works/red-book/

ATTENDEES MUST read the RED BOOK  (Liber Novus)  

Note: the new reader's edition is under $35. Or you may choose to borrow it from the KRISTINE MANN LIBRARY at the Jung Center (28 East 39th street).

The Red Book was published in 2009. Ryan and myself were fortunate to attend the Opening at the RMA. Subsequently, many meet-up members confidently decided to eagerly meet at private residents to collectively engage with the PICTORIALS ONLY. These were powerful and invaluable sessions. (~4-6 times over the next 14 months).

Approximately 2 years afterward, many of us reunited to discuss our respective engagement with the NARRATIVE (good stuff). This lasted ~9 months, in which we met for ~8-10 meet-ups.

This REVISTING of the Red Book will be our 2nd.

I hope those members whom have expressed their curiosity and spirit to meet will be able to RSVP and manage to attend. And I hope many others will join us too.

with gratitude,

Jorge
results.how_to_find_us: I usually arrive early and try to procure tables and chairs behind the GOETHE Statue. Feel free to arrive early and help me. My cell is 917 613.9736
results.name: CG Jung's RED BOOK (a particular & notable myth)

results.description:
Hi Guardians!

We are going Back to Nature!

We have been tour!

Now we are returning to The Museum of Natural History. Every Month. Same Time. Same place. Until further notice. We meet parallel to the Brights and TRU.

Our monthly Museum Walk and Talk is still the first Sunday of every month! Same time at 1pm under the lobby dinos (at or near...they did some renovations...). At 1:30 we move to the downstairs cafe to nosh and chat. Then we start exploring at 2:30. I usually have a blue New York Atheists hat on and a small brights button.

Generally, we try to keep it cheap and educational. The Museum of Natural History's admission is by donation.


Bright Cheers Evolving (BCE),
Charlie [masked], mobile)
Acting Director of The New York Brights

 

"In general people are not born stupid. True stupidity
is achieved only through great effort, such as the Creation Museum in Petersburg, KY"

-Giddian, a Brights Leader, is http://itanjo.com/... and Atheist Axioms at Cafe Press
results.why: We must track and guard against the tyranny of fanaticism.

results.description:
BWSF2015 - Basement Bar 


King P
Mana
Marc Andre
Stanford Reid

ABOUT BWSF2015:

Brooklyn Wildlife Summer Festival is an annual diverse and synergistic, indoor and outdoor festival featuring some of the best Independent talent from New York and beyond. The goal of the event is to galvanize the Indie arts and music community and represent its flourishing cultural growth within Brooklyn, with a special focus on Bushwick. BWSF2015 caters to a new youth culture that is multi-faceted, variegated, ethnically ambiguous and racially interwoven. Black, white, red, brown, gay, straight, trans - whatever color or gender… everyone parties together.

The festival is created by artists and is 100% Independent. There is no corporate sponsorship or outside funding. BWSF is unique in that it is the only festival to offer such a large and varied selection of independent artists and musicians, active within the community, gathered in one space. 

BWSF focuses on performers in the Brooklyn arts and entertainment scene and due to the large presence of international artists in Brooklyn, the festival includes performers and participants from all around the world. There will be representation from UK, Germany, Denmark, Australia, Caribbean, Jamaica, Russia and more. 

BWSF2015 SEEKS TO REACH: 
Multicultural and Multiethnic people, ages 18-80

The festival attracts individuals who:
• Are seekers, social explorers, tastemakers and enjoy being ahead of the curve.
• Believe old-fashioned business models are outdated and traditional vehicles for communication (TV and Radio) are no longer in tune with the consumer of today.
• Have turned their backs on the status quo and crave progressive thought, art and culture.
• Artists, musicians, Brooklyn and New York dwellers and everyone who is part of or who appreciated the Indie scene.
results.name: BWSF2015 @ Basement Bar

results.description:
This holiday week end let us enjoy the venue of Central Park. We can exercise, and relax and embellish the "melting pot" diversity of our wonderful city. Our "Who Are You" format will give us all the opportunity to bond and be enlightened. As we picnic, each member will be given 10 minutes to tell the group about our childhood years, from ages 1 through 12. Where you were born, how you were raised, things you enjoyed, things you did not enjoy, your neighborhood and family life, etc. whatever you want to share. I know we will be fascinated by our similarities, and our differences. 10 minutes goes by very fast so I will bring my bell to ring when a persons time is up.
At the end of the "who are you" program we will have a question and answer format. At this time we can satisfy our curiosity about something that someone said. For example: Since you were raised in Montana....did you ever see "big foot"??etc.
After our be quiet and listen program we will continue on with general socializing. I am sure that we will have lots to talk about and we will get to know each other much better as we develop our friendships.
REMEMBER TO BRING A LITTLE SOMETHING TO EAT TO SHARE. I always bring a little pillow to sit on, and I will bring a big "WHITE"  blanket that should be easy to see.
The exact spot to meet has been announced.  If we all enjoy this type of format we will have another "who are you" meetup and talk about our teen years age 12 until 20...
results.name: CENTRAL PARK HOLIDAY: "who are you" Potluck Picnic

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where fellow Python developers and learners can come and asks questions and/or code with some company! This event is free.

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. results.description:
Hi Brights, locals and visitors, out of state and international!

Also, to those who are curious about The Brights (the-brights.net) or who we are allied with. You are welcome to explore natural reality with us too!)


As Always: The Museum of Natural History. Every Month. Same Time. Same place. Until further notice.

(Please Note: To further our efforts at remembrance of those like-minded friends who have past away, we are exploring ideas to entrench and revisit their inspirations by creating a fund to set up benches, plaques, fountains and other things in our city. This will be an ongoing discussion until implemented.)


Our monthly Museum Walk and Talk is perpetually on the first Sunday of every month! Same time at 1pm under the lobby dinosaurs (at or near, in the round). At 1:30 we move to the downstairs cafe to nosh and chat. Then we start exploring at 2:30. I usually have a blue New York Atheists hat on and a small brights buttons.

Generally, we try to keep it cheap and educational. The Museum of Natural History's admission is by donation. several of us are members and therefore we take people in as guests as we can. The museum itself is by donation so it is very accessible to everyone. Never avoid coming if you feel you cannot afford it. Just let me know in confidence.


Other events are planned ad-hoc and the city and tri-state  is our oyster...

RSVPs are appreciated but not required unless specifically stated.

Bright Cheers Evolving (BCE),
Charlie [masked], mobile)
Acting Director of The New York Brights

 

"In general people are not born stupid. True stupidity
is achieved only through great effort, such as the Creation Museum in Petersburg, KY"

-Giddian, a Brights Leader, is http://itanjo.com/... and Atheist Axioms at Cafe Press
results.why: Our Bright Walk and Talks are explorations of science, culture and reality with informal chat between like-minded, respectful people.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet under the lobby dinos 1-1:30 then we will move to the lower cafe for an hour before exploring. I will have a blue New York Atheist hat on wearing various buttons and pins as well.
results.name: The New York City Brights Meetup Group Monthly Meetup

Enter at 23rd Ave and 19th St (check Google maps) and we will be straight ahead on the lawn. I will post my number the day of, but it should not be hard to find us.

I will bring my homemade macaroni salad, cups, plates, a blanket, and probably a frisbee. Please post what you will bring and feel free to bring some games or whatever you want. You may also want to bring a blanket or lawn chair.

results.description:
Welcome back everyone! Come <a>play</a> some <a>beach volleyball</a> :) <a>Games</a> will be 4x4, rotating 3 teams, rally scoring to 15. 

Things to Know: Wondering what intermediate means? <a>Simply</a> put, you know what second ball means, and you can bump, set and spike.

Over all you can receive a <a>serve</a> and get it to the setter, reliably serve  and hot the ball over the net.  

Here is a <a>video</a> of the level of <a>play</a> we <a>expect</a> at the bare minimum . 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Nf4aM-hEzE

But this is how we think we play...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zmfd9etbXGE

We are a fun and friendly group. Any arguments over calls will be a redo.

• "Daria plays" are discouraged, but you get one freebie.

• Dancing between plays is allowed! 

• <a>Open</a> invites to drinks/ <a>lemonade</a> after the game :) Losers can drown their sorrows. 

• Sorry guys no refunds on day of cancellations!

• PLEASE LET US KNOW IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT.  Two no shows = ban for a month. 

Where is it?

Pier 25 is located by the <a>West Side Highway</a> between North Moore St. and Harrision St. It's the first Pier north of <a>Battery</a> Park City.

http://pier25.com/location/

Closest <a>subways</a> are: Canal (A, C, E), Franklin St. (1), <a>Chambers</a> on the (A,C, 2,or 3)

This week we will be <a>playing</a> at an Intermediate <a>level</a>. Bumping and setting consistently, and no carrying allowed. If you are unsure if you are at the <a>required level</a>, please <a>message</a> Joe and he will inform you if you can <a>sign up</a>. If you do sign up and are not at that level, you will be asked to sit this one out and refunded your payment. We will have an <a>open play</a> <a>meet up</a> again next week. Thanks!

MANIFEST YOUR REALITY FALL PLANNING & GET-TOGETHER MEETUP!

This coming Sunday we'll be meeting in Central Park, so come, enjoy a brief meditation for manifesting our desires, and then we'll be having an open forum to share our ideas/experiences/questions and get to know each other better!  Newcomers welcome!


Every Sunday we meet to explore the Science of How to Manifest our Reality and Cause Conscious Expansion for Ourselves and Others!


Summer is winding down and now we want to hear from YOU so we can all make some awesome plans TOGETHER for the Fall!

• What do you want to learn in regards to manifesting your desires?

• What kind of new activities would you want our group to start doing?

• What works for you, what doesn’t? 

• Need specific help in a particular area of your life?  We’re here to help!

• Or just come to listen and spend time together!

Spirituality, enlightened masters, the science of manifesting, meditation, health, wealth, relationships, or whatever is on your mind!  Let’s take this time to discuss, get to know each other better and make our group even better!

Newcomers of course are welcome!  We want to meet you and hear what your experiences and interests are!  

So see you all there!


When: Sunday, September 6, 2015

Start Time: 2pm sharp

Please be on time so we can walk to the park together!

Meeting Location: 72nd Street and Central Park West at 2pm

Please be on time because we will walk to the spot together.  

Call Elena if you get lost: (973)[masked]

IMPORTANT: Bring yoga mats or something to sit on.  

Cost: This is a free event, donations are optional and welcomed.

PLEASE RSVP SO WE KNOW YOU ARE COMING! 

Please feel free to forward to your family & friends.  All are welcome!

About the Manifest Your Reality NYC Meetup Group:

Join us for powerful group meditations, mind-blowing talks and get-togethers where we will be sharing, learning and experiencing the great universal truths from Enlightened Spiritual Masters on the power of attraction, wealth creation, blissful relationships, attaining vibrant health and living a blissful life of both inner and outer fulfillment! 

We're all about creating the space for you to grow and Expand ~ Mind, Body and Spirit. Enrich yourself and others, live a truly Blissful, Happy and Abundant life, Connect with like-minded individuals on the same journey and shift from Probability to Possibility!

People from all walks of life come to our meetups, all are welcome! We can't wait to meet YOU! 

Our Meetups are free of cost, and donations are welcomed to cover space rental. 

See you at our next event!

venue.name: ‭CAP 21 Studios

results.description:
Date: Sunday, September 6, 2015

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), 5th Floor, NYC

Time: 2pm-4pm
(Please arrive 10 minutes in the lobby before 2pm meeting begins in the assigned room! Ask the Welcome Desk person for “Nick Curto's room assignment”. Try to be on time as late arrivals should be avoided if at all possible.)

Speaker: HERCULES INVICTUS

Topic(s): “Rulers of Our Solar System: Gods & Planets”

Program (live event):

The popular Stargate franchise portrayed the Olympians as either serpent-controlled System Lords or Ascended Beings with connections to lost Atlantis. Though heavily fictionalized for our entertainment, both views were also popular in antiquity and were hotly debated by the ancients, especially during the Hellenistic Era (between the reigns of Alexander the Great and Cleopatra). There is a reason why the planets still bear the names of the Greco-Roman Gods and are thought to still influence our destinies!

Bio: Hercules Invictus has been exploring the fringes of our reality throughout his entire terrestrial sojourn and has been sharing his experiences publicly for over four decades. He is proud of his Greek heritage, is an encounter prone individual, and he founded, among other things, the Regional Folklore Society of NEPA, the Center for the Study of Living Myth, and the Olympian Starseeds Initiative. For more information please visit: http://www.herculesinvictus.net

Please plan to attend what is bound to be one of the most interesting DNNY meetings to date and invite your interested friends to join us!

For questions/comments please contact: Nick Curto, DNNY Director/Co-Founder
E-mail: [masked] Phone[masked]

Meeting Details: Admission $10 per person. Children 12 and under admitted free. Our treasurer will collect your admission fee in the meeting room before the program begins.
R.S.V.P. Strongly recommended for people attending the meeting for the first time. Provide full name, e-mail address and cell phone number per person.

3 Important Notes:

1. No food or beverages are allowed in any rooms of the venue except bottled water that may be brought into the venue. You can also purchase chilled bottled water at the Welcome Desk in the Lobby for $1.
2. Please silence your cell phones when entering the meeting room.
3. No photos may be taken or sound recording is ever allowed at any of the DNNY meetings.

results.description:
"All the animals come out at night" -- and one of them is a cabby about to snap. In Martin Scorsese's classic 1970s drama, insomniac ex-Marine Travis Bickle (Robert De Niro) works the nightshift, driving his cab throughout decaying mid-'70s New York City, wishing for a "real rain" to wash the "scum" off the neon-lit streets. Chronically alone, Travis cannot connect with anyone, not even with such other cabbies as blowhard Wizard (Peter Boyle). He becomes infatuated with vapid blonde presidential campaign worker Betsy (Cybill Shepherd), who agrees to a date and then spurns Travis when he cluelessly takes her to a porno movie. After an encounter with a malevolent fare (played by Scorsese), the increasingly paranoid Travis begins to condition (and arm) himself for his imagined destiny, a mission that mutates from assassinating Betsy's candidate, Charles Palatine (Leonard Harris), to violently "saving" teen hooker Iris (Jodie Foster) from her pimp, Sport (Harvey Keitel). Travis' bloodbath turns him into a media hero; but has it truly calmed his mind? Written by Paul Schrader, Taxi Driver is an homage to and reworking of cinematic influences, a study of individual psychosis, and an acute diagnosis of the latently violent, media-fixated Vietnam era. Scorsese and Schrader structure Travis' mission to save Iris as a film noir version of John Ford's late Western The Searchers (1956), aligning Travis with a mythology of American heroism while exposing that myth's obsessively violent underpinnings. Yet Travis' military record and assassination attempt, as well as Palatine's political platitudes, also ground Taxi Driver in its historical moment of American in the 1970s. Employing such techniques as Godardian jump cuts and ellipses, expressive camera moves and angles, and garish colors, all punctuated by Bernard Herrmann's eerie final score (finished the day he died), Scorsesepresents a Manhattan skewed through Travis' point-of-view, where De Niro's now-famous "You talkin' to me" improv becomes one more sign of Travis' madness. Shot during a New York summer heat wave and garbage strike, Taxi Driver got into trouble with the MPAA for its violence. Scorsesedesaturated the color in the final shoot-out and got an R, and Taxi Driver surprised its unenthusiastic studio by becoming a box-office hit. Released in the Bicentennial year, after Vietnam, Watergate, and attention-getting attempts on President Ford's life, Taxi Driver's intense portrait of a man and a society unhinged spoke resonantly to the mid-'70s audience -- too resonantly in the case of attempted Reaganassassin and Foster fan John W. Hinckley. Taxi Driver went on to win the Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival, but it lost the Best Picture Oscar to the more comforting Rocky. Anchored by De Niro's disturbing embodiment of "God's lonely man," Taxi Driver remains a striking milestone of bothScorsese's career and 1970s Hollywood.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UUxD4-dEzn0

results.description:
DNNY Meeting Announcement

Date: Sunday, July 6, 2014

Time: 2pm-4pm (Please plan to arrive in lobby to meet us by 1:50pm. The meeting will start promptly!)

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave.) South Side of Street, Room 502, 5th Floor, NYC

Speaker: NICK CURTO

Topic: "Survival Workshop: Knowledge Is Power!"

Program (Live Event): Think about this question: What do you do when you wake up from a nights sleep and quickly find out that just over night the grid has gone down and there is no longer any electric power, the food supply in the stores is completely gone, the water stops flowing in your home pipes, the dollar looses most of its value and the banks are closed, your credit card stops working, the subways are locked down, and the bridges are all closed too? People in the streets are in panic mode and don't know what to do next and you are caught up in the terror and wonder what you should be doing now that the nightmare has really hit? If you know the answers to these questions and are prepared, you will have a much better chance to survive. If you do NOT, you're in deep, deep, deep trouble and will be coping with a situation that will be unbearable. Your worst fears are all coming true. Your very survival is at stake.

Learn the answers to these and other important questions and you will be much more likely and able to ride out the storm that is headed this way. By all reports, some or all of this description will come true, and it is not a question of IF... but a question of WHEN! The best thing to do is to take action right now!!! This workshop will guide you through what preparations are necessary to do and what to get first. How to use your money wisely to purchase the most essential items you will need right away, and where to get them. A one hour round table discussion will follow the first hour workshop. Knowledge IS power! Find out what you need to know and tell your family and friends what they need to do. It may well be one of the most important conversations that you will ever have with them.

Bio: Big Picture: Art Director/Graphic Designer, Creative Concept Designer, Think Tank Member, Futurist, Gay Rights Activist, Teacher, Truth Seeker, Paranormal Researcher, Ufologist, Spiritual Activist, Officiant, Life Coach, Writer/Composer, Playwright, Actor, Voice Over Actor, Puppeteer, Director, Many television & radio interviews. (A full bio available upon request)

Please plan to attend what is bound to be one of the most interesting DNNY meetings to date! Please invite your interested friends to join us!

Meeting Details:
Donation: $10
R.S.V.P. Recommended for people attending the meeting for the first time.

Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

The evening's focus will be on "older," "more popular" games (such as Catan, Carcassonne, Dominion, Puerto Rico, Ticket to Ride, Power Grid, etc.) so that newer players can get a solid introduction to these new styles of board games. If your image of "board game" is Sorry, Life, Backgammon, Monopoly, Risk, etc. there's a whole new, better genre waiting for you! (Veteran games and gamers still welcome, of course.)

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.

results.description:
Teams are 7v7, 90min+ game. 2 or 3 teams (depending on final numbers). We rotate every 10 min games. Arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt.


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Pass the ball have fun.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Monday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Tuesday, an email will be sent, listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance or read and mark up electronic comments.

Stories can be any length up to approx. 7,000 words. Flash fiction welcome.

You can submit your story to me (Marcy) directly, or submit to Dropbox per the Procedures (see below). My email is [masked].

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. Read through our Short Story Group Procedures for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure to make sure critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, so writers leave with a clear idea of what to do next with their stories.

We also spend time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know!

Flash pieces: If there is time (and there usually is), we can critique one or two last minute flash pieces that weren't submitted. Best method is to print out a copy for each participant. We will read the story there and give on-the-spot critiques.
results.name: Marcy's Short Story Meetup

results.description:
Hello Everyone!

ALL LEVELS WELCOME


Also check out my website www.tennis-buffs.com



Packanack Lake Tennis Club (only 20-30 min from the GWB)

9 Osborne Terrace, Wayne 07470

10 outdoor red clay and hard courts

$40 includes tennis, balls and BBQ

 

All levels welcome


IF YOU'RE SIGNING UP THROUGH MEETUP AND IT'S YOUR FIRST TIME -- YOU MUST CALL OR EMAIL ME.  I would like to stagger players to come different hours.

Spend Sunday afternoon with old and new friends playing tennis and having BBQ at Packanack Lake!  For those who haven't been to the Lake, it's like being at a resort or in your own backyard with a nice deck, overlooking clay courts.  When you are there, you will not think about anything else except fun and relaxation.  All levels are welcome.  You will play 3 hours of tennis depending on how many people sign up.  Bring your friends and families.  The More the Merrier!


 

GENERAL ANNOUNCEMENTS
RESPECT FOR SPACE WE SHARE
Please pick up after yourself when you finish eating.  It spoils the environment for everybody else while they're sitting out and socializing during their off hour, sharing the same area.  It's nice to have respect for the space we all share.  Please help me, as I'm juggling many things to create a fun evening for everyone.

BALLS ON COURT
A friendly reminder, please find the 3 balls that you played with and place them by the net for the next group of players.  Often people cannot find the balls or they are mixed in with old balls, not ones from the night's party.

HAND BALLS TO SERVER
Be considerate and wait for the server or the partner to turn around before sending balls over the net.  It's safer, saves time and just good court etiquette.

BE SUPPORTIVE OF YOUR PARTNER
Every once in a while we need to be reminded that we keep a positive attitude on the court.  People come for the enjoyment of the game and to meet other people in a social setting.  Please be a sportsman and be supportive of your partner.  It isn't fun for anyone on the court to see discontent being shown through facial expressions, body language or even scolding.  Let's keep the parties fun and enjoy the evening.

 


Look forward to meeting old and new friends at the next parties!

Thanks,
Penny Jung
Event Coordinator

results.description:
We'll be going across the George Washington Bridge and the north along the wooded cliffs above the Hudson and back.  The hike will be about 6.5 miles, and should take about 3 hours.

We will be meeting at the south west corner of 178th St and Fort Washington.  On the diagonally opposite corner is a huge bus / subway station with public restrooms available.

Crossing this bridge is very different from the Brooklyn Bridge -- the walkway is right at the edge, with nothing between you and the abyss but a waist-high railing.  So there is a much stronger feeling of the height.  Also, if your hat blows off, it will fly right over the edge.

Once across the bridge in New Jersey, we will walk north through the woods along the cliffs overlooking the river.  The last time I was there, I saw two deer.  They didn't run away, just let me walk up quite blatantly through the deep leaves to within 30 feet of them -- obviously they were quite used to people.

We'll go a mile or two along the river, there will be a convenience store and rest room, then we'll rest at the endpoint with a panoramic view and head back.

Once back in Manhattan, we'll return to the point where the hike started, then those interested will continue on another 9 blocks to an Indian restaurant for dinner.

Attendance at this event is free, and all participants attend at their own risk. Everyone will be required to sign a release waiver that basically gives up any right whatsoever to sue, to the fullest extent possible by law. You can read the current draft of this waiver at http://bluejacket7.com/legal/WalkingWaiver.doc
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at the south-west corner, and we'll probably be the only group there. I look like my picture.
results.name: 6.5 Mile George Washington Bridge Hike

results.description:
Teams are 7v7, 90min+ game. 2 or 3 teams (depending on final numbers). We rotate every 10 min games. Arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt.


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Pass the ball have fun.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Sunday Soccer 7v7 COED @3:30pm Nike Field- 75min+

venue.address_2: Coney Island Ave between Caton & Parkside Avenues
venue.name: Prospect Park Parade Grounds

results.description:
Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.name: Sunday Pick-up Parade Grounds 3:30 PM

results.description:
Multi-language picnic! PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY, READ all of description below so you're informed!  :)

We will meet BY THE BENCH at park entrance with FLAGS or a MEETUP SIGN from 3:50-4:10 PM. Please come early

We split into small groups by language. 10+ languages! beginners and native speakers welcome! Look for the sign of your language and join the group!

Language sections we have:
English - Spanish - French -Italian - Portuguese - Chinese - Japanese - Korean - Russian - German - Arabic - Hebrew 

-- This week:    ENGLISH LESSON! Sports Idioms - (Intermediate to Advanced students)

An idiom is a colorful way of saying something.  Americans love to use them, so sometimes it sounds like the conversation is about something entirely different!   In this week's lesson, we will explore sports idioms.  We'll talk about 12 different sports idioms, and then practice using them with a partner.  

Our teacher, Renee Nisivoccia, will lead the class.  See you there!  


Lesson starts at 4:45pm let us know as soon as you get if you want to take it!

--

If you would like to attend the event, you must bring either:

a) FOOD (would be great if relevant to your language but not necessary)!
b) DRINKS with plenty of disposable cups (2 large bottles at least)!
c) SUPPLIES, paper plates, napkins, forks (& knives, spoons) trash bags!

If you do not bring food you must contribute $5.


It is $1 to attend. This is a picnic! the idea is to share! Bring food, so you don't have to pay the $5!

You can either make or buy something but whatever you bring should be able to be shared with your language group. GUYS especially, you should spend at least $5 on something, it's totally not enough to just bring a bottle of water or a roll of napkins, (or 3 old bananas!), if you don't know what to bring follow the "abc" choice list above! Please be considerate to other members.

We will be mostly sitting on the grass. Bring a sheet to sit on & proper attire, forecast says 75! We will split off into small groups by language and spread out into conversational language practice groups of Spanish, English, French, Portuguese, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Hebrew, German, Arabic & Russian.

You will have option to meet us at a specific corner between 3:50 and 4:10 (20 minutes). If you're not familiar with Central Park, please be on time, and meet us at corner, otherwise it will be difficult to find us! 

IMPORTANT RULES
1. Please CHECK-IN with us as soon as you get in for a name tag. 

2. We are asking all members to spend at least 1/4 of their time HELPING out in their native language! That way we all help each other, you meet people interested in your culture and you make more friends!

3. Please CLEAN UP after yourselves! (coffee cups, papers, etc) Members who don't will be removed from our group!

4. Fee will be charged $1 for the event

5. If you bring nothing you must pay $5 to attend.

6. If you can't come to the event please update your RSVP status before it closes, so other members have the opportunity to come.

Members that RSVP yes and don't show 3 times will be removed from the group

7. If you come to this event is because you agree to our rules above. We REMOVE members that break our rules, are rude, aggressive or socially inappropriate towards our members. 

*BRINGING KIDS: Due to some experiences and comments we had in previous events. We don't encourage anyone to bring kids to the picnic. You can bring them only if:

1. They are also learning a language.

2. You will have your attention on them 100% of the time. If you just sit in your language group and let them unattended you will be removed from the group.
results.name: Language Exchange Picnic! + Language Lesson!

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  This is the first you have heard from me. I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
STARTING TIME; 4:15 PM

Wendy is a fiery Manhattan author whose husband has just left her for a younger woman; Darwan is a soft-spoken taxi driver from India on the verge of an arranged marriage. As Wendy sets out to reclaim her independence, she runs into a barrier common to many lifelong New Yorkers: she’s never learned to drive. When Wendy hires Darwan to teach her, her unraveling life and his calm restraint seem like an awkward fit. But as he shows her how to take control of the wheel, and she coaches him on how to impress a woman, their unlikely friendship awakens them to the joy, humor, and love in starting life anew.​

DINNER VILLA MILANO

Plandome Rd. [left at Andrews st, into parking lot behind restaurant]

Manhasset, NY

results.description:
A one-act play by Max Cohen that brings Samuel Beckett's famous "Waiting for Godot" into today's world, while still maintaining its original themes. The work puts into perspective the existential dillemas facing the modern man, modern New Yorker and particularly the modern millenial. It is a fresh perspective that has never been done before, the entire show taking place in a subway station.


YOU MUST PURCHASE YOUR TICKET ($12+fees) BEFORE YOU RSVP "YES" FOR THIS EVENT:

http://www.smarttix.com/show.aspx?showcode=wai288


Be sure to select the correct date (09 06)
and time (5:00 PM)

Run time: 50 minutes.  Meetup begins at 4:30pm, show begins 1/2 hour later. Please arrive on time so we can socialize and sit together!  After the play, we can venture to a nearby bar or restaurant for drinks and/or dinner, if desired.

This world premiere is part of Theater for the New City's 2015 Dream Up Festival, dedicated to new works.

More information:

<a>http://www.jsnyc.com/season/dreamup_2015/waitinft.htm</a>;
results.name: Waitin for the G (A modern take on Waiting for Godot)

results.description:
How does the quantum double slit experiment work? If you're unfamiliar, here's some background:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UMqtiFX_IQQ

(Start paying particular attention at the 4 minute mark!)

You can read more about it here: http://www.collective-evolution.com/2014/11/11/consciousness-creates-reality-physicists-admit-the-universe-is-immaterial-mental-spiritual/

As I understand it, observer effect impacts particle/wave nature of electrons. What implications does this have for our daily lives? Well, the general idea behind Consciousness Creates Reality is that you, as an individual, have the power to bring about your own reality. Above and beyond wishful thinking, the power of positive energy, and the law of attraction, Consciousness has the capacity to bring about real palpable changes within the physical world. 

How is this possible?--you might ask. I posit that the same observer effect that impacts electrons impacts other forms of matter as well. Observation essentially means looking closely, paying attention, or being AWARE. By turning your attention inward to your thoughts and emotions, you become the observer to your own life's experiments thus altering the structure of reality around you, just as observing the electrons impacts the manner in which they behave. Come and share your thoughts on the subject!


You can learn more about other phenomena which appear to be controlled via consciousness alone here: http://in5d.com/10-scientific-studies-that-prove-consciousness-can-alter-our-physical-material-world/
results.name: Let's identify how Consciousness Creates Reality

results.description:
Join us for Church of the Ascension's famous Jazz Mass and afterwards for their Community Dinner/Soda/Martini Nights.

Church of the Ascension is a welcoming catholic church with a very active LGBTQ outreach.

Every Sunday at 6pm, they have what many consider one of the most creative and spiritual weekly masses in NYC, their Jazz Mass.  For some of us, the simple soothing bossa nova tunes thoughout the mass elevate us to the arms of the "Christ the Redeemer Statue" in Rio de Janeiro, and help us to hear the homily in a whole different way. 

It is a simple jazz group made up of parishioners in a wonderfully relaxing church with a truly NYC multi-ethnic community of Straight and LGBTQ Catholics. 

Once a month (usually the first Sunday of the Month), the church and the parish community host a Community Dinner/Soda/Martini night after the 6pm Jazz Mass.  

The event is hosted by parish volunteers and the amount of your voluntary donation to help them with their costs is up to you and what you can afford to help with.

Below are two write-ups on their Jazz Mass.

<a>http://archives.jrn.columbia.edu/2010-2011/othergroundny.com//2009/11/30/after-mass-martinis-anyone/</a>;

http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLwPHVea6Obas3dYSvUnt6jYZa1Nql819R

Note: Church has AC.
results.name: Church of the Ascension: "JAZZ Mass" & Community Dinner,Martini or Seltzer Night

If you'll be spending the long weekend in town, come mix and mingle with members from more than 20 meetup groups. This year, we're taking over Tagine, a unique Moroccan bar/restaurant. This year, after the Brazilian Day in NY street festival ends, the afterparty begins at Liberty Theater nightclub in the heart of Times Square on 42nd St. Come party with two live music performances, the best DJ's and sexy samba dancers. Every year, this is the BEST Brazilian Day afterparty in NY, and this year it's even BIGGER and BETTER. So, get your discounted tickets now at <a>www.Brazilicia.com!</a> This year, we're featuring:

* OS HAWAIANOS performing LIVE, direct from Brazil!!!
* Four of the top Brazilian DJ's:
- DJ ERV MASTER (official DJ of Brazilian Day NY & Newark)
- DJ BEBEL VIANA (hottest DJ in Jersey)
- DJ FABIO SOUL (Miami's top Brazilian DJ)
- DJ ALEX CARIOCA (NYC's own, official DJ for FAROFA)
* BANDA FOURPLAY playing the best in Sertanejo and Arrocha
* A separate room with DJ BRINKA playing everything from Bachata, Hip-Hop, Salsa, House, Reggaeton and more
* SAMBA DANCERS performing

Come early as we'll have Leblon drink specials & the gorgeous Leblon girls to give you a free taste of Leblon. We'll also have food being served. And photos courtesy of BRAZUCA. Get your discounted tickets now at <a>www.Brazilicia.com.</a>

All this partying happens 1 block from the festival's main stage, on the world famous 42nd St. The Liberty Theater is a beautiful nightclub with three rooms, including the sexy Red Room overlooking the Main Room with a state of the art sound system where you'll enjoy the best in Brazilian and Dance music. results.description:
Exclusive deal: get your reduced ticket under geraldo's meetup group for only 15 dollars 

This year, after the Brazilian Day in NY street festival ends, the afterparty begins at Liberty Theater nightclub in the heart of Times Square on 42nd St. Come party with two live music performances, the best DJ's and sexy samba dancers. Every year, this is the BEST Brazilian Day afterparty in NY, and this year it's even BIGGER and BETTER. So, get your tickets now at

https://brazilian-independence-day-party-libertytheater.eventbrite.com/?access=Meetup

! This year, we're featuring:

• OS HAWAIANOS performing LIVE, direct from Brazil!!!


• Four of the top Brazilian DJ's:


- DJ ERV MASTER (official DJ of Brazilian Day NY & Newark)


- DJ BEBEL VIANA (hottest DJ in Jersey)


- DJ FABIO SOUL (Miami's top Brazilian DJ)


- DJ ALEX CARIOCA (NYC's own, official DJ for FAROFA)


• BANDA FOURPLAY playing the best in Sertanejo and Arrocha


• A separate room with DJ BRINKA playing everything from Bachata, Hip-Hop, Salsa, House, Reggaeton and more


• Our sexy SAMBA DANCERS

Come early as we'll have Leblon drink specials & the gorgeous Leblon girls to give you a free taste of Leblon. We'll also have food being served. And photos courtesy of BRAZUCA.

Get your tickets now at 

</a>

<a href="https://brazilian-independence-day-party-libertytheater.eventbrite.com/?access=Meetup">https://brazilian-independence-day-party-libertytheater.eventbrite.com/?access=Meetup

<a href="http://brazilicia.com/"></a>


All this partying happens 1 block from the festival's main stage, on the world famous 42nd St. The Liberty Theater is a beautiful nightclub with three rooms, including the sexy Red Room overlooking the Main Room with a state of the art sound system where you'll enjoy the best in Brazilian and Dance music. And the third room will have you dancing to the best in Latino music, house and hip-hop. So, come celebrate Brazilian Day at the best afterparty in NY at Liberty Theater!

For more info: 

www.Brazilicia.com
results.name: Brazilian Independence Day Afterparty at Liberty Theater Times Square

results.description:
SWINGIN' SUNDAYS - WEST COAST SWING LESSONS AND DANCE

every 1st, 3rd, & 5th Sunday

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

BEGINNER AND INTERMEDIATE LESSONS: 6:00-6:45 PM

from 9/7-12/7, the intermediate lesson will be a performance class, see details below

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

-BEGINNERS WELCOME! We have a Basic lesson to start the night and some fantastic local instructors on hand to guide you, so tell ALL your friends!

-Featuring a wonderful mix of rotating DJs.

-Low cost, high fun at a nice venue

-Only $7 before 5:15 PM for more than 4 hours of dancing fun :-)

-2 Lessons: Basic & Intermediate at 6:00 PM

-Dance Party starts at 6:45 PM and goes 'till 12:00 AM

-$7 before 5:15 PM, $12 after

***************************************************************

------IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT------From 9/7/14-12/7/14-----

In place of the intermediate class, we'll be offering an intermediate level routine and performance opportunity.

We will be teaching and cleaning the routine on 9/7, 9/21, 10/5, 10/19, 11/2, 11/16, 11/30

You will perform in the show on Sunday, December 7th.

There is NO CHARGE for the class!

All you need to do is pay for the admission to the dance and show up by 6:00 PM!

 

What YOU get out of this:

1) The opportunity to perform for a group of supportive dancers

2) The opportunity to learn, practice, and utilize skills that help you understand musicality, presentation, partnering, and phrasing.

3) A TON OF FUN

What We Need From YOU:

1) Just YOU - partner NOT required

2) The choreography will be taught over the first 5 sessions. You need to be in attendance at least 3 of the first 5 Sundays. You also need to attend the review sessions on the last two Sundays (11/16 & 11/30). So in total, of the 7 choreography sessions, you need to attend at least 5.

***************************************************************

All night drinks specials!

* $6 Sangria

* $16 1/2 Carafe of Sangria

* $5 Corona

* $2 Bottle of Water

 

LOCATION:

Dancesport

22 West 34th St, btw 5 & 6 Av

4th floor

Look forward to seeing you there!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pssssst: This dance is part of a collaboration of multiple dance styles using the same venue to offer different dance styles all at the same time. There's Bachata, Salsa, Zouk, Kizomba, and West Coast Swing all happening at the SAME place, at the SAME time, for the SAME price! So, you have the chance to check out FIVE different dances all for the price of 1!  The evening starts with a Bachata Lesson at 5:00 PM.  For More Information:  https://www.facebook.com/events/308507872585674/
results.how_to_find_us: https://www.facebook.com/events/399068243571991
results.name: Swingin' Sundays! West Coast Swing (also Zouk, Salsa, & Bachata)

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
